D'you suppose if it had n't been for that [I]69-charity 'd have kept on sitting day after day in [this old vault]1952-this old vault ? ”[69-charity] Of this appeal [[her]435-her hearer]436-her hearer took up only the last question . “ It is [an old vault]1999-an old vault ; but need it be ? That 's the point . And it 's [my]436-her hearer putting the question to [[my]436-her hearer cousin]1884-my cousin that seems to have been the cause of the trouble . ”[436-her hearer] [His]436-her hearer glance explored the melancholy penumbra of [the long narrow room]437-the long narrow room , resting on the blotched walls , the discoloured rows of books , and the stern rosewood desk surmounted by the portrait of [the young Honorius]438-the young honorius . “ Of course it 's a bad job to do anything with [a building jammed against a hill like [this ridiculous mausoleum]2002-this ridiculous mausoleum]2001-a building jammed against a hill like this ridiculous mausoleum : [you]2003-you could n't get a good draught through [it]2001-a building jammed against a hill like this ridiculous mausoleum without blowing a hole in [the mountain]231-the mountain . But it can be ventilated after a fashion , and the sun can be let in : [I]439-the architect 'll show [you]2003-you how if [you]2003-you like .... ”[439-the architect] [The architect]439-the architect 's passion for improvement had already made [him]439-the architect lose sight of [her]435-her grievance , and [he]439-the architect lifted [his]439-the architect stick instructively toward the cornice . But [her]435-her silence seemed to tell [him]439-the architect that [she]435-her took no interest in the ventilation of [the library]240-the library , and turning back to [her]435-her abruptly [he]439-the architect held out both hands . “ Look here -- [you]435-her do n't mean what [you]435-her said ? [You]435-her do n't really think [I]439-the architect 'd do anything to hurt [you]435-her ? ”[439-the architect] A new note in [his]439-the architect voice disarmed [her]435-her : [no one]1910-no one had ever spoken to [her]435-her in that tone . “ Oh , what DID [you]439-the architect do it for then ? ”[435-her] [she]435-her wailed . [He]439-the architect had [her]435-her hands in [his]439-the architect , and [she]435-her was feeling the smooth touch that [she]435-her had imagined the day before on [the hillside]275-the hillside . [He]439-the architect pressed [her]435-her hands lightly and let them go . “ Why , to make things pleasanter for [you]435-her here ; and better for the books . [I]439-the architect 'm sorry if [[my]439-the architect cousin]1884-my cousin twisted around what [I]439-the architect said . [She]1884-my cousin 's excitable , and [she]1884-my cousin lives on trifles : [I]439-the architect ought to have remembered that . Do n't punish [me]439-the architect by letting [her]1884-my cousin think [you]435-her take [her]1884-my cousin seriously . ”[439-the architect] It was wonderful to hear [him]439-the architect speak of [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard as if [she]66-miss hatchard were [a querulous baby]443-a querulous baby : in spite of [his]439-the architect shyness [he]439-the architect had the air of power that the experience of [cities]444-cities probably gave . It was the fact of having lived in [Nettleton]5-nettleton that made [lawyer Royall]69-charity , in spite of [his]439-the architect infirmities , [the strongest man in [North Dormer]1-north dormer]445-the strongest man in north dormer ; and [Charity]69-charity was sure that [this young man]446-this young man had lived in [bigger places than [Nettleton]5-nettleton]447-bigger places than nettleton . [She]69-charity felt that if [she]69-charity kept up [her]69-charity denunciatory tone [he]439-the architect would secretly class [her]69-charity with [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard ; and the thought made [her]69-charity suddenly simple . “ It do n't matter to [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard how [I]439-the architect take [her]66-miss hatchard . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall says [she]66-miss hatchard 's going to get [a trained librarian]1949-a trained librarian ; and [I]439-the architect 'd sooner resign than have [the village]148-the village say [she]66-miss hatchard sent [me]439-the architect away . ”[439-the architect] “ Naturally [you]448-you would . But [I]69-charity 'm sure [she]66-miss hatchard does n't mean to send [you]448-you away . At any rate , wo n't [you]448-you give [me]69-charity the chance to find out first and let [you]448-you know ? It will be time enough to resign if [I]69-charity 'm mistaken . ”[69-charity] [Her]69-charity pride flamed into [her]69-charity cheeks at the suggestion of [his]448-you intervening . “ [I]448-you do n't want [anybody]1939-anybody should coax [her]66-miss hatchard to keep [me]448-you if [I]448-you do n't suit . ”[448-you] [He]448-you coloured too . “ [I]448-you give [you]69-charity [my]448-you word [I]448-you wo n't do that . Only wait till tomorrow , will [you]69-charity ? ”[448-you] [He]448-you looked straight into [her]69-charity eyes with [his]448-you shy grey glance . “ [You]69-charity can trust [me]448-you , [you]69-charity know -- [you]69-charity really can . ”[448-you] All the old frozen woes seemed to melt in [her]69-charity , and [she]69-charity murmured awkwardly , looking away from [him]448-you : “ Oh , [I]69-charity 'll wait . ”[69-charity] V There had never been such a June in [Eagle County]16-eagle county . Usually it was a month of moods , with abrupt alternations of belated frost and mid - summer heat ; this year , day followed day in a sequence of temperate beauty . Every morning a breeze blew steadily from [the hills]150-the hills . Toward noon it built up great canopies of white cloud that threw a cool shadow over [fields]450-fields and [woods]178-woods ; then before sunset the clouds dissolved again , and the western light rained its unobstructed brightness on [the valley]228-the valley . On such an afternoon [Charity Royall]69-charity lay on [a ridge above [a sunlit hollow]454-a sunlit hollow]453-a ridge above a sunlit hollow , [her]69-charity face pressed to the earth and the warm currents of the grass running through [her]69-charity . Directly in [her]69-charity line of vision a blackberry branch laid its frail white flowers and blue - green leaves against the sky . Just beyond , a tuft of sweet - fern uncurled between the beaded shoots of the grass , and a small yellow butterfly vibrated over them like a fleck of sunshine . This was all [she]69-charity saw ; but [she]69-charity felt , above [her]69-charity and about [her]69-charity , the strong growth of the beeches clothing [the ridge]455-the ridge , the rounding of pale green cones on countless spruce - branches , the push of myriads of sweet - fern fronds in the cracks of the stony slope below the wood , and the crowding shoots of meadowsweet and yellow flags in [the pasture beyond]456-the pasture beyond . All this bubbling of sap and slipping of sheaths and bursting of calyxes was carried to [her]69-charity on mingled currents of fragrance . Every leaf and bud and blade seemed to contribute its exhalation to the pervading sweetness in which the pungency of pine - sap prevailed over the spice of thyme and the subtle perfume of fern , and all were merged in a moist earth - smell that was like the breath of some huge sun - warmed animal . [Charity]69-charity had lain there a long time , passive and sun - warmed as the slope on which [she]69-charity lay , when there came between [her]69-charity eyes and the dancing butterfly the sight of [a man]322-a man 's foot in a large worn boot covered with red mud . “ Oh , do n't ! ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity exclaimed , raising [herself]69-charity on [her]69-charity elbow and stretching out a warning hand . “ Do n't what ? ”[69-charity] a hoarse voice asked above [her]69-charity head . “ Do n't stamp on those bramble flowers , [you]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms dolt ! ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity retorted , springing to [her]69-charity knees . The foot paused and then descended clumsily on the frail branch , and raising [her]69-charity eyes [she]69-charity saw above [her]69-charity the bewildered face of [a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms showing through [his]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms ragged shirt . “ Do n't [you]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms ever SEE anything , [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity assailed [him]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms , as [he]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms stood before [her]69-charity with the look of [a man who has stirred up a wasp]459-a man who has stirred up a wasp 's nest . [He]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms grinned . “ [I]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms seen [you]69-charity ! That 's what [I]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms come down for . ”[458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms] “ Down from where ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity questioned , stooping to gather up the petals [his]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms foot had scattered . [He]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms jerked [his]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms thumb toward [the heights]460-the heights . “ Been cutting down trees for [Dan Targatt]95-dan targatt . ”[458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms] [Charity]69-charity sank back on [her]69-charity heels and looked at [him]458-a slouching man with a thin sunburnt beard , and white arms musingly . [She]69-charity was not in the least afraid of poor [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt , though [he]94-liff hyatt “ came from [the Mountain]8-the mountain , ”[461-some of the girls] and [some of [the girls]462-the girls]461-some of the girls ran when [they]461-some of the girls saw [him]94-liff hyatt . Among the more reasonable [he]94-liff hyatt passed for [a harmless creature]463-a harmless creature , a sort of link between the mountain and [civilized folk]464-civilized folk , who occasionally came down and did a little wood cutting for [a farmer when hands were short]465-a farmer when hands were short . Besides , [she]69-charity knew [the Mountain people]466-the mountain people would never hurt [her]69-charity : [Liff]94-liff hyatt [himself]94-liff hyatt had told [her]69-charity so once when [she]69-charity was [a little girl]467-a little girl , and had met [him]94-liff hyatt one day at the edge of [[lawyer Royall]64-mr. royall 's pasture]468-lawyer royall 's pasture . “ [They]466-the mountain people wo n't any of 'em touch [you]69-charity up there , f'ever [you]69-charity was to come up .... But [I]94-liff hyatt do n't s'pose [you]69-charity will , ”[94-liff hyatt] [he]94-liff hyatt had added philosophically , looking at [her]69-charity new shoes , and at the red ribbon that [Mrs. Royall]81-mrs. royall had tied in [her]81-mrs. royall hair . [Charity]69-charity had , in truth , never felt any desire to visit [[her]69-charity birthplace]469-her birthplace . [She]69-charity did not care to have it known that [she]69-charity was of [the Mountain]8-the mountain , and was shy of being seen in talk with [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt . But today [she]69-charity was not sorry to have [him]94-liff hyatt appear . A great many things had happened to [her]69-charity since the day when [young Lucius Harney]75-harney had entered the doors of [the Hatchard Memorial]353-the hatchard memorial , but none , perhaps , so unforeseen as the fact of [her]69-charity suddenly finding it a convenience to be on good terms with [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt . [She]69-charity continued to look up curiously at [his]94-liff hyatt freckled weather - beaten face , with feverish hollows below the cheekbones and the pale yellow eyes of a harmless animal . “ [I]69-charity wonder if [he]94-liff hyatt 's related to [me]69-charity ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity thought , with a shiver of disdain . “ Is there [any folks living in [the brown house]2010-the brown house by [the swamp]2011-the swamp]2009-any folks living in the brown house by the swamp , up under Porcupine ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity presently asked in an indifferent tone . [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt , for a while , considered [her]69-charity with surprise ; then [he]94-liff hyatt scratched [his]94-liff hyatt head and shifted [his]94-liff hyatt weight from one tattered sole to the other . “ There 's always [the same folks in [the brown house]2010-the brown house]2012-the same folks in the brown house , ”[94-liff hyatt] [he]94-liff hyatt said with [his]94-liff hyatt vague grin . “ [They]2012-the same folks in the brown house 're from up [your]69-charity way , ai n't [they]2012-the same folks in the brown house ? ”[94-liff hyatt] “ [Their]2012-the same folks in the brown house name 's the same as [mine]94-liff hyatt , ”[94-liff hyatt] [he]94-liff hyatt rejoined uncertainly . [Charity]69-charity still held [him]94-liff hyatt with resolute eyes . “ See here , [I]69-charity want to go [there]185-there some day and take [a gentleman with [me]69-charity that 's boarding with [us]2016-us]2015-a gentleman with me that 's boarding with us . [He]2015-a gentleman with me that 's boarding with us 's up in these parts drawing pictures . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity did not offer to explain this statement . It was too far beyond [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt 's limitations for the attempt to be worth making . “ [He]2015-a gentleman with me that 's boarding with us wants to see [the brown house]2010-the brown house , and go all over [it]2010-the brown house , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity pursued . [Liff]94-liff hyatt was still running [his]94-liff hyatt fingers perplexedly through [his]94-liff hyatt shock of straw - colored hair . “ Is it [a fellow from [the city]2019-the city]2018-a fellow from the city ? ”[94-liff hyatt] [he]94-liff hyatt asked . “ Yes . [He]2015-a gentleman with me that 's boarding with us draws pictures of things . [He]2015-a gentleman with me that 's boarding with us 's down there now drawing [the Bonner house]2020-the bonner house . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity pointed to a chimney just visible over [the dip of [the pasture below the wood]472-the pasture below the wood]471-the dip of the pasture below the wood . “ [The Bonner house]2020-the bonner house ? ”[94-liff hyatt] [Liff]94-liff hyatt echoed incredulously . “ Yes . [You]69-charity wo n't understand -- and it do n't matter . All [I]94-liff hyatt say is : [he]2015-a gentleman with me that 's boarding with us 's going to [the Hyatts]96-the hyatts ' in a day or two . ”[94-liff hyatt] [Liff]94-liff hyatt looked more and more perplexed . “ [Bash]97-bash hyatt is ugly sometimes in the afternoons . ”[94-liff hyatt] [She]69-charity threw [her]69-charity head back , [her]69-charity eyes full on [Hyatt]94-liff hyatt 's . “ [I]69-charity 'm coming too : [you]94-liff hyatt tell [him]2015-a gentleman with me that 's boarding with us . ”[69-charity] “ [They]96-the hyatts wo n't none of [them]96-the hyatts trouble [you]94-liff hyatt , [the Hyatts]96-the hyatts wo n't . What d'you want a take [a stranger]168-a stranger with [you]94-liff hyatt though ? ”[69-charity] “ [I]94-liff hyatt 've told [you]94-liff hyatt , have n't [I]94-liff hyatt ? [You]94-liff hyatt 've got to tell [Bash Hyatt]97-bash hyatt . ”[94-liff hyatt] [He]94-liff hyatt looked away at [the blue mountains on the horizon]473-the blue mountains on the horizon ; then [his]94-liff hyatt gaze dropped to the chimney - top below [the pasture]276-the pasture . “ [He]168-a stranger 's down there now ? ”[94-liff hyatt] “ Yes . ”[94-liff hyatt] [He]94-liff hyatt shifted [his]94-liff hyatt weight again , crossed [his]94-liff hyatt arms , and continued to survey [the distant landscape]475-the distant landscape . “ Well , so long , ”[94-liff hyatt] [he]94-liff hyatt said at last , inconclusively ; and turning away [he]94-liff hyatt shambled up [the hillside]275-the hillside . From the ledge above [her]477-her , [he]94-liff hyatt paused to call down : “ [I]94-liff hyatt would n't go there a Sunday ”[94-liff hyatt] ; then [he]94-liff hyatt clambered on till the trees closed in on [him]94-liff hyatt . Presently , from high overhead , [Charity]69-charity heard the ring of [his]94-liff hyatt axe . [She]69-charity lay on [the warm ridge]478-the warm ridge , thinking of many things that [the woodsman]479-the woodsman 's appearance had stirred up in [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity knew nothing of [her]69-charity early life , and had never felt any curiosity about it : only a sullen reluctance to explore the corner of [her]69-charity memory where certain blurred images lingered . But all that had happened to [her]69-charity within the last few weeks had stirred [her]69-charity to the sleeping depths . [She]69-charity had become absorbingly interesting to [herself]69-charity , and everything that had to do with [her]69-charity past was illuminated by this sudden curiosity . [She]69-charity hated more than ever the fact of coming from [the Mountain]8-the mountain ; but it was no longer indifferent to [her]69-charity . Everything that in any way affected [her]69-charity was alive and vivid : even the hateful things had grown interesting because they were a part of [herself]69-charity . “ [I]69-charity wonder if [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt knows who [[my]69-charity mother]2023-my mother was ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity mused ; and it filled [her]69-charity with a tremor of surprise to think that [some woman who was once young and slight , with quick motions of the blood like [hers]69-charity]480-some woman who was once young and slight , with quick motions of the blood like hers , had carried [her]69-charity in [her]69-charity breast , and watched [her]69-charity sleeping . [She]69-charity had always thought of [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother as so long dead as to be no more than [a nameless pinch of earth]482-a nameless pinch of earth ; but now it occurred to [her]69-charity that [the once - young woman]483-the once - young woman might be alive , and wrinkled and elf - locked like [the woman [she]69-charity had sometimes seen in the door of [the brown house]2010-the brown house that [Lucius Harney]75-harney wanted to draw]484-the woman she had sometimes seen in the door of the brown house that lucius harney wanted to draw . The thought brought [him]75-harney back to the central point in [her]69-charity mind , and [she]69-charity strayed away from the conjectures roused by [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt 's presence . Speculations concerning the past could not hold [her]69-charity long when the present was so rich , the future so rosy , and when [Lucius Harney]75-harney , a stone 's throw away , was bending over [his]75-harney sketch - book , frowning , calculating , measuring , and then throwing [his]75-harney head back with the sudden smile that had shed its brightness over everything . [She]69-charity scrambled to [her]69-charity feet , but as [she]69-charity did so [she]69-charity saw [him]75-harney coming up [the pasture]276-the pasture and dropped down on the grass to wait . When [he]75-harney was drawing and measuring [one of “ [[his]75-harney houses]2025-his houses]2024-one of “ his houses , ”[69-charity] as [she]69-charity called [them]487-them , [she]69-charity often strayed away by [herself]69-charity into [the woods]488-the woods or up [the hillside]275-the hillside . It was partly from shyness that [she]69-charity did so : from a sense of inadequacy that came to [her]69-charity most painfully when [[her]69-charity companion]490-her companion , absorbed in [his]75-harney job , forgot [her]69-charity ignorance and [her]69-charity inability to follow [his]75-harney least allusion , and plunged into a monologue on art and life . To avoid the awkwardness of listening with a blank face , and also to escape the surprised stare of the inhabitants of the houses before which [he]75-harney would abruptly pull up [their]491-their horse and open [his]75-harney sketch - book , [she]69-charity slipped away to some spot from which , without being seen , [she]69-charity could watch [him]75-harney at work , or at least look down on [the house [he]75-harney was drawing]492-the house he was drawing . [She]69-charity had not been displeased , at first , to have it known to [North Dormer]1-north dormer and [the neighborhood]493-the neighborhood that [she]69-charity was driving [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's cousin]255-miss hatchard 's cousin about [the country in [the buggy [he]75-harney had hired of [lawyer Royall]64-mr. royall]496-the buggy he had hired of lawyer royall]495-the country in the buggy he had hired of lawyer royall . [She]69-charity had always kept to [herself]69-charity , contemptuously aloof from village love - making , without exactly knowing whether [her]69-charity fierce pride was due to the sense of [her]69-charity tainted origin , or whether [she]69-charity was reserving [herself]69-charity for a more brilliant fate . Sometimes [she]69-charity envied [the other girls]497-the other girls [their]497-the other girls sentimental preoccupations , [their]497-the other girls long hours of inarticulate philandering with [one of [the few youths who still lingered in [the village]148-the village]499-the few youths who still lingered in the village]498-one of the few youths who still lingered in the village ; but when [she]69-charity pictured [herself]69-charity curling [her]69-charity hair or putting a new ribbon on [her]69-charity hat for [Ben Fry]78-ben fry or [one of [the Sollas boys]502-the sollas boys]501-one of the sollas boys the fever dropped and [she]69-charity relapsed into indifference . Now [she]69-charity knew the meaning of [her]69-charity disdains and reluctances . [She]69-charity had learned what [she]69-charity was worth when [Lucius Harney]75-harney , looking at [her]69-charity for the first time , had lost the thread of [his]75-harney speech , and leaned reddening on the edge of [her]69-charity desk . But another kind of shyness had been born in [her]69-charity : a terror of exposing to vulgar perils the sacred treasure of [her]69-charity happiness . [She]69-charity was not sorry to have [the neighbors]503-the neighbors suspect [her]69-charity of “ going with ”[69-charity] [a young man from [the city]2019-the city]504-a young man from the city ; but [she]69-charity did not want it known to all [the countryside]506-the countryside how many hours of the long June days [she]69-charity spent with [him]504-a young man from the city . What [she]69-charity most feared was that the inevitable comments should reach [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall . [Charity]69-charity was instinctively aware that few things concerning [her]69-charity escaped the eyes of [the silent man under whose roof [she]69-charity lived]507-the silent man under whose roof she lived ; and in spite of the latitude which [North Dormer]1-north dormer accorded to courting [couples]508-couples [she]69-charity had always felt that , on the day when [she]69-charity showed too open a preference , [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall might , as [she]69-charity phrased it , make [her]69-charity “ pay for it . ”[69-charity] How , [she]69-charity did not know ; and [her]69-charity fear was the greater because it was undefinable . If [she]69-charity had been accepting the attentions of [one of [the village youths]510-the village youths]509-one of the village youths [she]69-charity would have been less apprehensive : [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall could not prevent [her]69-charity marrying when [she]69-charity chose to . But [everybody]306-everybody knew that “ going with [a city fellow]2026-a city fellow ”[64-mr. royall] was a different and less straightforward affair : almost [every village]512-every village could show [a victim of the perilous venture]513-a victim of the perilous venture . And [her]69-charity dread of [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's intervention gave a sharpened joy to the hours [she]69-charity spent with [young Harney]75-harney , and made [her]69-charity , at the same time , shy of being too generally seen with [him]75-harney . As [he]75-harney approached [she]69-charity rose to [her]69-charity knees , stretching [her]69-charity arms above [her]69-charity head with the indolent gesture that was [her]69-charity way of expressing a profound well - being . “ [I]69-charity 'm going to take [you]75-harney to [that house up under Porcupine]2027-that house up under porcupine , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity announced . “ [What house]2028-what house ? But [the people]2034-the people were [a sulky - looking lot]2035-a sulky - looking lot -- do [you]75-harney suppose [they]2034-the people 'll let [us]2036-us in ? ”[69-charity] “ [They]2034-the people 'll do whatever [I]69-charity tell [them]2034-the people , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said with assurance . [He]514-he threw [himself]514-he down beside [her]69-charity . “ Will [they]2034-the people ? ”[514-he] [he]514-he rejoined with a smile . “ Well , [I]514-he should like to see what 's left inside [the house]171-the house . And [I]514-he should like to have a talk with [the people]2034-the people . What else did [he]514-he know about it , and about [her]69-charity relation to it ? [Her]69-charity heart began to beat with the fierce impulse of resistance which [she]69-charity instinctively opposed to every imagined slight . “ [The Mountain]8-the mountain ? [I]69-charity ai n't afraid of [the Mountain]8-the mountain ! ”[69-charity] [Her]69-charity tone of defiance seemed to escape [him]514-he . [He]514-he lay breast - down on the grass , breaking off sprigs of thyme and pressing them against [his]514-he lips . Far off , above [the folds of [the nearer hills]518-the nearer hills]517-the folds of the nearer hills , [the Mountain]8-the mountain thrust itself up menacingly against a yellow sunset . “ [I]514-he must go up [there]185-there some day : [I]514-he want to see it , ”[514-he] [he]514-he continued . [Her]69-charity heart - beats slackened and [she]69-charity turned again to examine [his]514-he profile . It was innocent of all unfriendly intention . “ What 'd [you]514-he want to go up [the Mountain]8-the mountain for ? ”[514-he] “ Why , it must be rather a curious place . It struck [her]69-charity now as strange that [she]69-charity knew so little about [the Mountain]8-the mountain . [She]69-charity had never asked , and [no one]1910-no one had ever offered to enlighten [her]69-charity . [North Dormer]1-north dormer took [the Mountain]231-the mountain for granted , and implied its disparagement by an intonation rather than by explicit criticism . “ It 's queer , [you]69-charity know , ”[514-he] [he]514-he continued , “ that , just over there , on top of [that hill]2045-that hill , there should be [a handful of people who do n't give a damn for [anybody]1939-anybody]2046-a handful of people who do n't give a damn for anybody . ”[514-he] The words thrilled [her]69-charity . Where are [you]69-charity going to take [me]521-he tomorrow ? ”[521-he] VI That evening after supper [Charity]69-charity sat alone in [the kitchen]330-the kitchen and listened to [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall and [young Harney]75-harney talking in [the porch]320-the porch . [She]69-charity had remained indoors after the table had been cleared and [old Verena]87-verena had hobbled up to bed . The kitchen window was open , and [Charity]69-charity seated [herself]69-charity near it , [her]69-charity idle hands on [her]69-charity knee . The evening was cool and still . Beyond [the black hills an amber west]525-the black hills an amber west passed into pale green , and then to a deep blue in which a great star hung . The soft hoot of a little owl came through the dusk , and between its calls [the men]526-the men 's voices rose and fell . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's was full of a sonorous satisfaction . It was a long time since [he]64-mr. royall had had anyone of [Lucius Harney]75-harney 's quality to talk to : [Charity]69-charity divined that [the young man]173-the young man symbolized all [his]173-the young man ruined and unforgotten past . When [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard had been called to [Springfield]2-springfield by the illness of [a widowed sister]528-a widowed sister , and [young Harney]75-harney , by that time seriously embarked on [his]75-harney task of drawing and measuring [all the old houses between [Nettleton]5-nettleton and the [New Hampshire]23-new hampshire border]529-all the old houses between nettleton and the new hampshire border , had suggested the possibility of boarding at [the red house]357-the red house in [[his]75-harney cousin]531-his cousin 's absence , [Charity]69-charity had trembled lest [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall should refuse . There had been no question of lodging [the young man]173-the young man : there was no room for [him]173-the young man . But it appeared that [he]173-the young man could still live at [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's if [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall would let [him]173-the young man take [his]173-the young man meals at [the red house]357-the red house ; and after a day 's deliberation [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall consented . [Charity]69-charity suspected [him]64-mr. royall of being glad of the chance to make a little money . [He]64-mr. royall had the reputation of being [an avaricious man]534-an avaricious man ; but [she]69-charity was beginning to think [he]64-mr. royall was probably poorer than [people]338-people knew . [His]64-mr. royall practice had become little more than a vague legend , revived only at lengthening intervals by a summons to [Hepburn]4-hepburn or [Nettleton]5-nettleton ; and [he]64-mr. royall appeared to depend for [his]64-mr. royall living mainly on the scant produce of [[his]64-mr. royall farm]536-his farm , and on the commissions received from [the few [insurance agencies]538-insurance agencies that [he]64-mr. royall represented in [the neighbourhood]398-the neighbourhood]537-the few insurance agencies that he represented in the neighbourhood . At any rate , [he]64-mr. royall had been prompt in accepting [Harney]75-harney 's offer to hire [the buggy]540-the buggy at a dollar and a half a day ; and [his]64-mr. royall satisfaction with the bargain had manifested itself , unexpectedly enough , at the end of the first week , by [his]64-mr. royall tossing a ten - dollar bill into [Charity]69-charity 's lap as [she]69-charity sat one day retrimming [her]69-charity old hat . “ Here -- go get [yourself]69-charity a Sunday bonnet that 'll make [all the other girls]2067-all the other girls mad , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said , looking at [her]69-charity with a sheepish twinkle in [his]64-mr. royall deep - set eyes ; and [she]69-charity immediately guessed that the unwonted present -- the only gift of money [she]69-charity had ever received from [him]64-mr. royall -- represented [Harney]75-harney 's first payment . But [the young man]173-the young man 's coming had brought [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall other than pecuniary benefit . It gave [him]64-mr. royall , for the first time in years , [a man]322-a man 's companionship . [Charity]69-charity had only a dim understanding of [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian 's needs ; but [she]69-charity knew [he]64-mr. royall felt [himself]64-mr. royall above [the people among whom [he]64-mr. royall lived]544-the people among whom he lived , and [she]69-charity saw that [Lucius Harney]75-harney thought [him]64-mr. royall so . [She]69-charity was surprised to find how well [he]64-mr. royall seemed to talk now that [he]64-mr. royall had [a listener who understood [him]64-mr. royall]545-a listener who understood him ; and [she]69-charity was equally struck by [young Harney]75-harney 's friendly deference . [Their]546-they conversation was mostly about politics , and beyond [her]69-charity range ; but tonight it had a peculiar interest for [her]69-charity , for [they]546-they had begun to speak of [the Mountain]8-the mountain . [She]69-charity drew back a little , lest [they]546-they should see [she]69-charity was in hearing . “ [The Mountain]8-the mountain ? [The Mountain]8-the mountain ? ”[64-mr. royall] [she]69-charity heard [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall say . “ Why , [the Mountain]8-the mountain 's a blot -- that 's what it is , [sir]2068-sir , a blot . [That scum up there]2069-that scum up there ought to have been run in long ago -- and would have , if [the people down here]2070-the people down here had n't been clean scared of [them]2069-that scum up there . [The Mountain]8-the mountain belongs to [this township]2071-this township , and it 's [North Dormer]1-north dormer 's fault if there 's [a gang of [thieves]2073-thieves and [outlaws]2074-outlaws living over there , in sight of [us]2075-us , defying the laws of [[their]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country country]2076-their country]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country . [The only man that ever goes up]2085-the only man that ever goes up is [the minister]2086-the minister , and [he]2086-the minister goes because [they]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country send down and get [him]2086-the minister whenever there 's any of [them]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country dies . [They]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country think a lot of [Christian burial on [the Mountain]8-the mountain]2087-christian burial on the mountain -- but [I]547-i never heard of [their]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country having [the minister]2086-the minister up to marry [them]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country . And [they]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country never trouble [the Justice of the Peace]2089-the justice of the peace either . [They]2072-a gang of thieves and outlaws living over there , in sight of us , defying the laws of their country just herd together like [the heathen]2090-the heathen . ”[547-i] [He]547-i went on , explaining in somewhat technical language how [the little colony of [squatters]549-squatters]548-the little colony of squatters had contrived to keep the law at bay , and [Charity]69-charity , with burning eagerness , awaited [young Harney]75-harney 's comment ; but [the young man]173-the young man seemed more concerned to hear [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's views than to express [his]173-the young man own . “ [I]547-i suppose [you]75-harney 've never been up [there]185-there [yourself]75-harney ? ”[547-i] [he]547-i presently asked . “ Yes , [I]64-mr. royall have , ”[64-mr. royall] said [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall with a contemptuous laugh . “ [The wiseacres down here]2092-the wiseacres down here told [me]64-mr. royall [I]64-mr. royall 'd be done for before [I]64-mr. royall got back ; but [nobody]1881-nobody lifted a finger to hurt [me]64-mr. royall . And [I]64-mr. royall 'd just had [one of [[their]2092-the wiseacres down here gang]2095-their gang]2094-one of their gang sent up for seven years too . ”[64-mr. royall] “ [You]75-harney went up after that ? ”[173-the young man] “ Yes , [sir]2068-sir : right after it . [The fellow]2097-the fellow came down to [Nettleton]5-nettleton and ran amuck , the way [they]2097-the fellow sometimes do . After [they]2097-the fellow 've done a wood - cutting job [they]2097-the fellow come down and blow the money in ; and [this man]2098-this man ended up with manslaughter . [I]551-i got [him]2098-this man convicted , though [they]2097-the fellow were scared of [the Mountain]8-the mountain even at [Nettleton]5-nettleton ; and then a queer thing happened . [The fellow]2097-the fellow sent for [me]551-i to go and see [him]2098-this man in [gaol]2100-gaol . [I]551-i went , and this is what [he]2097-the fellow says : ' [The fool that defended [me]551-i]2101-the fool that defended me is [a chicken - livered son of a -- and all the rest of it]2102-a chicken - livered son of a -- and all the rest of it , ' [he]2097-the fellow says . ' [I]551-i 've got a job to be done for [me]551-i up on [the Mountain]8-the mountain , and [you]551-i 're [the only man [I]551-i seen in [court]2104-court]2103-the only man i seen in court that looks as if [he]2097-the fellow 'd do it . ' [He]2097-the fellow told [me]551-i [he]2097-the fellow had [a child]224-a child up there -- or thought [he]2097-the fellow had -- [a little girl]467-a little girl ; and [he]2097-the fellow wanted [her]467-a little girl brought down and reared like [a Christian]2107-a christian . [I]551-i was sorry for [the fellow]2097-the fellow , so [I]551-i went up and got [the child]2109-the child . ”[551-i] [He]551-i paused , and [Charity]69-charity listened with a throbbing heart . “ That 's the only time [I]551-i ever went up [the Mountain]231-the mountain , ”[551-i] [he]551-i concluded . There was a moment 's silence ; then [Harney]75-harney spoke . “ And [the child]2109-the child -- had [she]2109-the child [no mother]2112-no mother ? ”[75-harney] “ Oh , yes : there was [a mother]2113-a mother . But [she]2113-a mother was glad enough to have [her]2113-a mother go . [She]2113-a mother 'd have given [her]2113-a mother to [anybody]1939-anybody . [They]1939-anybody ai n't half human up there . [I]75-harney guess [the mother]2115-the mother 's dead by now , with the life [she]2115-the mother was leading . Anyhow , [I]75-harney 've never heard of [her]2115-the mother from that day to this . ”[75-harney] “ [[My]75-harney God]2116-my god , how ghastly , ”[75-harney] [Harney]75-harney murmured ; and [Charity]69-charity , choking with humiliation , sprang to [her]69-charity feet and ran [upstairs]424-upstairs . [She]69-charity knew at last : knew that [she]69-charity was [the child of [a drunken convict]554-a drunken convict]553-the child of a drunken convict and of [a mother who was n't “ half human , ”]2117-a mother who was n't “ half human , ”[2117-a mother who was n't “ half human , ”] and was glad to have [her]69-charity go ; and [she]69-charity had heard this history of [her]69-charity origin related to [the one being in whose eyes [she]69-charity longed to appear superior to [the people about [her]69-charity]556-the people about her]555-the one being in whose eyes she longed to appear superior to the people about her ! [She]69-charity had noticed that [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had not named [her]69-charity , had even avoided any allusion that might identify [her]69-charity with [the child [he]64-mr. royall had brought down from [the Mountain]8-the mountain]557-the child he had brought down from the mountain ; and [she]69-charity knew it was out of regard for [her]69-charity that [he]64-mr. royall had kept silent . But of what use was [his]64-mr. royall discretion , since only that afternoon , misled by [Harney]75-harney 's interest in [the out - law colony]558-the out - law colony , [she]69-charity had boasted to [him]64-mr. royall of coming from [the Mountain]8-the mountain ? Now every word that had been spoken showed [her]69-charity how such an origin must widen the distance between [them]559-them . During [his]64-mr. royall ten days ' sojourn at [North Dormer]1-north dormer [Lucius Harney]75-harney had not spoken a word of love to [her]69-charity . [He]64-mr. royall had intervened in [her]69-charity behalf with [[his]64-mr. royall cousin]531-his cousin , and had convinced [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard of [her]69-charity merits as [a librarian]561-a librarian ; but that was a simple act of justice , since it was by [his]64-mr. royall own fault that those merits had been questioned . [He]64-mr. royall had asked [her]69-charity to drive [him]64-mr. royall about [the country]1888-the country when [he]64-mr. royall hired [lawyer Royall]64-mr. royall 's buggy to go on [his]64-mr. royall sketching expeditions ; but that too was natural enough , since [he]64-mr. royall was unfamiliar with [the region]563-the region . Lastly , when [[his]64-mr. royall cousin]531-his cousin was called to [Springfield]2-springfield , [he]64-mr. royall had begged [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall to receive [him]64-mr. royall as [a boarder]565-a boarder ; but where else in [North Dormer]1-north dormer could [he]64-mr. royall have boarded ? Not with [Carrick Fry]88-carrick fry , whose wife was paralysed , and [whose large family]566-whose large family crowded [his]64-mr. royall table to over - flowing ; not with [the Targatts]99-the targatts , who lived a mile up [the road]160-the road , nor with [poor old [Mrs. Hawes]100-mrs. hawes , who , since [[her]100-mrs. hawes eldest daughter]569-her eldest daughter had deserted [her]100-mrs. hawes , barely had the strength to cook [her]100-mrs. hawes own meals while [Ally]74-ally picked up [her]74-ally living as [a seamstress]570-a seamstress]568-poor old mrs. hawes , who , since her eldest daughter had deserted her , barely had the strength to cook her own meals while ally picked up her living as a seamstress . [[Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's]571-mr. royall 's was [the only house where [the young man]173-the young man could have been offered a decent hospitality]572-the only house where the young man could have been offered a decent hospitality . There had been nothing , therefore , in the outward course of events to raise in [Charity]69-charity 's breast the hopes with which it trembled . But beneath the visible incidents resulting from [Lucius Harney]75-harney 's arrival there ran an undercurrent as mysterious and potent as the influence that makes [the forest]574-the forest break into leaf before the ice is off the pools . The business on which [Harney]75-harney had come was authentic ; [Charity]69-charity had seen the letter from [a [New York]24-new york publisher commissioning [him]75-harney to make a study of [the eighteenth century houses in [the less familiar districts of New England]577-the less familiar districts of new england]576-the eighteenth century houses in the less familiar districts of new england]575-a new york publisher commissioning him to make a study of the eighteenth century houses in the less familiar districts of new england . But incomprehensible as the whole affair was to [her]69-charity , and hard as [she]69-charity found it to understand why [he]75-harney paused enchanted before [certain neglected and paintless houses]578-certain neglected and paintless houses , while others , refurbished and “ improved ”[69-charity] by [the local builder]579-the local builder , did not arrest a glance , [she]69-charity could not but suspect that [Eagle County]16-eagle county was less rich in architecture than [he]75-harney averred , and that the duration of [his]75-harney stay ( which [he]75-harney had fixed at a month ) was not unconnected with the look in [his]75-harney eyes when [he]75-harney had first paused before [her]69-charity in [the library]240-the library . Everything that had followed seemed to have grown out of that look : [his]75-harney way of speaking to [her]69-charity , [his]75-harney quickness in catching [her]69-charity meaning , [his]75-harney evident eagerness to prolong [their]581-them excursions and to seize on every chance of being with [her]69-charity . The signs of [his]75-harney liking were manifest enough ; but it was hard to guess how much they meant , because [his]75-harney manner was so different from anything [North Dormer]1-north dormer had ever shown [her]69-charity . [He]75-harney was at once simpler and more deferential than [any one [she]69-charity had known]582-any one she had known ; and sometimes it was just when [he]75-harney was simplest that [she]69-charity most felt the distance between [them]581-them . Education and opportunity had divided [them]581-them by a width that no effort of [hers]69-charity could bridge , and even when [his]75-harney youth and [his]75-harney admiration brought [him]75-harney nearest , some chance word , some unconscious allusion , seemed to thrust [her]69-charity back across [the gulf]583-the gulf . Never had it yawned so wide as when [she]69-charity fled up to [[her]69-charity room]323-her room carrying with [her]69-charity the echo of [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's tale . [Her]69-charity first confused thought was the prayer that [she]69-charity might never see [young Harney]75-harney again . It was too bitter to picture [him]75-harney as [the detached impartial listener to such a story]585-the detached impartial listener to such a story . “ [I]69-charity wish [he]75-harney 'd go away : [I]69-charity wish [he]75-harney 'd go tomorrow , and never come back ! ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity moaned to [her]69-charity pillow ; and far into the night [she]69-charity lay there , in the disordered dress [she]69-charity had forgotten to take off , [her]69-charity whole soul a tossing misery on which [her]69-charity hopes and dreams spun about like drowning straws . Of all this tumult only a vague heart - soreness was left when [she]69-charity opened [her]69-charity eyes the next morning . [Her]69-charity first thought was of the weather , for [Harney]75-harney had asked [her]69-charity to take [him]75-harney to [the brown house under Porcupine]586-the brown house under porcupine , and then around by [Hamblin]18-hamblin ; and as the trip was a long one [they]587-they were to start at nine . The sun rose without a cloud , and earlier than usual [she]69-charity was in [the kitchen]330-the kitchen , making cheese sandwiches , decanting buttermilk into a bottle , wrapping up slices of apple pie , and accusing [Verena]87-verena of having given away a basket [she]69-charity needed , which had always hung on a hook in [the passage]368-the passage . When [she]69-charity came out into [the porch]320-the porch , in [her]69-charity pink calico , which had run a little in the washing , but was still bright enough to set off [her]69-charity dark tints , [she]69-charity had such a triumphant sense of being a part of the sunlight and the morning that the last trace of [her]69-charity misery vanished . What did it matter where [she]69-charity came from , or whose [child]591-child [she]69-charity was , when love was dancing in [her]69-charity veins , and down [the road]160-the road [she]69-charity saw [young Harney]75-harney coming toward [her]69-charity ? [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall was in [the porch]320-the porch too . [He]64-mr. royall had said nothing at breakfast , but when [she]69-charity came out in [her]69-charity pink dress , the basket in [her]69-charity hand , [he]64-mr. royall looked at [her]69-charity with surprise . “ Where [you]69-charity going to ? ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall asked . “ Why -- [Mr. Harney]76-harney 's starting earlier than usual today , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity answered . “ [Mr. Harney]76-harney , [Mr. Harney]76-harney ? Ai n't [Mr. Harney]76-harney learned how to drive [a horse]2118-a horse yet ? ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity made no answer , and [he]64-mr. royall sat tilted back in [his]64-mr. royall chair , drumming on the rail of [the porch]320-the porch . It was the first time [he]64-mr. royall had ever spoken of [the young man]173-the young man in that tone , and [Charity]69-charity felt a faint chill of apprehension . After a moment [he]64-mr. royall stood up and walked away toward the bit of ground behind [the house]171-the house , where [the hired man]597-the hired man was hoeing . The air was cool and clear , with the autumnal sparkle that a north wind brings to [the hills]150-the hills in early summer , and the night had been so still that the dew hung on everything , not as a lingering moisture , but in separate beads that glittered like diamonds on the ferns and grasses . It was a long drive to [the foot of Porcupine]599-the foot of porcupine : first across [the valley]228-the valley , with blue hills bounding [the open slopes]601-the open slopes ; then down into [the beech - woods]602-the beech - woods , following the course of [the Creston]19-creston , [a brown brook]603-a brown brook leaping over velvet ledges ; then out again onto [the farm - lands about [Creston Lake]26-creston lake]604-the farm - lands about creston lake , and gradually up [the ridges of [the Eagle Range]10-eagle range]605-the ridges of the eagle range . At last [they]606-they reached [the yoke of [the hills]150-the hills]607-the yoke of the hills , and before [them]606-they opened [another valley]609-another valley , green and wild , and beyond [it]609-another valley [more blue heights eddying away to the sky like the waves of a receding tide]610-more blue heights eddying away to the sky like the waves of a receding tide . [Harney]76-harney tied the horse to a tree - stump , and [they]606-they unpacked [their]606-they basket under an aged walnut with a riven trunk out of which bumblebees darted . The sun had grown hot , and behind [them]606-they was the noonday murmur of [the forest]574-the forest . Summer insects danced on the air , and a flock of white butterflies fanned the mobile tips of the crimson fireweed . In [the valley]228-the valley below not [a house]613-a house was visible ; it seemed as if [Charity Royall]69-charity and [young Harney]76-harney were [the only living beings in [the great hollow of earth]615-the great hollow of earth and sky]614-the only living beings in the great hollow of earth and sky . [Charity]69-charity 's spirits flagged and disquieting thoughts stole back on [her]69-charity . [Young Harney]91-young harney had grown silent , and as [he]76-harney lay beside [her]69-charity , [his]76-harney arms under [his]76-harney head , [his]76-harney eyes on the network of leaves above [him]76-harney , [she]69-charity wondered if [he]76-harney were musing on what [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had told [him]76-harney , and if it had really debased [her]69-charity in [his]76-harney thoughts . [She]69-charity wished [he]76-harney had not asked [her]69-charity to take [him]76-harney that day to [the brown house]2010-the brown house ; [she]69-charity did not want [him]76-harney to see [the people [she]69-charity came from]617-the people she came from while the story of [her]69-charity birth was fresh in [his]76-harney mind . More than once [she]69-charity had been on the point of suggesting that [they]618-they should follow [the ridge]455-the ridge and drive straight to [Hamblin]18-hamblin , where there was [a little deserted house]620-a little deserted house [he]76-harney wanted to see ; but shyness and pride held [her]69-charity back . “ [He]76-harney 'd better know what kind of [folks]1922-folks [I]69-charity belong to , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said to [herself]69-charity , with a somewhat forced defiance ; for in reality it was shame that kept [her]69-charity silent . Suddenly [she]69-charity lifted [her]69-charity hand and pointed to the sky . “ There 's a storm coming up . ”[69-charity] [He]76-harney followed [her]69-charity glance and smiled . “ Is it that scrap of cloud among the pines that frightens [you]69-charity ? ”[76-harney] “ It 's over [the Mountain]8-the mountain ; and a cloud over [the Mountain]231-the mountain always means trouble . ”[69-charity] “ Oh , [I]76-harney do n't believe half the bad things [you]76-harney all say of [the Mountain]8-the mountain ! But anyhow , [we]621-we 'll get down to [the brown house]2010-the brown house before the rain comes . ”[76-harney] [He]76-harney was not far wrong , for only a few isolated drops had fallen when [they]621-we turned into [the road under the shaggy flank of Porcupine]622-the road under the shaggy flank of porcupine , and came upon [the brown house]2010-the brown house . [It]2010-the brown house stood alone beside [a swamp bordered with alder thickets and tall bulrushes]624-a swamp bordered with alder thickets and tall bulrushes . Not [another dwelling]625-another dwelling was in sight , and it was hard to guess what motive could have actuated [the early settler who had made [[his]626-the early settler who had made his home in so unfriendly a spot home in [so unfriendly a spot]628-so unfriendly a spot]627-his home in so unfriendly a spot]626-the early settler who had made his home in so unfriendly a spot . [Charity]69-charity had picked up enough of [[her]69-charity companion]490-her companion 's erudition to understand what had attracted [him]76-harney to [the house]171-the house . [She]69-charity noticed the fan - shaped tracery of the broken light above the door , the flutings of the paintless pilasters at the corners , and the round window set in the gable ; and [she]69-charity knew that , for reasons that still escaped [her]69-charity , these were things to be admired and recorded . Still , [they]621-we had seen [other houses]631-other houses far more “ typical ”[76-harney] ( the word was [Harney]76-harney 's ) ; and as [he]76-harney threw the reins on the horse 's neck [he]76-harney said with a slight shiver of repugnance : “ [We]621-we wo n't stay long . ”[76-harney] Against the restless alders turning [their]621-we white lining to the storm [the house]171-the house looked singularly desolate . The paint was almost gone from the clap - boards , the window - panes were broken and patched with rags , and [the garden]633-the garden was a poisonous tangle of nettles , burdocks and tall swamp - weeds over which big blue - bottles hummed . At the sound of wheels [a child with a tow - head]634-a child with a tow - head and pale eyes like [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt 's peered over the fence and then slipped away behind [an out - house]635-an out - house . [Harney]76-harney jumped down and helped [Charity]69-charity out ; and as [he]76-harney did so the rain broke on [them]621-we . It came slant - wise , on a furious gale , laying shrubs and young trees flat , tearing off their leaves like an autumn storm , turning [the road]160-the road into [a river]637-a river , and making hissing pools of every hollow . Thunder rolled incessantly through the roar of the rain , and a strange glitter of light ran along the ground under the increasing blackness . “ Lucky [we]621-we 're [here]1923-here after all , ”[76-harney] [Harney]76-harney laughed . [He]76-harney fastened the horse under [a half - roofless shed]638-a half - roofless shed , and wrapping [Charity]69-charity in [his]76-harney coat ran with [her]69-charity to [the house]171-the house . [The boy]640-the boy had not reappeared , and as there was no response to [their]621-we knocks [Harney]76-harney turned the door - handle and [they]621-we went in . There were [three people in the kitchen to which the door admitted [them]621-we]641-three people in the kitchen to which the door admitted them . [An old woman]642-an old woman with a handkerchief over [her]642-an old woman head was sitting by the window . [She]642-an old woman held a sickly - looking kitten on [her]642-an old woman knees , and whenever it jumped down and tried to limp away [she]642-an old woman stooped and lifted it back without any change of [her]642-an old woman aged , unnoticing face . [Another woman]643-another woman , [the unkempt creature that [Charity]69-charity had once noticed in driving by]644-the unkempt creature that charity had once noticed in driving by , stood leaning against the window - frame and stared at [them]621-we ; and near the stove [an unshaved man in a tattered shirt]645-an unshaved man in a tattered shirt sat on a barrel asleep . [The place]154-the place was bare and miserable and the air heavy with the smell of dirt and stale tobacco . [Charity]69-charity 's heart sank . Old derided tales of [the Mountain people]466-the mountain people came back to [her]69-charity , and [the woman]648-the woman 's stare was so disconcerting , and the face of [the sleeping man]649-the sleeping man so sodden and bestial , that [her]69-charity disgust was tinged with a vague dread . [She]69-charity was not afraid for [herself]69-charity ; [she]69-charity knew [the Hyatts]96-the hyatts would not be likely to trouble [her]69-charity ; but [she]69-charity was not sure how [they]96-the hyatts would treat [a “ city fellow]2123-a “ city fellow . ”[75-harney] [Lucius Harney]75-harney would certainly have laughed at [her]69-charity fears . [He]75-harney glanced about [the room]259-the room , uttered a general “ How are [you]652-the younger woman ? ”[75-harney] to which [no one]1910-no one responded , and then asked [the younger woman]652-the younger woman if [they]653-they might take shelter till the storm was over . [She]69-charity turned [her]69-charity eyes away from [him]75-harney and looked at [Charity]69-charity . “ [You]69-charity 're [the girl from [Royall]64-mr. royall 's]2124-the girl from royall 's , ai n't [you]69-charity ? ”[69-charity] The colour rose in [Charity]69-charity 's face . “ [I]69-charity 'm [Charity Royall]69-charity , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said , as if asserting [her]69-charity right to the name in the very place where it might have been most open to question . [The woman]648-the woman did not seem to notice . “ [You]69-charity kin stay , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity merely said ; then [she]69-charity turned away and stooped over a dish in which [she]69-charity was stirring something . [Harney]75-harney and [Charity]69-charity sat down on a bench made of a board resting on two starch boxes . [They]655-they faced a door hanging on a broken hinge , and through the crack [they]655-they saw the eyes of [the tow - headed boy]656-the tow - headed boy and of [a pale little girl with a scar across [her]657-a pale little girl with a scar across her cheek cheek]657-a pale little girl with a scar across her cheek . [Charity]69-charity smiled , and signed to [the children to come in]658-the children to come in ; but as soon as [they]658-the children to come in saw [they]658-the children to come in were discovered [they]658-the children to come in slipped away on bare feet . It occurred to [her]69-charity that [they]658-the children to come in were afraid of rousing [the sleeping man]649-the sleeping man ; and probably [the woman]648-the woman shared [their]658-the children to come in fear , for [she]648-the woman moved about as noiselessly and avoided going near the stove . The rain continued to beat against [the house]171-the house , and in one or two places it sent a stream through the patched panes and ran into pools on the floor . Every now and then the kitten mewed and struggled down , and [the old woman]412-the old woman stooped and caught it , holding it tight in [her]412-the old woman bony hands ; and once or twice [the man on the barrel]663-the man on the barrel half woke , changed [his]663-the man on the barrel position and dozed again , [his]663-the man on the barrel head falling forward on [his]663-the man on the barrel hairy breast . As the minutes passed , and the rain still streamed against the windows , a loathing of [the place]154-the place and [the people]2034-the people came over [Charity]69-charity . The sight of [the weak - minded old woman]666-the weak - minded old woman , of [the cowed children]667-the cowed children , and [the ragged man]668-the ragged man sleeping off [his]663-the man on the barrel liquor , made the setting of [her]69-charity own life seem a vision of peace and plenty . [She]69-charity thought of [the kitchen at [Mr. Royall 's]64-mr. royall , with [its]669-the kitchen at mr. royall 's , with its scrubbed floor and dresser full of china scrubbed floor and dresser full of china]669-the kitchen at mr. royall 's , with its scrubbed floor and dresser full of china , and the peculiar smell of yeast and coffee and soft - soap that [she]69-charity had always hated , but that now seemed the very symbol of household order . [She]69-charity saw [[Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's room]670-mr. royall 's room , with the high - backed horsehair chair , the faded rag carpet , the row of books on a shelf , the engraving of “ The Surrender of Burgoyne ”[64-mr. royall] over the stove , and the mat with a brown and white spaniel on a moss - green border . And then [her]69-charity mind travelled to [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's house]1883-miss hatchard 's house , where all was freshness , purity and fragrance , and compared to which [the red house]357-the red house had always seemed so poor and plain . “ This is where [I]69-charity belong -- this is where [I]69-charity belong , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity kept repeating to [herself]69-charity ; but the words had no meaning for [her]69-charity . Every instinct and habit made [her]69-charity [a stranger among [these poor swamp - people living like vermin in [their]674-these poor swamp - people living like vermin in their lair lair]674-these poor swamp - people living like vermin in their lair]673-a stranger among these poor swamp - people living like vermin in their lair . With all [her]69-charity soul [she]69-charity wished [she]69-charity had not yielded to [Harney]75-harney 's curiosity , and brought [him]75-harney [there]185-there . The rain had drenched [her]69-charity , and [she]69-charity began to shiver under the thin folds of [her]69-charity dress . [The younger woman]652-the younger woman must have noticed it , for [she]652-the younger woman went out of [the room]259-the room and came back with a broken tea - cup which [she]652-the younger woman offered to [Charity]69-charity . It was half full of whiskey , and [Charity]69-charity shook [her]69-charity head ; but [Harney]75-harney took the cup and put [his]75-harney lips to it . When [he]75-harney had set it down [Charity]69-charity saw [him]75-harney feel in [his]75-harney pocket and draw out a dollar ; [he]75-harney hesitated a moment , and then put it back , and [she]69-charity guessed that [he]75-harney did not wish [her]69-charity to see [him]75-harney offering money to people [she]69-charity had spoken of as being [[her]69-charity kin]678-her kin . [The sleeping man]649-the sleeping man stirred , lifted [his]649-the sleeping man head and opened [his]649-the sleeping man eyes . [They]680-they rested vacantly for a moment on [Charity]69-charity and [Harney]75-harney , and then closed again , and [his]75-harney head drooped ; but a look of anxiety came into [the woman]648-the woman 's face . [She]648-the woman glanced out of the window and then came up to [Harney]75-harney . “ [I]648-the woman guess [you]75-harney better go along now , ”[648-the woman] [she]648-the woman said . [The young man]173-the young man understood and got to [his]173-the young man feet . “ Thank [you]648-the woman , ”[173-the young man] [he]173-the young man said , holding out [his]173-the young man hand . [She]648-the woman seemed not to notice the gesture , and turned away as [they]680-they opened the door . The rain was still coming down , but [they]680-they hardly noticed it : the pure air was like balm in [their]680-they faces . The clouds were rising and breaking , and between [their]680-they edges the light streamed down from remote blue hollows . [Harney]75-harney untied the horse , and [they]680-they drove off through the diminishing rain , which was already beaded with sunlight . For a while [Charity]69-charity was silent , and [[her]69-charity companion]490-her companion did not speak . [She]648-the woman looked timidly at [his]75-harney profile : it was graver than usual , as though [he]75-harney too were oppressed by what [they]680-they had seen . Then [she]648-the woman broke out abruptly : “ [Those people back there]2125-those people back there are [the kind of [folks]1922-folks [I]648-the woman come from]2126-the kind of folks i come from . [They]2125-those people back there may be [[my]648-the woman relations]2128-my relations , for all [I]648-the woman know . ”[648-the woman] [She]648-the woman did not want [him]75-harney to think that [she]648-the woman regretted having told [him]75-harney [her]648-the woman story . “ [Poor creatures]2129-poor creatures , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney rejoined . “ [I]648-the woman wonder why [they]2129-poor creatures came down to [that fever - hole]2130-that fever - hole . ”[648-the woman] [She]648-the woman laughed ironically . “ To better [themselves]2129-poor creatures ! It 's worse up on [the Mountain]231-the mountain . [Bash Hyatt]97-bash hyatt married [the daughter of [the farmer that used to own [the brown house]2010-the brown house]2133-the farmer that used to own the brown house]2132-the daughter of the farmer that used to own the brown house . That was [him]75-harney by the stove , [I]648-the woman suppose . ”[648-the woman] [Harney]75-harney seemed to find nothing to say and [she]648-the woman went on : “ [I]648-the woman saw [you]75-harney take out a dollar to give to [that poor woman]2135-that poor woman . Why did [you]75-harney put it back ? ”[648-the woman] [He]75-harney reddened , and leaned forward to flick a swamp - fly from the horse 's neck . “ [I]75-harney was n't sure---- ”[75-harney] “ Was it because [you]75-harney knew [they]2136-they were [[my]75-harney folks]2137-my folks , and thought [I]75-harney 'd be ashamed to see [you]75-harney give [them]2136-they money ? ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney turned to [her]648-the woman with eyes full of reproach . “ Oh , [Charity----]102-charity---- ”[75-harney] It was the first time [he]75-harney had ever called [her]648-the woman by [her]648-the woman name . [Her]648-the woman misery welled over . “ [I]648-the woman ain't -- [I]648-the woman ai n't ashamed . [They]2136-they 're [[my]648-the woman people]2138-my people , and [I]648-the woman ai n't ashamed of [them]2136-they , ”[648-the woman] [she]648-the woman sobbed . “ [[My]75-harney dear]1903-my dear ... ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney murmured , putting [his]75-harney arm about [her]648-the woman ; and [she]648-the woman leaned against [him]75-harney and wept out [her]648-the woman pain . It was too late to go around to [Hamblin]18-hamblin , and all the stars were out in a clear sky when [they]684-they reached [the North Dormer valley]685-the north dormer valley and drove up to [the red house]357-the red house . [VII]103-vii SINCE [her]648-the woman reinstatement in [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's favour [Charity]69-charity had not dared to curtail by a moment [her]648-the woman hours of attendance at [the library]240-the library . [She]69-charity even made a point of arriving before the time , and showed a laudable indignation when [the youngest Targatt girl , who had been engaged to help in the cleaning and rearranging of the books]688-the youngest targatt girl , who had been engaged to help in the cleaning and rearranging of the books , came trailing in late and neglected [her]688-the youngest targatt girl , who had been engaged to help in the cleaning and rearranging of the books task to peer through the window at [the Sollas boy]689-the sollas boy . Nevertheless , “ library days ”[69-charity] seemed more than ever irksome to [Charity]69-charity after [her]69-charity vivid hours of liberty ; and [she]69-charity would have found it hard to set a good example to [her]69-charity subordinate if [Lucius Harney]75-harney had not been commissioned , before [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's departure , to examine with [the local carpenter]690-the local carpenter the best means of ventilating the “ Memorial . ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney was careful to prosecute this inquiry on the days when [the library]240-the library was open to [the public]692-the public ; and [Charity]69-charity was therefore sure of spending part of the afternoon in [his]75-harney company . [The Targatt girl]693-the targatt girl 's presence , and the risk of being interrupted by [some passer - by]694-some passer - by suddenly smitten with a thirst for letters , restricted [their]695-their intercourse to the exchange of commonplaces ; but there was a fascination to [Charity]69-charity in the contrast between these public civilities and [their]695-their secret intimacy . The day after [their]695-their drive to [the brown house]2010-the brown house was “ library day , ”[693-the targatt girl] and [she]693-the targatt girl sat at [her]693-the targatt girl desk working at the revised catalogue , while [the Targatt girl]693-the targatt girl , one eye on the window , chanted out the titles of a pile of books . [Charity]69-charity 's thoughts were far away , in [the dismal house by [the swamp]2011-the swamp]698-the dismal house by the swamp , and under the twilight sky during the long drive [home]342-home , when [Lucius Harney]75-harney had consoled [her]69-charity with endearing words . That day , for the first time since [he]75-harney had been boarding with [them]695-their , [he]75-harney had failed to appear as usual at the midday meal . No message had come to explain [his]75-harney absence , and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , who was more than usually taciturn , had betrayed no surprise , and made no comment . In itself this indifference was not particularly significant , for [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , in common with most of [[his]64-mr. royall fellow - citizens]701-his fellow - citizens , had a way of accepting events passively , as if [he]64-mr. royall had long since come to the conclusion that [no one who lived in [North Dormer]1-north dormer]702-no one who lived in north dormer could hope to modify them . But to [Charity]69-charity , in the reaction from [her]69-charity mood of passionate exaltation , there was something disquieting in [his]75-harney silence . It was almost as if [Lucius Harney]75-harney had never had a part in [their]695-their lives : [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's imperturbable indifference seemed to relegate [him]75-harney to the domain of unreality . As [she]69-charity sat at work , [she]69-charity tried to shake off [her]69-charity disappointment at [Harney]75-harney 's non - appearing . Some trifling incident had probably kept [him]75-harney from joining [them]695-their at midday ; but [she]69-charity was sure [he]75-harney must be eager to see [her]69-charity again , and that [he]75-harney would not want to wait till [they]695-their met at supper , between [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall and [Verena]87-verena . [She]69-charity was wondering what [his]75-harney first words would be , and trying to devise a way of getting rid of [the Targatt girl]693-the targatt girl before [he]75-harney came , when [she]69-charity heard steps outside , and [he]75-harney walked up [the path]332-the path with [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles . [The clergyman from [Hepburn]4-hepburn]705-the clergyman from hepburn seldom came to [North Dormer]1-north dormer except when [he]705-the clergyman from hepburn drove over to officiate at [the old white church]706-the old white church which , by an unusual chance , happened to belong to [the Episcopal communion]707-the episcopal communion . [He]75-harney was [a brisk affable man]708-a brisk affable man , eager to make the most of the fact that a little nucleus of “ [church - people ”]2140-church - people ”[708-a brisk affable man] had survived in [the sectarian wilderness]709-the sectarian wilderness , and resolved to undermine the influence of the ginger - bread - coloured Baptist chapel at [the other end of [the village]148-the village]158-the other end of the village ; but [he]75-harney was kept busy by parochial work at [Hepburn]4-hepburn , where there were paper - mills and [saloons]712-saloons , and it was not often that [he]75-harney could spare time for [North Dormer]1-north dormer . [Charity]69-charity , who went to [the white church]206-the white church ( like [all the best people in [North Dormer]1-north dormer]714-all the best people in north dormer ) , admired [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles , and had even , during the memorable trip to [Nettleton]5-nettleton , imagined [herself]69-charity married to [a man who had such a straight nose and such a beautiful way of speaking]715-a man who had such a straight nose and such a beautiful way of speaking , and who lived in [a brown - stone rectory covered with Virginia creeper]716-a brown - stone rectory covered with virginia creeper . It had been a shock to discover that the privilege was already enjoyed by [a lady with crimped hair and a large baby]717-a lady with crimped hair and a large baby ; but the arrival of [Lucius Harney]75-harney had long since banished [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles from [Charity]69-charity 's dreams , and as [he]75-harney walked up the path at [Harney]75-harney 's side [she]69-charity saw [him]75-harney as [he]75-harney really was : [a fat middle - aged man with a baldness showing under [his]75-harney clerical hat , and spectacles on [his]75-harney Grecian nose]718-a fat middle - aged man with a baldness showing under his clerical hat , and spectacles on his grecian nose . [She]69-charity wondered what had called [him]75-harney to [North Dormer]1-north dormer on a weekday , and felt a little hurt that [Harney]75-harney should have brought [him]75-harney to [the library]240-the library . It presently appeared that [his]75-harney presence [there]185-there was due to [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard . [He]75-harney had been spending a few days at [Springfield]2-springfield , to fill [a friend]281-a friend 's pulpit , and had been consulted by [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard as to [young Harney]75-harney 's plan for ventilating the “ Memorial . ”[66-miss hatchard] To lay hands on the Hatchard ark was a grave matter , and [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard , always full of scruples about [her]66-miss hatchard scruples ( it was [Harney]75-harney 's phrase ) , wished to have [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles 's opinion before deciding . “ [I]67-mr. miles could n't , ”[67-mr. miles] [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles explained , “ quite make out from [[your]173-the young man cousin]1987-your cousin what changes [you]173-the young man wanted to make , and as [the other trustees]2142-the other trustees did not understand either [I]67-mr. miles thought [I]67-mr. miles had better drive over and take a look -- though [I]67-mr. miles 'm sure , ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles added , turning [his]67-mr. miles friendly spectacles on [the young man]173-the young man , “ that [no one]1910-no one could be more competent -- but of course [this spot]2144-this spot has its peculiar sanctity ! ”[67-mr. miles] “ [I]75-harney hope a little fresh air wo n't desecrate it , ”[75-harney] [Harney]75-harney laughingly rejoined ; and [they]723-they walked to the other end of [the library]240-the library while [he]75-harney set forth [his]75-harney idea to [the Rector]725-the rector . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles had greeted [the two girls]726-the two girls with [his]67-mr. miles usual friendliness , but [Charity]69-charity saw that [he]67-mr. miles was occupied with other things , and [she]69-charity presently became aware , by the scraps of conversation drifting over to [her]69-charity , that [he]67-mr. miles was still under the charm of [his]67-mr. miles visit to [Springfield]2-springfield , which appeared to have been full of agreeable incidents . “ Ah , [the Coopersons]104-the coopersons ... yes , [you]67-mr. miles know [them]104-the coopersons , of course , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity heard . “ [That 's a fine old house]2145-that 's a fine old house ! And [Ned Cooperson]105-ned cooperson has collected some really remarkable impressionist pictures .... ”[69-charity] The names [he]67-mr. miles cited were unknown to [Charity]69-charity . “ Yes ; yes ; [the Schaefer quartette]2146-the schaefer quartette played at [Lyric Hall]29-lyric hall on Saturday evening ; and on Monday [I]69-charity had the privilege of hearing them again at [the Towers]2147-the towers . Beautifully done ... [Bach]106-bach and [Beethoven]107-beethoven ... a lawn - party first ... [I]69-charity saw [Miss Balch]108-miss balch several times , by the way ... looking extremely handsome .... ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity dropped [her]69-charity pencil and forgot to listen to [the Targatt girl]693-the targatt girl 's sing - song . Why had [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles suddenly brought up [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch 's name ? “ Oh , really ? ”[75-harney] [she]69-charity heard [Harney]75-harney rejoin ; and , raising [his]75-harney stick , [he]75-harney pursued : “ [You]69-charity see , [my]75-harney plan is to move these shelves away , and open a round window in this wall , on the axis of the one under the pediment . ”[75-harney] “ [I]67-mr. miles suppose [she]108-miss balch 'll be coming up [here]1923-here later to stay with [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard ? ”[67-mr. miles] [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles went on , following on [his]67-mr. miles train of thought ; then , spinning about and tilting [his]67-mr. miles head back : “ Yes , yes , [I]67-mr. miles see -- [I]67-mr. miles understand : that will give a draught without materially altering the look of things . [I]67-mr. miles can see no objection . ”[67-mr. miles] The discussion went on for some minutes , and gradually [the two men]728-the two men moved back toward the desk . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles stopped again and looked thoughtfully at [Charity]69-charity . “ Are n't [you]69-charity a little pale , [[my]67-mr. miles dear]1903-my dear ? Not overworking ? [Mr. Harney]76-harney tells [me]67-mr. miles [you]69-charity and [Mamie]109-mamie are giving [the library]240-the library a thorough overhauling . ”[67-mr. miles] [He]67-mr. miles was always careful to remember [[his]67-mr. miles parishioners]729-his parishioners ' Christian names , and at the right moment [he]67-mr. miles bent [his]67-mr. miles benignant spectacles on [the Targatt girl]693-the targatt girl . Then [he]67-mr. miles turned to [Charity]69-charity . “ Do n't take things hard , [[my]67-mr. miles dear]1903-my dear ; do n't take things hard . Come down and see [Mrs. Miles]110-mrs. miles and [me]67-mr. miles some day at [Hepburn]4-hepburn , ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles said , pressing [her]69-charity hand and waving a farewell to [Mamie Targatt]109-mamie . [He]67-mr. miles went out of [the library]240-the library , and [Harney]76-harney followed [him]67-mr. miles . [Charity]69-charity thought [she]69-charity detected a look of constraint in [Harney]76-harney 's eyes . [She]69-charity fancied [he]76-harney did not want to be alone with [her]69-charity ; and with a sudden pang [she]69-charity wondered if [he]76-harney repented the tender things [he]76-harney had said to [her]69-charity the night before . [His]76-harney words had been more fraternal than lover - like ; but [she]69-charity had lost their exact sense in the caressing warmth of [his]76-harney voice . [He]76-harney had made [her]69-charity feel that the fact of [her]69-charity being [a waif from [the Mountain]8-the mountain]732-a waif from the mountain was only another reason for holding [her]69-charity close and soothing [her]69-charity with consolatory murmurs ; and when the drive was over , and [she]69-charity got out of the buggy , tired , cold , and aching with emotion , [she]69-charity stepped as if the ground were a sunlit wave and [she]69-charity the spray on its crest . Why , then , had [his]76-harney manner suddenly changed , and why did [he]76-harney leave [the library]240-the library with [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles ?
