[Her]69-charity restless imagination fastened on the name of [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch : from the moment it had been mentioned [she]69-charity fancied that [Harney]76-harney 's expression had altered . [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch at [a garden - party at [Springfield]2-springfield]734-a garden - party at springfield , looking “ extremely handsome ”[65-annabel balch] ... perhaps [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles had seen [her]65-annabel balch there at the very moment when [Charity]69-charity and [Harney]76-harney were sitting in [the Hyatts ' hovel]735-the hyatts ' hovel , between [a drunkard]736-a drunkard and [a half - witted old woman]737-a half - witted old woman ! [Charity]69-charity did not know exactly what a garden - party was , but [her]69-charity glimpse of [the flower - edged lawns of [Nettleton]5-nettleton]738-the flower - edged lawns of nettleton helped [her]69-charity to visualize the scene , and envious recollections of the “ old things ”[108-miss balch] which [Miss Balch]108-miss balch avowedly “ wore out ”[108-miss balch] when [she]108-miss balch came to [North Dormer]1-north dormer made it only too easy to picture [her]65-annabel balch in [her]65-annabel balch splendour . [Charity]69-charity understood what associations the name must have called up , and felt the uselessness of struggling against the unseen influences in [Harney]76-harney 's life . When [she]69-charity came down from [[her]69-charity room]323-her room for supper [he]76-harney was not [there]185-there ; and while [she]69-charity waited in [the porch]320-the porch [she]69-charity recalled the tone in which [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had commented the day before on [their]742-their early start . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall sat at [her]69-charity side , [his]64-mr. royall chair tilted back , [his]64-mr. royall broad black boots with side - elastics resting against the lower bar of the railings . [His]64-mr. royall rumpled grey hair stood up above [his]64-mr. royall forehead like the crest of an angry bird , and the leather - brown of [his]64-mr. royall veined cheeks was blotched with red . [Charity]69-charity knew that those red spots were the signs of a coming explosion . Suddenly [he]64-mr. royall said : “ Where 's supper ? Has [Verena Marsh]87-verena slipped up again on [her]87-verena soda - biscuits ? ”[64-mr. royall] [Charity]69-charity threw a startled glance at [him]64-mr. royall . “ [I]69-charity presume [she]87-verena 's waiting for [Mr. Harney]76-harney . ”[69-charity] “ [Mr. Harney]76-harney , is [she]87-verena ? [She]87-verena 'd better dish up , then . [He]64-mr. royall ai n't coming . ”[64-mr. royall] [He]64-mr. royall stood up , walked to the door , and called out , in the pitch necessary to penetrate [the old woman]412-the old woman 's tympanum : “ Get along with the supper , [Verena]87-verena . ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity was trembling with apprehension . Something had happened -- [she]69-charity was sure of it now -- and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall knew what it was . But not for [the world]184-the world would [she]69-charity have gratified [him]64-mr. royall by showing [her]69-charity anxiety . [She]69-charity took [her]69-charity usual place , and [he]64-mr. royall seated [himself]64-mr. royall opposite , and poured out a strong cup of tea before passing [her]69-charity the tea - pot . [Verena]87-verena brought some scrambled eggs , and [he]64-mr. royall piled [his]64-mr. royall plate with them . “ Ai n't [you]69-charity going to take any ? ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall asked . [Charity]69-charity roused [herself]69-charity and began to eat . The tone with which [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had said “ [He]64-mr. royall 's not coming ”[64-mr. royall] seemed to [her]69-charity full of an ominous satisfaction . [She]69-charity saw that [he]64-mr. royall had suddenly begun to hate [Lucius Harney]75-harney , and guessed [herself]69-charity to be the cause of this change of feeling . But [she]69-charity had no means of finding out whether some act of hostility on [his]64-mr. royall part had made [the young man]173-the young man stay away , or whether [he]64-mr. royall simply wished to avoid seeing [her]69-charity again after [their]746-their drive back from [the brown house]2010-the brown house . [She]69-charity ate [her]69-charity supper with a studied show of indifference , but [she]69-charity knew that [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall was watching [her]69-charity and that [her]69-charity agitation did not escape [him]64-mr. royall . After supper [she]69-charity went up to [[her]69-charity room]323-her room . [She]69-charity heard [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall cross [the passage]368-the passage , and presently the sounds below [her]69-charity window showed that [he]64-mr. royall had returned to [the porch]320-the porch . [She]69-charity seated [herself]69-charity on [her]69-charity bed and began to struggle against the desire to go down and ask [him]64-mr. royall what had happened . “ [I]69-charity 'd rather die than do it , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity muttered to [herself]69-charity . With a word [he]64-mr. royall could have relieved [her]69-charity uncertainty : but never would [she]69-charity gratify [him]64-mr. royall by saying it . [She]69-charity rose and leaned out of the window . The twilight had deepened into night , and [she]69-charity watched the frail curve of the young moon dropping to the edge of [the hills]150-the hills . Through the darkness [she]69-charity saw [one or two figures]752-one or two figures moving down [the road]160-the road ; but the evening was too cold for loitering , and presently the strollers disappeared . Lamps were beginning to show here and there in the windows . A bar of light brought out the whiteness of a clump of lilies in [[the Hawes]74-ally 's yard]754-the hawes 's yard : and farther down [the street]163-the street [Carrick Fry]88-carrick fry 's Rochester lamp cast its bold illumination on [the rustic flower - tub in the middle of [his]88-carrick fry grass - plot]756-the rustic flower - tub in the middle of his grass - plot . For a long time [she]69-charity continued to lean in the window . But a fever of unrest consumed [her]69-charity , and finally [she]69-charity went [downstairs]757-downstairs , took [her]69-charity hat from its hook , and swung out of [the house]171-the house . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall sat in [the porch]320-the porch , [Verena]87-verena beside [him]64-mr. royall , [her]87-verena old hands crossed on [her]87-verena patched skirt . As [Charity]69-charity went down [the steps]760-the steps [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall called after [her]69-charity : “ Where [you]69-charity going ? ”[64-mr. royall] [She]69-charity could easily have answered : “ To [Orma]77-orma fry 's , ”[69-charity] or “ Down to [the Targatts ' ”]2152-the targatts ' ”[64-mr. royall] ; and either answer might have been true , for [she]69-charity had no purpose . But [she]69-charity swept on in silence , determined not to recognize [his]64-mr. royall right to question [her]69-charity . At the gate [she]69-charity paused and looked up and down [the road]160-the road . The darkness drew [her]69-charity , and [she]69-charity thought of climbing [the hill]279-the hill and plunging into the depths of the larch - wood above [the pasture]276-the pasture . Then [she]69-charity glanced irresolutely along [the street]163-the street , and as [she]69-charity did so a gleam appeared through the spruces at [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's gate . [Lucius Harney]75-harney was [there]185-there , then -- [he]75-harney had not gone down to [Hepburn]4-hepburn with [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles , as [she]69-charity had at first imagined . But where had [he]75-harney taken [his]75-harney evening meal , and what had caused [him]75-harney to stay away from [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's ? The light was positive proof of [his]75-harney presence , for [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's servants]766-miss hatchard 's servants were away on a holiday , and [[[her]66-miss hatchard farmer]767-her farmer 's wife]768-her farmer 's wife came only in the mornings , to make [the young man]173-the young man 's bed and prepare [his]173-the young man coffee . Beside that lamp [he]173-the young man was doubtless sitting at this moment . To know the truth [Charity]69-charity had only to walk half the length of [the village]148-the village , and knock at the lighted window . [She]69-charity hesitated a minute or two longer , and then turned toward [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's]771-miss hatchard 's . [She]69-charity walked quickly , straining [her]69-charity eyes to detect [anyone who might be coming along [the street]163-the street]772-anyone who might be coming along the street ; and before reaching [the Frys]111-the frys ' [she]69-charity crossed over to avoid the light from [their]774-their window . Whenever [she]69-charity was unhappy [she]69-charity felt [herself]69-charity at bay against a pitiless world , and a kind of animal secretiveness possessed [her]69-charity . But [the street]163-the street was empty , and [she]69-charity passed unnoticed through the gate and up the path to [the house]171-the house . [Its]171-the house white front glimmered indistinctly through the trees , showing only one oblong of light on the lower floor . [She]69-charity had supposed that the lamp was in [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's sitting - room]777-miss hatchard 's sitting - room ; but [she]69-charity now saw that it shone through a window at the farther corner of [the house]171-the house . [She]69-charity did not know [the room to which this window belonged]779-the room to which this window belonged , and [she]69-charity paused under [the trees]780-the trees , checked by a sense of strangeness . Then [she]69-charity moved on , treading softly on the short grass , and keeping so close to [the house]171-the house that whoever was in [the room]259-the room , even if roused by [her]69-charity approach , would not be able to see [her]69-charity . The window opened on [a narrow verandah]783-a narrow verandah with a trellised arch . [She]69-charity leaned close to the trellis , and parting the sprays of clematis that covered it looked into a corner of [the room]259-the room . [She]69-charity saw the foot of a mahogany bed , an engraving on the wall , a wash - stand on which a towel had been tossed , and one end of the green - covered table which held the lamp . Half of the lampshade projected into [her]69-charity field of vision , and just under it two smooth sunburnt hands , [one holding a pencil and the other a ruler]785-one holding a pencil and the other a ruler , were moving to and fro over a drawing - board . [Her]69-charity heart jumped and then stood still . [He]786-he was there , a few feet away ; and while [her]69-charity soul was tossing on seas of woe [he]786-he had been quietly sitting at [his]786-he drawing - board . The sight of those two hands , moving with [their]787-their usual skill and precision , woke [her]69-charity out of [her]69-charity dream . [Her]69-charity eyes were opened to the disproportion between what [she]69-charity had felt and the cause of [her]69-charity agitation ; and [she]69-charity was turning away from the window when one hand abruptly pushed aside the drawing - board and the other flung down the pencil . [Charity]69-charity had often noticed [Harney]75-harney 's loving care of [his]75-harney drawings , and the neatness and method with which [he]75-harney carried on and concluded each task . The impatient sweeping aside of the drawing - board seemed to reveal a new mood . The gesture suggested sudden discouragement , or distaste for [his]75-harney work and [she]69-charity wondered if [he]75-harney too were agitated by secret perplexities . [Her]69-charity impulse of flight was checked ; [she]69-charity stepped up on [the verandah]788-the verandah and looked into [the room]259-the room . [Harney]75-harney had put [his]75-harney elbows on the table and was resting [his]75-harney chin on [his]75-harney locked hands . [He]75-harney had taken off [his]75-harney coat and waistcoat , and unbuttoned the low collar of [his]75-harney flannel shirt ; [she]69-charity saw the vigorous lines of [his]75-harney young throat , and the root of the muscles where they joined the chest . [He]75-harney sat staring straight ahead of [him]75-harney , a look of weariness and self - disgust on [his]75-harney face : it was almost as if [he]75-harney had been gazing at a distorted reflection of [his]75-harney own features . For a moment [Charity]69-charity looked at [him]75-harney with a kind of terror , as if [he]75-harney had been [a stranger under familiar lineaments]790-a stranger under familiar lineaments ; then [she]69-charity glanced past [him]75-harney and saw on the floor an open portmanteau half full of clothes . [She]69-charity understood that [he]75-harney was preparing to leave , and that [he]75-harney had probably decided to go without seeing [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity saw that the decision , from whatever cause it was taken , had disturbed [him]75-harney deeply ; and [she]69-charity immediately concluded that [his]75-harney change of plan was due to some surreptitious interference of [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's . All [her]69-charity old resentments and rebellions flamed up , confusedly mingled with the yearning roused by [Harney]75-harney 's nearness . Only a few hours earlier [she]69-charity had felt secure in [his]75-harney comprehending pity ; now [she]69-charity was flung back on [herself]69-charity , doubly alone after that moment of communion . [Harney]75-harney was still unaware of [her]69-charity presence . [He]75-harney sat without moving , moodily staring before [him]75-harney at the same spot in the wall - paper . [He]75-harney had not even had the energy to finish [his]75-harney packing , and [his]75-harney clothes and papers lay on the floor about [the portmanteau]791-the portmanteau . Presently [he]75-harney unlocked [his]75-harney clasped hands and stood up ; and [Charity]69-charity , drawing back hastily , sank down on the step of [the verandah]788-the verandah . The night was so dark that there was not much chance of [his]75-harney seeing [her]69-charity unless [he]75-harney opened the window and before that [she]69-charity would have time to slip away and be lost in the shadow of the trees . [He]75-harney stood for a minute or two looking around [the room]259-the room with the same expression of self - disgust , as if [he]75-harney hated [himself]75-harney and everything about [him]75-harney ; then [he]75-harney sat down again at the table , drew a few more strokes , and threw [his]75-harney pencil aside . Finally [he]75-harney walked across the floor , kicking the portmanteau out of [his]75-harney way , and lay down on the bed , folding [his]75-harney arms under [his]75-harney head , and staring up morosely at the ceiling . Just so , [Charity]69-charity had seen [him]75-harney at [her]69-charity side on the grass or the pine - needles , [his]75-harney eyes fixed on the sky , and pleasure flashing over [his]75-harney face like the flickers of sun the branches shed on it . But now the face was so changed that [she]69-charity hardly knew it ; and grief at [his]75-harney grief gathered in [her]69-charity throat , rose to [her]69-charity eyes and ran over . [She]69-charity continued to crouch on the steps , holding [her]69-charity breath and stiffening [herself]69-charity into complete immobility . One motion of [her]69-charity hand , one tap on the pane , and [she]69-charity could picture the sudden change in [his]75-harney face . In every pulse of [her]69-charity rigid body [she]69-charity was aware of the welcome [his]75-harney eyes and lips would give [her]69-charity ; but something kept [her]69-charity from moving . It was not the fear of any sanction , human or heavenly ; [she]69-charity had never in [her]69-charity life been afraid . It was simply that [she]69-charity had suddenly understood what would happen if [she]69-charity went in . It was the thing that did happen between [young men]404-young men and [girls]795-girls , and that [North Dormer]1-north dormer ignored in public and snickered over on the sly . It was what [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard was still ignorant of , but [every girl of [Charity]69-charity 's class]796-every girl of charity 's class knew about before [she]69-charity left [school]1916-school . It was what had happened to [[Ally Hawes]74-ally 's sister]798-ally hawes 's sister [Julia]112-julia , and had ended in [her]112-julia going to [Nettleton]5-nettleton , and in [people]338-people 's never mentioning [her]112-julia name . It did not , of course , always end so sensationally ; nor , perhaps , on the whole , so untragically . [Charity]69-charity had always suspected that [the shunned Julia]112-julia 's fate might have its compensations . There were others , worse endings that [the village]148-the village knew of , mean , miserable , unconfessed ; other lives that went on drearily , without visible change , in the same cramped setting of hypocrisy . But these were not the reasons that held [her]69-charity back . Since the day before , [she]69-charity had known exactly what [she]69-charity would feel if [Harney]75-harney should take [her]69-charity in [his]75-harney arms : the melting of palm into palm and mouth on mouth , and the long flame burning [her]69-charity from head to foot . But mixed with this feeling was another : the wondering pride in [his]75-harney liking for [her]69-charity , the startled softness that [his]75-harney sympathy had put into [her]69-charity heart . Sometimes , when [her]69-charity youth flushed up in [her]69-charity , [she]69-charity had imagined yielding like [other girls]801-other girls to furtive caresses in the twilight ; but [she]69-charity could not so cheapen [herself]69-charity to [Harney]75-harney . [She]69-charity did not know why [he]75-harney was going ; but since [he]75-harney was going [she]69-charity felt [she]69-charity must do nothing to deface the image of [her]69-charity that [he]75-harney carried away . If [he]75-harney wanted [her]69-charity [he]75-harney must seek [her]69-charity : [he]75-harney must not be surprised into taking [her]69-charity as [girls like [Julia Hawes]112-julia]802-girls like julia hawes were taken .... No sound came from [the sleeping village]803-the sleeping village , and in the deep darkness of [the garden]633-the garden [she]69-charity heard now and then a secret rustle of branches , as though some night - bird brushed them . Once a footfall passed the gate , and [she]69-charity shrank back into [her]69-charity corner ; but the steps died away and left a profounder quiet . [Her]69-charity eyes were still on [Harney]75-harney 's tormented face : [she]69-charity felt [she]69-charity could not move till [he]75-harney moved . But [she]69-charity was beginning to grow numb from [her]69-charity constrained position , and at times [her]69-charity thoughts were so indistinct that [she]69-charity seemed to be held there only by a vague weight of weariness . A long time passed in this strange vigil . [Harney]75-harney still lay on the bed , motionless and with fixed eyes , as though following [his]75-harney vision to its bitter end . At last [he]75-harney stirred and changed [his]75-harney attitude slightly , and [Charity]69-charity 's heart began to tremble . But [he]75-harney only flung out [his]75-harney arms and sank back into [his]75-harney former position . With a deep sigh [he]75-harney tossed the hair from [his]75-harney forehead ; then [his]75-harney whole body relaxed , [his]75-harney head turned sideways on the pillow , and [she]69-charity saw that [he]75-harney had fallen asleep . The sweet expression came back to [his]75-harney lips , and the haggardness faded from [his]75-harney face , leaving it as fresh as [a boy]805-a boy 's . [She]69-charity rose and crept away . [VIII]113-viii [SHE]69-charity had lost the sense of time , and did not know how late it was till [she]69-charity came out into [the street]163-the street and saw that all the windows were dark between [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's and [the Royall house]808-the royall house]807-miss hatchard 's and the royall house . As [she]69-charity passed from under the black pall of [the Norway spruces]30-the norway spruces [she]69-charity fancied [she]69-charity saw two figures in the shade about [the duck - pond]166-the duck - pond . [She]69-charity drew back and watched ; but nothing moved , and [she]69-charity had stared so long into [the lamp - lit room]810-the lamp - lit room that the darkness confused [her]69-charity , and [she]69-charity thought [she]69-charity must have been mistaken . [She]69-charity walked on , wondering whether [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall was still in [the porch]320-the porch . In [her]69-charity exalted mood [she]69-charity did not greatly care whether [he]64-mr. royall was waiting for [her]69-charity or not : [she]69-charity seemed to be floating high over life , on a great cloud of misery beneath which every - day realities had dwindled to mere specks in space . But [the porch]320-the porch was empty , [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's hat hung on its peg in [the passage]368-the passage , and the kitchen lamp had been left to light [her]69-charity to bed . [She]69-charity took it and went up . The morning hours of the next day dragged by without incident . [Charity]69-charity had imagined that , in some way or other , [she]69-charity would learn whether [Harney]75-harney had already left ; but [Verena]87-verena 's deafness prevented [her]69-charity being a source of news , and [no one]1910-no one came to [the house]171-the house who could bring enlightenment . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall went out early , and did not return till [Verena]87-verena had set the table for the midday meal . When [he]64-mr. royall came in [he]64-mr. royall went straight to [the kitchen]330-the kitchen and shouted to [the old woman]412-the old woman : “ Ready for dinner---- ”[64-mr. royall] then [he]64-mr. royall turned into [the dining - room]818-the dining - room , where [Charity]69-charity was already seated . [Harney]75-harney 's plate was in its usual place , but [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall offered no explanation of [his]64-mr. royall absence , and [Charity]69-charity asked none . The feverish exaltation of the night before had dropped , and [she]69-charity said to [herself]69-charity that [he]64-mr. royall had gone away , indifferently , almost callously , and that now [her]69-charity life would lapse again into the narrow rut out of which [he]64-mr. royall had lifted it . For a moment [she]69-charity was inclined to sneer at [herself]69-charity for not having used the arts that might have kept [him]64-mr. royall . [She]69-charity sat at table till the meal was over , lest [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall should remark on [her]69-charity leaving ; but when [he]64-mr. royall stood up [she]69-charity rose also , without waiting to help [Verena]87-verena . [She]69-charity had [her]69-charity foot on the stairs when [he]64-mr. royall called to [her]69-charity to come back . “ [I]64-mr. royall 've got a headache . [I]64-mr. royall 'm going up to lie down . ”[64-mr. royall] “ [I]64-mr. royall want [you]69-charity should come in here first ; [I]64-mr. royall 've got something to say to [you]69-charity . ”[64-mr. royall] [She]69-charity was sure from [his]64-mr. royall tone that in a moment [she]69-charity would learn what every nerve in [her]69-charity ached to know ; but as [she]69-charity turned back [she]69-charity made a last effort of indifference . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall stood in the middle of [the office]819-the office , [his]64-mr. royall thick eyebrows beetling , [his]64-mr. royall lower jaw trembling a little . At first [she]69-charity thought [he]64-mr. royall had been drinking ; then [she]69-charity saw that [he]64-mr. royall was sober , but stirred by a deep and stern emotion totally unlike [his]64-mr. royall usual transient angers . And suddenly [she]69-charity understood that , until then , [she]69-charity had never really noticed [him]64-mr. royall or thought about [him]64-mr. royall . Except on the occasion of [his]64-mr. royall one offense [he]64-mr. royall had been to [her]69-charity merely the person who is always there , the unquestioned central fact of life , as inevitable but as uninteresting as [North Dormer]1-north dormer itself , or any of the other conditions fate had laid on [her]69-charity . Even then [she]69-charity had regarded [him]64-mr. royall only in relation to [herself]69-charity , and had never speculated as to [his]64-mr. royall own feelings , beyond instinctively concluding that [he]64-mr. royall would not trouble [her]69-charity again in the same way . But now [she]69-charity began to wonder what [he]64-mr. royall was really like . [He]64-mr. royall had grasped the back of [his]64-mr. royall chair with both hands , and stood looking hard at [her]69-charity . At length [he]64-mr. royall said : “ [Charity]69-charity , for once let 's [you]69-charity and [me]64-mr. royall talk together like [friends]2153-friends . ”[64-mr. royall] Instantly [she]69-charity felt that something had happened , and that [he]64-mr. royall held [her]69-charity in [his]64-mr. royall hand . “ Where is [Mr. Harney]76-harney ? Why has n't [he]76-harney come back ? Have [you]64-mr. royall sent [him]76-harney away ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity broke out , without knowing what [she]69-charity was saying . The change in [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall frightened [her]69-charity . All the blood seemed to leave [his]64-mr. royall veins and against [his]64-mr. royall swarthy pallor the deep lines in [his]64-mr. royall face looked black . “ Did n't [he]76-harney have time to answer some of those questions last night ? [You]69-charity was with [him]76-harney long enough ! ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said . [Charity]69-charity stood speechless . The taunt was so unrelated to what had been happening in [her]69-charity soul that [she]69-charity hardly understood it . But the instinct of self - defense awoke in [her]69-charity . “ Who says [I]69-charity was with [him]76-harney last night ? ”[69-charity] “ [The whole place]2154-the whole place is saying it by now . ”[69-charity] “ Then it was [you]64-mr. royall that put the lie into [their]2155-their mouths.--Oh , how [I]69-charity 've always hated [you]64-mr. royall ! ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity cried . [She]69-charity had expected a retort in kind , and it startled [her]69-charity to hear [her]69-charity exclamation sounding on through silence . “ Yes , [I]64-mr. royall know , ”[64-mr. royall] [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall said slowly . “ But that ai n't going to help [us]2156-us much now . ”[64-mr. royall] “ It helps [me]64-mr. royall not to care a straw what lies [you]64-mr. royall tell about [me]64-mr. royall ! ”[64-mr. royall] “ If [they]2155-their 're lies , they 're not [my]69-charity lies : [my]69-charity Bible oath on that , [Charity]69-charity . [I]69-charity did n't know where [you]69-charity were : [I]69-charity was n't out of [this house]2157-this house last night . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity made no answer and [he]64-mr. royall went on : “ Is it a lie that [you]69-charity were seen coming out of [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's nigh onto midnight ? ”[64-mr. royall] [She]69-charity straightened [herself]69-charity with a laugh , all [her]69-charity reckless insolence recovered . “ [I]69-charity did n't look to see what time it was . ”[69-charity] “ [[You]69-charity lost girl]2158-you lost girl ... [you]69-charity ... [you]69-charity .... Oh , [my]64-mr. royall God , why did [you]69-charity tell [me]64-mr. royall ? ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall broke out , dropping into [his]64-mr. royall chair , [his]64-mr. royall head bowed down like [an old man]345-an old man 's . [Charity]69-charity 's self - possession had returned with the sense of [her]69-charity danger . “ Do [you]69-charity suppose [I]64-mr. royall 'd take the trouble to lie to [YOU]69-charity ? Who are [you]69-charity , anyhow , to ask [me]64-mr. royall where [I]64-mr. royall go to when [I]64-mr. royall go out at night ? ”[64-mr. royall] [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall lifted [his]64-mr. royall head and looked at [her]69-charity . [His]64-mr. royall face had grown quiet and almost gentle , as [she]69-charity remembered seeing it sometimes when [she]69-charity was [a little girl]467-a little girl , before [Mrs. Royall]81-mrs. royall died . “ Do n't let ['s]2159-'s go on like this , [Charity]69-charity . It ca n't do any good to [either of [us]2159-'s]2160-either of us . [You]69-charity were seen going into [[that fellow]2161-that fellow 's house]2162-that fellow 's house ... [you]69-charity were seen coming out of [it]2162-that fellow 's house .... [I]81-mrs. royall 've watched this thing coming , and [I]81-mrs. royall 've tried to stop it . As [God]114-god sees [me]81-mrs. royall , [I]81-mrs. royall have .... ”[81-mrs. royall] “ Ah , it WAS [you]81-mrs. royall , then ? [I]822-i knew it was [you]81-mrs. royall that sent [him]2161-that fellow away ! ”[822-i] [He]822-i looked at [her]81-mrs. royall in surprise . “ Did n't [he]2161-that fellow tell [you]69-charity so ? [I]822-i thought [he]2161-that fellow understood . ”[822-i] [He]822-i spoke slowly , with difficult pauses , “ [I]822-i did n't name [you]69-charity to [him]2161-that fellow : [I]822-i 'd have cut [my]822-i hand off sooner . [I]822-i just told [him]2161-that fellow [I]822-i could n't spare the horse any longer ; and that the cooking was getting too heavy for [Verena]87-verena . [I]822-i guess [he]2161-that fellow 's [the kind that 's heard the same thing before]2163-the kind that 's heard the same thing before . Anyhow , [he]2161-that fellow took it quietly enough . [He]2161-that fellow said [his]2161-that fellow job [here]1923-here was about done , anyhow ; and there did n't another word pass between [us]2165-us .... If [he]2161-that fellow told [you]69-charity otherwise [he]2161-that fellow told [you]69-charity an untruth . ”[822-i] [Charity]69-charity listened in a cold trance of anger . It was nothing to [her]69-charity what [the village]148-the village said ... but all this fingering of [her]69-charity dreams ! “ [I]822-i 've told [you]69-charity [he]2161-that fellow did n't tell [me]822-i anything . [I]822-i did n't speak with [him]2161-that fellow last night . ”[822-i] “ [You]822-i did n't speak with [him]2161-that fellow ? ”[822-i] “ No .... It 's not that [I]822-i care what any of [you]69-charity say ... but [you]69-charity may as well know . Things ai n't between [us]2165-us the way [you]69-charity think ... and [the other people in [this place]1892-this place]2166-the other people in this place . [He]2161-that fellow was kind to [me]822-i ; [he]2161-that fellow was [[my]822-i friend]2168-my friend ; and all of a sudden [he]2161-that fellow stopped coming , and [I]822-i knew it was [you]69-charity that done it -- [YOU]69-charity ! ”[822-i] All [her]824-her unreconciled memory of the past flamed out at [him]825-i . “ So [I]64-mr. royall went [there]185-there last night to find out what [you]69-charity 'd said to [him]2161-that fellow : that 's all . ”[64-mr. royall] [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall drew a heavy breath . “ But , then -- if [he]2161-that fellow was n't [there]185-there , what were [you]69-charity doing there all that time?--Charity , for pity 's sake , tell [me]64-mr. royall . [I]64-mr. royall 've got to know , to stop [their]2171-their talking . ”[64-mr. royall] This pathetic abdication of all authority over [her]824-her did not move [her]824-her : [she]824-her could feel only the outrage of [his]825-i interference . “ Ca n't [you]825-i see that [I]825-i do n't care what [anybody]1939-anybody says ? It 's true [I]825-i went [there]185-there to see [him]2161-that fellow ; and [he]2161-that fellow was in [[his]2161-that fellow room]2174-his room , and [I]825-i stood outside for ever so long and watched [him]2161-that fellow ; but [I]825-i dursn't go in for fear [he]2161-that fellow 'd think [I]825-i 'd come after [him]2161-that fellow .... ”[825-i] [She]824-her felt [her]824-her voice breaking , and gathered it up in a last defiance . “ As long as [I]824-her live [I]824-her 'll never forgive [you]64-mr. royall ! ”[824-her] [she]824-her cried . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall made no answer . [He]64-mr. royall sat and pondered with sunken head , [his]64-mr. royall veined hands clasped about the arms of [his]64-mr. royall chair . Age seemed to have come down on [him]64-mr. royall as winter comes on [the hills]150-the hills after a storm . At length [he]64-mr. royall looked up . “ [Charity]69-charity , [you]69-charity say [you]69-charity do n't care ; but [you]69-charity 're [the proudest girl [I]827-i know]2175-the proudest girl i know , and the last to want [people]338-people to talk against [you]69-charity . [You]69-charity know there 's always eyes watching [you]69-charity : [you]69-charity 're handsomer and smarter than the rest , and that 's enough . But till lately [you]69-charity 've never given [them]338-people a chance . Now [they]338-people 've got it , and [they]338-people 're going to use it . [I]827-i believe what [you]69-charity say , but [they]338-people wo n't .... It was [Mrs. Tom Fry]115-mrs. tom fry seen [you]69-charity going in ... and [two or three of [them]338-people]2177-two or three of them watched for [you]69-charity to come out again .... [You]69-charity 've been with [the fellow]2097-the fellow all day long every day since [he]2097-the fellow come here ... and [I]827-i 'm [a lawyer]2179-a lawyer , and [I]827-i know how hard slander dies . ”[827-i] [He]827-i paused , but [she]828-you stood motionless , without giving [him]827-i any sign of acquiescence or even of attention . “ [He]2097-the fellow 's [a pleasant fellow]2180-a pleasant fellow to talk to -- [I]828-you liked having [him]2097-the fellow [here]1923-here [myself]828-you . [The young men up here]2182-the young men up here ai n't had [his]2097-the fellow chances . But there 's one thing as old as [the hills]150-the hills and as plain as daylight : if [he]2097-the fellow 'd wanted [you]828-you the right way [he]2097-the fellow 'd have said so . ”[828-you] [Charity]69-charity did not speak . It seemed to [her]828-you that nothing could exceed the bitterness of hearing such words from such lips . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall rose from [his]827-i seat . “ See here , [Charity Royall]69-charity : [I]827-i had a shameful thought once , and [you]828-you 've made [me]827-i pay for it . Is n't that score pretty near wiped out ? ... There 's a streak in [me]827-i [I]827-i ai n't always master of ; but [I]827-i 've always acted straight to [you]828-you but that once . And [you]828-you 've known [I]827-i would -- [you've]828-you trusted [me]827-i . For all [your]828-you sneers and [your]828-you mockery [you]828-you 've always known [I]827-i loved [you]828-you the way [a man]322-a man loves [a decent woman]2185-a decent woman . [I]827-i 'm a good many years older than [you]828-you , but [I]827-i 'm head and shoulders above [this place]1892-this place and [everybody]306-everybody in [it]1892-this place , and [you]828-you know that too . [I]827-i slipped up once , but that 's no reason for not starting again . If [you]828-you 'll come with [me]827-i [I]827-i 'll do it . If [you]828-you 'll marry [me]827-i [we]2188-we 'll leave [here]1923-here and settle in [some big town]2190-some big town , where there 's [men]210-men , and business , and things doing . It 's not too late for [me]827-i to find an opening .... [I]827-i can see it by the way [folks]1922-folks treat [me]827-i when [I]827-i go down to [Hepburn]4-hepburn or [Nettleton]5-nettleton .... ”[827-i] [Charity]69-charity made no movement . Nothing in [his]829-he appeal reached [her]69-charity heart , and [she]69-charity thought only of words to wound and wither . But a growing lassitude restrained [her]69-charity . What did anything matter that [he]829-he was saying ? [She]69-charity saw the old life closing in on [her]69-charity , and hardly heeded [his]829-he fanciful picture of renewal . “ [Charity]69-charity -- [Charity]69-charity -- say [you]69-charity 'll do it , ”[829-he] [she]69-charity heard [him]829-he urge , all [his]829-he lost years and wasted passion in [his]829-he voice . “ Oh , what 's the use of all this ? When [I]829-he leave [here]1923-here it wo n't be with [you]69-charity . ”[829-he] [She]69-charity moved toward the door as [she]69-charity spoke , and [he]829-he stood up and placed [himself]829-he between [her]69-charity and the threshold . [He]829-he seemed suddenly tall and strong , as though the extremity of [his]829-he humiliation had given [him]829-he new vigour . “ That 's all , is it ? It 's not much . ”[829-he] [He]829-he leaned against the door , so towering and powerful that [he]829-he seemed to fill [the narrow room]830-the narrow room . “ Well , then look here .... [You]69-charity 're right : [I]829-he 've no claim on [you]69-charity -- why should [you]69-charity look at [a broken man like [me]829-he]2194-a broken man like me ? [You]69-charity want [the other fellow]2195-the other fellow ... and [I]829-he do n't blame [you]69-charity . [You]69-charity picked out the best when [you]69-charity seen it ... well , that was always [my]829-he way . ”[829-he] [He]829-he fixed [his]829-he stern eyes on [her]831-you , and [she]831-you had the sense that the struggle within [him]829-he was at its highest . “ Do [you]831-you want [him]829-he to marry [you]831-you ? ”[829-he] [he]829-he asked . [They]832-they stood and looked at [each other]328-each other for a long moment , eye to eye , with the terrible equality of courage that sometimes made [her]831-you feel as if [she]831-you had [his]829-he blood in [her]831-you veins . “ Do [you]831-you want [him]829-he to -- say ? [I]835-he 'll have [him]829-he [here]1923-here in an hour if [you]831-you do . [I]835-he ai n't been in the law thirty years for nothing . [He]829-he 's hired [[Carrick Fry]88-carrick fry 's team]2197-carrick fry 's team to take [him]829-he to [Hepburn]4-hepburn , but [he]829-he ai n't going to start for another hour . And [I]835-he can put things to [him]829-he so [he]829-he wo n't be long deciding .... [He]829-he 's soft : [I]835-he could see that . [I]835-he do n't say [you]831-you wo n't be sorry afterward -- but , by [God]114-god , [I]835-he 'll give [you]831-you the chance to be , if [you]831-you say so . ”[835-he] [She]834-she heard [him]835-he out in silence , too remote from all [he]835-he was feeling and saying for any sally of scorn to relieve [her]834-she . As [she]834-she listened , there flitted through [her]834-she mind the vision of [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt 's muddy boot coming down on the white bramble - flowers . The same thing had happened now ; something transient and exquisite had flowered in [her]834-she , and [she]834-she had stood by and seen it trampled to earth . While the thought passed through [her]834-she [she]834-she was aware of [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , still leaning against the door , but crestfallen , diminished , as though [her]834-she silence were the answer [he]835-he most dreaded . “ [I]834-she do n't want any chance [you]835-he can give [me]834-she : [I]834-she 'm glad [he]835-he 's going away , ”[834-she] [she]834-she said . [He]835-he kept [his]835-he place a moment longer , [his]835-he hand on the door - knob . “ [Charity]69-charity ! ”[835-he] [he]835-he pleaded . [She]834-she made no answer , and [he]835-he turned the knob and went out . [She]834-she heard [him]835-he fumble with the latch of the front door , and saw [him]835-he walk down the steps . [He]835-he passed out of the gate , and [his]835-he figure , stooping and heavy , receded slowly up [the street]163-the street . For a while [she]834-she remained where [he]835-he had left [her]834-she . [She]834-she was still trembling with the humiliation of [his]835-he last words , which rang so loud in [her]834-she ears that it seemed as though they must echo through [the village]148-the village , proclaiming [her]834-she a creature to lend [herself]834-she to such vile suggestions . [Her]834-she shame weighed on [her]834-she like a physical oppression : the roof and walls seemed to be closing in on [her]834-she , and [she]834-she was seized by the impulse to get away , under the open sky , where there would be room to breathe . [She]834-she went to the front door , and as [she]834-she did so [Lucius Harney]75-harney opened it . [He]75-harney looked graver and less confident than usual , and for a moment or two [neither of [them]839-them]838-neither of them spoke . Then [he]75-harney held out [his]75-harney hand . “ Are [you]834-she going out ? ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney asked . “ May [I]75-harney come in ? ”[75-harney] [Her]834-she heart was beating so violently that [she]834-she was afraid to speak , and stood looking at [him]75-harney with tear - dilated eyes ; then [she]834-she became aware of what [her]834-she silence must betray , and said quickly : “ Yes : come in . ”[834-she] [She]834-she led the way into [the dining - room]818-the dining - room , and [they]839-them sat down on opposite sides of the table , the cruet - stand and japanned bread - basket between [them]839-them . [Harney]75-harney had laid [his]75-harney straw hat on the table , and as [he]75-harney sat there , in [his]75-harney easy - looking summer clothes , a brown tie knotted under [his]75-harney flannel collar , and [his]75-harney smooth brown hair brushed back from [his]75-harney forehead , [she]834-she pictured [him]75-harney , as [she]834-she had seen [him]75-harney the night before , lying on [his]75-harney bed , with the tossed locks falling into [his]75-harney eyes , and [his]75-harney bare throat rising out of [his]75-harney unbuttoned shirt . [He]75-harney had never seemed so remote as at the moment when that vision flashed through [her]834-she mind . “ [I]75-harney 'm so sorry it 's good - bye : [I]75-harney suppose [you]75-harney know [I]75-harney 'm leaving , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney began , abruptly and awkwardly ; [she]834-she guessed that [he]75-harney was wondering how much [she]834-she knew of [his]75-harney reasons for going . “ [I]834-she presume [you]75-harney found [your]75-harney work was over quicker than what [you]75-harney expected , ”[834-she] [she]834-she said . “ Well , yes -- that is , no : there are plenty of things [I]834-she should have liked to do . But [my]834-she holiday 's limited ; and now that [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall needs the horse for [himself]64-mr. royall it 's rather difficult to find means of getting about . ”[834-she] “ There ai n't any too many teams for hire around here , ”[834-she] [she]834-she acquiesced ; and there was another silence . “ These days here have been -- awfully pleasant : [I]75-harney wanted to thank [you]834-she for making [them]2198-them so , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney continued , [his]75-harney colour rising . [She]834-she could not think of any reply , and [he]75-harney went on : “ [You]834-she 've been wonderfully kind to [me]75-harney , and [I]75-harney wanted to tell [you]834-she .... [I]75-harney wish [I]75-harney could think of [you]834-she as happier , less lonely .... Things are sure to change for [you]834-she by and by .... ”[75-harney] “ Things do n't change at [North Dormer]1-north dormer : [people]338-people just get used to [them]338-people . ”[75-harney] The answer seemed to break up the order of [his]75-harney prearranged consolations , and [he]75-harney sat looking at [her]834-she uncertainly . Then [he]75-harney said , with [his]75-harney sweet smile : “ That 's not true of [you]834-she . It ca n't be . ”[75-harney] The smile was like a knife - thrust through [her]834-she heart : everything in [her]834-she began to tremble and break loose . [She]834-she felt [her]834-she tears run over , and stood up . “ Well , good - bye , ”[834-she] [she]834-she said . [She]834-she was aware of [his]75-harney taking [her]834-she hand , and of feeling that [his]75-harney touch was lifeless . “ Good - bye . ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney turned away , and stopped on the threshold . “ [You]834-she 'll say good - bye for [me]75-harney to [Verena]87-verena ? ”[75-harney] [She]834-she heard the closing of the outer door and the sound of [his]75-harney quick tread along [the path]332-the path . The latch of the gate clicked after [him]75-harney . The next morning when [she]834-she arose in the cold dawn and opened [her]834-she shutters [she]834-she saw [a freckled boy]842-a freckled boy standing on the other side of [the road]160-the road and looking up at [her]834-she . [He]842-a freckled boy was [a boy from [a farm three or four miles down [the Creston road]846-the creston road]845-a farm three or four miles down the creston road]844-a boy from a farm three or four miles down the creston road , and [she]834-she wondered what [he]842-a freckled boy was doing [there]185-there at that hour , and why [he]842-a freckled boy looked so hard at [her]834-she window . When [he]842-a freckled boy saw [her]834-she [he]842-a freckled boy crossed over and leaned against the gate unconcernedly . There was [no one]1910-no one stirring in [the house]171-the house , and [she]834-she threw a shawl over [her]834-she night - gown and ran down and let [herself]834-she out . By the time [she]834-she reached the gate [the boy]640-the boy was sauntering down [the road]160-the road , whistling carelessly ; but [she]834-she saw that a letter had been thrust between the slats and the crossbar of the gate . [She]834-she took it out and hastened back to [[her]834-she room]323-her room . The envelope bore [her]834-she name , and inside was a leaf torn from a pocket - diary . [DEAR CHARITY]69-charity : [I]0-i ca n't go away like this . [I]0-i am staying for a few days at [Creston River]20-creston river . Will [you]69-charity come down and meet [me]0-i at [Creston pool]19-creston ? [I]0-i will wait for [you]69-charity till evening . [IX CHARITY]69-charity sat before the mirror trying on a hat which [Ally Hawes]74-ally , with much secrecy , had trimmed for [her]74-ally . It was of white straw , with a drooping brim and cherry - coloured lining that made [her]74-ally face glow like the inside of the shell on the parlour mantelpiece . [She]834-she propped the square of looking - glass against [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's black leather Bible , steadying it in front with a white stone on which a view of [the Brooklyn Bridge]853-the brooklyn bridge was painted ; and [she]834-she sat before [her]834-she reflection , bending the brim this way and that , while [Ally Hawes]74-ally 's pale face looked over [her]834-she shoulder like the ghost of wasted opportunities . “ [I]834-she look awful , do n't [I]834-she ? ”[834-she] [she]834-she said at last with a happy sigh . [Ally]74-ally smiled and took back the hat . “ [I]69-charity 'll stitch the roses on right here , so 's [you]69-charity can put it away at once . ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity laughed , and ran [her]69-charity fingers through [her]69-charity rough dark hair . [She]69-charity knew that [Harney]75-harney liked to see its reddish edges ruffled about [her]74-ally forehead and breaking into little rings at the nape . [She]69-charity sat down on [her]69-charity bed and watched [Ally]74-ally stoop over the hat with a careful frown . “ Do n't [you]74-ally ever feel like going down to [Nettleton]5-nettleton for a day ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity asked . [Ally]74-ally shook [her]74-ally head without looking up . “ No , [I]74-ally always remember that awful time [I]74-ally went down with [Julia]112-julia -- to [that doctor]2200-that doctor 's . ”[74-ally] “ Oh , [Ally----]118-ally---- ”[74-ally] “ [I]74-ally ca n't help it . [The house]171-the house is on [the corner of [Wing Street]33-wing street and [Lake Avenue]34-lake avenue]2202-the corner of wing street and lake avenue . [The trolley from [the station]2204-the station]2203-the trolley from the station goes right by [it]171-the house , and the day [the minister]2086-the minister took [us]2206-us down to see those pictures [I]74-ally recognized it right off , and could n't seem to see anything else . There 's a big black sign with gold letters all across the front--'Private Consultations . ' [She]69-charity came as near as anything to dying .... ”[74-ally] “ [Poor Julia]119-julia ! ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity sighed from the height of [her]69-charity purity and [her]69-charity security . [She]69-charity had [a friend whom [she]69-charity trusted and who respected [her]69-charity]854-a friend whom she trusted and who respected her . [She]69-charity was going with [him]854-a friend whom she trusted and who respected her to spend the next day -- the Fourth of July -- at [Nettleton]5-nettleton . Whose business was it but [hers]69-charity , and what was the harm ? The pity of it was that [girls like [Julia]119-julia]855-girls like julia did not know how to choose , and to keep [bad fellows]856-bad fellows at a distance .... [Charity]69-charity slipped down from the bed , and stretched out [her]69-charity hands . “ Is it sewed ? Let [me]69-charity try it on again . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity put the hat on , and smiled at [her]69-charity image . The thought of [Julia]119-julia had vanished .... The next morning [she]69-charity was up before dawn , and saw the yellow sunrise broaden behind [the hills]150-the hills , and the silvery luster preceding a hot day tremble across [the sleeping fields]858-the sleeping fields . [Her]69-charity plans had been made with great care . [She]69-charity had announced that [she]69-charity was going down to [the Band of Hope picnic]35-the band of hope picnic at [Hepburn]4-hepburn , and as [no one else]283-no one else from [North Dormer]1-north dormer intended to venture so far it was not likely that [her]69-charity absence from the festivity would be reported . Besides , if it were [she]69-charity would not greatly care . [She]69-charity was determined to assert [her]69-charity independence , and if [she]69-charity stooped to fib about the Hepburn picnic it was chiefly from the secretive instinct that made [her]69-charity dread the profanation of [her]69-charity happiness . Whenever [she]69-charity was with [Lucius Harney]75-harney [she]69-charity would have liked some impenetrable mountain mist to hide [her]69-charity . It was arranged that [she]69-charity should walk to a point of [the Creston road]846-the creston road where [Harney]75-harney was to pick [her]69-charity up and drive [her]69-charity across [the hills]150-the hills to [Hepburn]4-hepburn in time for [the nine - thirty train]862-the nine - thirty train to [Nettleton]5-nettleton . [Harney]75-harney at first had been rather lukewarm about the trip . [He]75-harney declared [himself]75-harney ready to take [her]69-charity to [Nettleton]5-nettleton , but urged [her]69-charity not to go on the Fourth of July , on account of the crowds , the probable lateness of [the trains]863-the trains , the difficulty of [her]69-charity getting back before night ; but [her]69-charity evident disappointment caused [him]75-harney to give way , and even to affect a faint enthusiasm for the adventure . [She]69-charity understood why [he]75-harney was not more eager : [he]75-harney must have seen sights beside which even a Fourth of July at [Nettleton]5-nettleton would seem tame . But [she]69-charity had never seen anything ; and a great longing possessed [her]69-charity to walk [the streets of [a big town]865-a big town]864-the streets of a big town on a holiday , clinging to [his]75-harney arm and jostled by [idle crowds]866-idle crowds in [their]866-idle crowds best clothes . The only cloud on the prospect was the fact that [the shops]867-the shops would be closed ; but [she]69-charity hoped [he]75-harney would take [her]69-charity back another day , when they were open . [She]69-charity started out unnoticed in the early sunlight , slipping through [the kitchen]330-the kitchen while [Verena]87-verena bent above the stove . To avoid attracting notice , [she]69-charity carried [her]69-charity new hat carefully wrapped up , and had thrown a long grey veil of [Mrs. Royall]81-mrs. royall 's over the new white muslin dress which [Ally]74-ally 's clever fingers had made for [her]69-charity . All of the ten dollars [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had given [her]69-charity , and a part of [her]69-charity own savings as well , had been spent on renewing [her]69-charity wardrobe ; and when [Harney]75-harney jumped out of [the buggy]540-the buggy to meet [her]69-charity [she]69-charity read [her]69-charity reward in [his]75-harney eyes . [The freckled boy who had brought [her]69-charity the note two weeks earlier]870-the freckled boy who had brought her the note two weeks earlier was to wait with the buggy at [Hepburn]4-hepburn till [their]871-their return . [He]75-harney perched at [Charity]69-charity 's feet , [his]75-harney legs dangling between the wheels , and [they]871-their could not say much because of [his]75-harney presence . But it did not greatly matter , for [their]871-their past was now rich enough to have given [them]871-their a private language ; and with the long day stretching before [them]871-their like the blue distance beyond [the hills]150-the hills there was a delicate pleasure in postponement . When [Charity]69-charity , in response to [Harney]75-harney 's message , had gone to meet [him]75-harney at [the Creston]19-creston pool [her]69-charity heart had been so full of mortification and anger that [his]75-harney first words might easily have estranged [her]69-charity . But it happened that [he]75-harney had found the right word , which was one of simple friendship . [His]75-harney tone had instantly justified [her]69-charity , and put [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian in the wrong . [He]75-harney had made no allusion to what had passed between [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall and [himself]75-harney , but had simply let it appear that [he]75-harney had left because means of conveyance were hard to find at [North Dormer]1-north dormer , and because [Creston River]20-creston river was [a more convenient centre]874-a more convenient centre . [He]75-harney told [her]69-charity that [he]75-harney had hired by the week [the buggy of [the freckled boy]876-the freckled boy 's father , who served as livery - stable keeper to [one or two melancholy summer boarding - houses on [Creston Lake]26-creston lake]877-one or two melancholy summer boarding - houses on creston lake]875-the buggy of the freckled boy 's father , who served as livery - stable keeper to one or two melancholy summer boarding - houses on creston lake , and had discovered , within driving distance , [a number of houses worthy of [his]75-harney pencil]878-a number of houses worthy of his pencil ; and [he]75-harney said that [he]75-harney could not , while [he]75-harney was in [the neighbourhood]398-the neighbourhood , give up the pleasure of seeing [her]69-charity as often as possible . When [they]880-they took leave of [each other]328-each other [she]69-charity promised to continue to be [[his]75-harney guide]882-his guide ; and during the fortnight which followed [they]880-they roamed [the hills]150-the hills in happy comradeship . In [most of [the village]148-the village]884-most of the village friendships between [youths]886-youths and [maidens]887-maidens lack of conversation was made up for by tentative fondling ; but [Harney]75-harney , except when [he]75-harney had tried to comfort [her]69-charity in [her]69-charity trouble on [their]880-they way back from [the Hyatts]96-the hyatts ' , had never put [his]75-harney arm about [her]69-charity , or sought to betray [her]69-charity into any sudden caress . It seemed to be enough for [him]75-harney to breathe [her]69-charity nearness like a flower 's ; and since [his]75-harney pleasure at being with [her]69-charity , and [his]75-harney sense of [her]69-charity youth and [her]69-charity grace , perpetually shone in [his]75-harney eyes and softened the inflection of [his]75-harney voice , [his]75-harney reserve did not suggest coldness , but the deference due to [a girl of [his]75-harney own class]888-a girl of his own class . [The buggy]540-the buggy was drawn by an old trotter who whirled [them]540-the buggy along so briskly that the pace created a little breeze ; but when [they]540-the buggy reached [Hepburn]4-hepburn the full heat of the airless morning descended on [them]540-the buggy . At [the railway station]890-the railway station [the platform]891-the platform was packed with [a sweltering throng]892-a sweltering throng , and [they]540-the buggy took refuge in [the waiting - room]893-the waiting - room , where there was [another throng]894-another throng , already dejected by the heat and the long waiting for [retarded trains]895-retarded trains . [Pale mothers]896-pale mothers were struggling with fretful babies , or trying to keep [[their]896-pale mothers older offspring]897-their older offspring from the fascination of [the track]898-the track ; [girls]795-girls and [[their]795-girls “ fellows]2207-their “ fellows ”[795-girls] were giggling and shoving , and passing about candy in sticky bags , and [older men]900-older men , collarless and perspiring , were shifting [heavy children]901-heavy children from one arm to the other , and keeping a haggard eye on [the scattered members of [[their]900-older men families]903-their families]902-the scattered members of their families . At last [the train]904-the train rumbled in , and engulfed [the waiting multitude]905-the waiting multitude . [Harney]75-harney swept [Charity]69-charity up on to [the first car]906-the first car and [they]907-their captured a bench for two , and sat in happy isolation while [the train]904-the train swayed and roared along through [rich fields and languid tree - clumps]909-rich fields and languid tree - clumps . The haze of the morning had become a sort of clear tremor over everything , like the colourless vibration about a flame ; and the opulent landscape seemed to droop under it . But to [Charity]69-charity the heat was a stimulant : it enveloped [the whole world]910-the whole world in the same glow that burned at [her]69-charity heart . Now and then a lurch of [the train]904-the train flung [her]69-charity against [Harney]75-harney , and through [her]69-charity thin muslin [she]69-charity felt the touch of [his]75-harney sleeve . [She]69-charity steadied [herself]69-charity , [their]907-their eyes met , and the flaming breath of the day seemed to enclose [them]907-their . [The train]904-the train roared into [the Nettleton station]913-the nettleton station , [the descending mob]914-the descending mob caught [them]907-their on its tide , and [they]907-their were swept out into a vague dusty square thronged with seedy “ hacks ”[914-the descending mob] and long curtained omnibuses drawn by horses with tasselled fly - nets over [[their]907-their withers , who stood swinging [their]907-their depressed heads drearily from side to side]915-their withers , who stood swinging their depressed heads drearily from side to side . [A mob of ' bus and hack drivers]916-a mob of ' bus and hack drivers were shouting “ To [the Eagle House]37-the eagle house , ”[916-a mob of ' bus and hack drivers] “ To [the Washington House]2208-the washington house , ”[916-a mob of ' bus and hack drivers] “ This way to [the Lake]38-the lake , ”[916-a mob of ' bus and hack drivers] “ Just starting for Greytop ; ”[916-a mob of ' bus and hack drivers] and through [their]916-a mob of ' bus and hack drivers yells came the popping of fire - crackers , the explosion of torpedoes , the banging of toy - guns , and the crash of [a firemen 's band trying to play the Merry Widow]917-a firemen 's band trying to play the merry widow while [they]916-a mob of ' bus and hack drivers were being packed into a waggonette streaming with bunting . [The ramshackle wooden hotels about [the square]919-the square]918-the ramshackle wooden hotels about the square were all hung with flags and paper lanterns , and as [Harney]75-harney and [Charity]69-charity turned into [the main street]920-the main street , with [[its]920-the main street brick and granite business blocks]921-its brick and granite business blocks crowding out [the old low - storied shops]922-the old low - storied shops , and [its]920-the main street towering poles strung with innumerable wires that seemed to tremble and buzz in the heat , [they]907-their saw the double line of flags and lanterns tapering away gaily to [the park]923-the park at the other end of the perspective . The noise and colour of this holiday vision seemed to transform [Nettleton]5-nettleton into [a metropolis]924-a metropolis . [Charity]69-charity could not believe that [Springfield]2-springfield or even [Boston]39-boston had anything grander to show , and [she]69-charity wondered if , at this very moment , [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch , on the arm of as brilliant [a young man]925-a young man , were threading [her]65-annabel balch way through scenes as resplendent . “ Where shall [we]907-their go first ? ”[75-harney] [Harney]75-harney asked ; but as [she]69-charity turned [her]69-charity happy eyes on [him]75-harney [he]75-harney guessed the answer and said : “ [We]907-their 'll take a look round , shall [we]907-their ? ”[75-harney] [The street]163-the street swarmed with [[their]907-their fellow - travellers]927-their fellow - travellers , with [other excursionists]928-other excursionists arriving from other directions , with [[Nettleton]5-nettleton 's own population]929-nettleton 's own population , and with [the mill - hands]930-the mill - hands trooping in from [the factories on [the Creston]19-creston]931-the factories on the creston . [The shops]867-the shops were closed , but [one]933-one would scarcely have noticed it , so numerous were the glass doors swinging open on [saloons]712-saloons , on [restaurants]935-restaurants , on drug - stores gushing from every soda - water tap , on fruit and confectionery shops stacked with strawberry - cake , cocoanut drops , trays of glistening molasses candy , boxes of caramels and chewing - gum , baskets of sodden strawberries , and dangling branches of bananas . Outside of some of the doors were trestles with banked - up oranges and apples , spotted pears and dusty raspberries ; and the air reeked with the smell of fruit and stale coffee , beer and sarsaparilla and fried potatoes . Even [the shops that were closed]936-the shops that were closed offered , through wide expanses of plate - glass , hints of hidden riches . In some , waves of silk and ribbon broke over shores of imitation moss from which ravishing hats rose like tropical orchids . In others , the pink throats of gramophones opened [their]907-their giant convolutions in a soundless chorus ; or bicycles shining in neat ranks seemed to await the signal of an invisible starter ; or tiers of fancy - goods in leatherette and paste and celluloid dangled [their]907-their insidious graces ; and , in one vast bay that seemed to project [them]907-their into exciting contact with [the public]692-the public , [wax ladies in daring dresses]938-wax ladies in daring dresses chatted elegantly , or , with gestures intimate yet blameless , pointed to [their]938-wax ladies in daring dresses pink corsets and transparent hosiery . [Presently Harney]75-harney found that [his]939-his watch had stopped , and turned in at [a small jeweller 's shop which chanced to still be open]940-a small jeweller 's shop which chanced to still be open . While the watch was being examined [Charity]69-charity leaned over the glass counter where , on a background of dark blue velvet , pins , rings , and brooches glittered like the moon and stars . [She]69-charity had never seen jewellry so near by , and [she]69-charity longed to lift the glass lid and plunge [her]69-charity hand among the shining treasures . But already [Harney]75-harney 's watch was repaired , and [he]75-harney laid [his]75-harney hand on [her]69-charity arm and drew [her]69-charity from [her]69-charity dream . “ Which do [you]69-charity like best ? ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney asked leaning over the counter at [her]69-charity side . “ [I]69-charity do n't know .... ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity pointed to a gold lily - of - [the - valley]941-the - valley with white flowers . “ Do n't [you]69-charity think the blue pin 's better ? ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney suggested , and immediately [she]69-charity saw that [the lily of [the valley]228-the valley]942-the lily of the valley was mere trumpery compared to the small round stone , blue as [a mountain lake]944-a mountain lake , with little sparks of light all round it . [She]69-charity coloured at [her]69-charity want of discrimination . “ It 's so lovely [I]69-charity guess [I]69-charity was afraid to look at it , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said . [He]75-harney laughed , and [they]945-they went out of [the shop]946-the shop ; but a few steps away [he]75-harney exclaimed : “ Oh , by [Jove]120-jove , [I]75-harney forgot something , ”[75-harney] and turned back and left [her]69-charity in [the crowd]947-the crowd . [She]69-charity stood staring down a row of pink gramophone throats till [he]75-harney rejoined [her]69-charity and slipped [his]75-harney arm through [hers]69-charity . “ [You]69-charity must n't be afraid of looking at the blue pin any longer , because it belongs to [you]69-charity , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney said ; and [she]69-charity felt a little box being pressed into [her]69-charity hand . [Her]69-charity heart gave a leap of joy , but it reached [her]69-charity lips only in a shy stammer . [She]69-charity remembered [other girls whom [she]69-charity had heard planning to extract presents from [[their]948-other girls whom she had heard planning to extract presents from their fellows fellows]949-their fellows]948-other girls whom she had heard planning to extract presents from their fellows , and was seized with a sudden dread lest [Harney]75-harney should have imagined that [she]69-charity had leaned over the pretty things in the glass case in the hope of having one given to [her]69-charity .... A little farther down [the street]163-the street [they]951-they turned in at a glass doorway opening on [a shining hall with a mahogany staircase]952-a shining hall with a mahogany staircase , and brass cages in [its]952-a shining hall with a mahogany staircase corners . “ [We]951-they must have something to eat , ”[75-harney] [Harney]75-harney said ; and the next moment [Charity]69-charity found [herself]69-charity in [a dressing - room]953-a dressing - room all looking - glass and lustrous surfaces , where [a party of showy - looking girls]954-a party of showy - looking girls were dabbing on powder and straightening immense plumed hats . When [they]954-a party of showy - looking girls had gone [she]69-charity took courage to bathe [her]69-charity hot face in one of the marble basins , and to straighten [her]69-charity own hat - brim , which the parasols of [the crowd]947-the crowd had indented . The dresses in [the shops]867-the shops had so impressed [her]69-charity that [she]69-charity scarcely dared look at [her]69-charity reflection ; but when [she]69-charity did so , the glow of [her]69-charity face under [her]69-charity cherry - coloured hat , and the curve of [her]69-charity young shoulders through the transparent muslin , restored [her]69-charity courage ; and when [she]69-charity had taken the blue brooch from its box and pinned it on [her]69-charity bosom [she]69-charity walked toward [the restaurant]957-the restaurant with [her]69-charity head high , as if [she]69-charity had always strolled through [tessellated halls]958-tessellated halls beside [young men in flannels]959-young men in flannels . [Her]69-charity spirit sank a little at the sight of [the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on [their]960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables]960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables . “ Not f'r another hour , ”[960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables] one of [them]960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables dropped to [Harney]75-harney in passing ; and [he]75-harney stood doubtfully glancing about [him]75-harney . “ Oh , well , [we]2209-we ca n't stay sweltering [here]1923-here , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney decided ; “ let 's try somewhere else-- ”[75-harney] and with a sense of relief [Charity]69-charity followed [him]75-harney from that scene of inhospitable splendour . That “ [somewhere else ”]2211-somewhere else ”[69-charity] turned out -- after more hot tramping , and several failures -- to be , of all things , [a little open - air place in [a back street]962-a back street that called [itself]962-a back street [a French restaurant]963-a french restaurant]961-a little open - air place in a back street that called itself a french restaurant , and consisted in two or three rickety tables under a scarlet - runner , between a patch of zinnias and petunias and a big elm bending over from [the next yard]964-the next yard . [Here]1923-here [they]960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables lunched on queerly flavoured things , while [Harney]75-harney , leaning back in a crippled rocking - chair , smoked cigarettes between the courses and poured into [Charity]69-charity 's glass a pale yellow wine which [he]75-harney said was the very same one drank in just [such jolly places in [France]40-france]966-such jolly places in france . [Charity]69-charity did not think the wine as good as sarsaparilla , but [she]69-charity sipped a mouthful for the pleasure of doing what [he]75-harney did , and of fancying [herself]69-charity alone with [him]75-harney in [foreign countries]967-foreign countries . The illusion was increased by [their]960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables being served by [a deep - bosomed woman with smooth hair and a pleasant laugh]968-a deep - bosomed woman with smooth hair and a pleasant laugh , who talked to [Harney]75-harney in unintelligible words , and seemed amazed and overjoyed at [his]75-harney answering [her]69-charity in kind . At the other tables [other people]969-other people sat , mill - hands probably , homely but pleasant looking , who spoke the same shrill jargon , and looked at [Harney]75-harney and [Charity]69-charity with friendly eyes ; and between the table - legs [a poodle with bald patches and pink eyes]970-a poodle with bald patches and pink eyes nosed about for scraps , and sat up on [his]970-a poodle with bald patches and pink eyes hind legs absurdly . [Harney]75-harney showed no inclination to move , for hot as [their]960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables corner was , it was at least shaded and quiet ; and , from [the main thoroughfares]971-the main thoroughfares came the clanging of trolleys , the incessant popping of torpedoes , the jingle of street - organs , the bawling of [megaphone men and the loud murmur of increasing crowds]972-megaphone men and the loud murmur of increasing crowds . [He]75-harney leaned back , smoking [his]75-harney cigar , patting the dog , and stirring the coffee that steamed in [their]960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables chipped cups . “ It 's the real thing , [you]69-charity know , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney explained ; and [Charity]69-charity hastily revised [her]69-charity previous conception of the beverage . [They]960-the slim - waisted waitresses in black , with bewitching mob - caps on their haughty heads , who were moving disdainfully between the tables had made no plans for the rest of the day , and when [Harney]75-harney asked [her]69-charity what [she]69-charity wanted to do next [she]69-charity was too bewildered by rich possibilities to find an answer . Finally [she]69-charity confessed that [she]69-charity longed to go to [the Lake]973-the lake , where [she]69-charity had not been taken on [her]69-charity former visit , and when [he]75-harney answered , “ Oh , there 's time for that -- it will be pleasanter later , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity suggested seeing some pictures like the ones [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles had taken [her]69-charity to . [She]69-charity thought [Harney]75-harney looked a little disconcerted ; but [he]75-harney passed [his]75-harney fine handkerchief over [his]75-harney warm brow , said gaily , “ Come along , then , ”[75-harney] and rose with a last pat for the pink - eyed dog . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles 's pictures had been shown in [an austere Y.M.C.A. hall]974-an austere y.m.c.a. hall , with white walls and an organ ; but [Harney]75-harney led [Charity]69-charity to [a glittering place]975-a glittering place -- everything [she]69-charity saw seemed to glitter -- where [they]976-they passed , between immense pictures of [yellow - haired beauties]977-yellow - haired beauties stabbing [villains in evening dress]978-villains in evening dress , into [a velvet - curtained auditorium packed with [spectators]980-spectators to the last limit of compression]979-a velvet - curtained auditorium packed with spectators to the last limit of compression . After that , for a while , everything was merged in [her]69-charity brain in swimming circles of heat and blinding alternations of light and darkness . All [the world]184-the world has to show seemed to pass before [her]69-charity in a chaos of palms and minarets , [charging cavalry regiments]982-charging cavalry regiments , roaring lions , [comic policemen]983-comic policemen and [scowling murderers]984-scowling murderers ; and [the crowd around [her]69-charity]985-the crowd around her , the hundreds of hot sallow candy - munching faces , young , old , middle - aged , but all kindled with the same contagious excitement , became part of the spectacle , and danced on the screen with the rest . Presently the thought of the cool trolley - run to [the Lake]38-the lake grew irresistible , and [they]976-they struggled out of [the theatre]986-the theatre . As [they]976-they stood on [the pavement]987-the pavement , [Harney]75-harney pale with the heat , and even [Charity]69-charity a little confused by it , [a young man]925-a young man drove by in an electric run - about with a calico band bearing the words : “ Ten dollars to take [you]69-charity round [the Lake]38-the lake . ”[925-a young man] Before [Charity]69-charity knew what was happening , [Harney]75-harney had waved a hand , and [they]976-they were climbing in . “ Say , for twenny - five [I]989-the driver 'll run [you]69-charity out to see the ball - game and back , ”[989-the driver] [the driver]989-the driver proposed with an insinuating grin ; but [Charity]69-charity said quickly : “ Oh , [I]69-charity 'd rather go rowing on [the Lake]38-the lake . ”[69-charity] [The street]163-the street was so thronged that progress was slow ; but the glory of sitting in [the little carriage]991-the little carriage while [it]991-the little carriage wriggled its way between laden omnibuses and trolleys made the moments seem too short . “ Next turn is [Lake Avenue]34-lake avenue , ”[173-the young man] [the young man]173-the young man called out over [his]173-the young man shoulder ; and as [they]976-they paused in the wake of a big omnibus groaning with [Knights of Pythias in cocked hats and swords]993-knights of pythias in cocked hats and swords , [Charity]69-charity looked up and saw on the corner [a brick house with a conspicuous black and gold sign across]994-a brick house with a conspicuous black and gold sign across [its]994-a brick house with a conspicuous black and gold sign across front . “ [Dr. Merkle]121-dr. merkle ; Private Consultations at all hours . [Lady Attendants]122-lady attendants , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity read ; and suddenly [she]69-charity remembered [Ally Hawes]74-ally 's words : “ [The house]171-the house was at the corner of [Wing Street]33-wing street and [Lake Avenue]34-lake avenue ... there 's a big black sign across the front .... ”[74-ally] Through all the heat and the rapture a shiver of cold ran over [her]69-charity . [X]123-x [THE Lake]973-the lake at last -- a sheet of shining metal brooded over by drooping trees . [Charity]69-charity and [Harney]75-harney had secured [a boat]996-a boat and , getting away from [the wharves]997-the wharves and [the refreshment - booths]998-the refreshment - booths , [they]999-they drifted idly along , hugging the shadow of [the shore]1000-the shore . Where the sun struck the water its shafts flamed back blindingly at the heat - veiled sky ; and the least shade was black by contrast . [The Lake]38-the lake was so smooth that the reflection of the trees on its edge seemed enamelled on a solid surface ; but gradually , as the sun declined , the water grew transparent , and [Charity]69-charity , leaning over , plunged [her]69-charity fascinated gaze into depths so clear that [she]69-charity saw the inverted tree - tops interwoven with the green growths of the bottom . [They]999-they rounded a point at [the farther end of [the Lake]38-the lake]1001-the farther end of the lake , and entering [an inlet]1002-an inlet pushed [their]999-they bow against a protruding tree - trunk . A green veil of willows overhung [them]999-they . Beyond the trees , [wheat - fields]1003-wheat - fields sparkled in the sun ; and all along the horizon [the clear hills]1004-the clear hills throbbed with light . [Charity]69-charity leaned back in the stern , and [Harney]75-harney unshipped the oars and lay in the bottom of [the boat]1005-the boat without speaking . Ever since [their]999-they meeting at [the Creston pool]1006-the creston pool [he]75-harney had been subject to these brooding silences , which were as different as possible from the pauses when [they]999-they ceased to speak because words were needless . At such times [his]75-harney face wore the expression [she]69-charity had seen on it when [she]69-charity had looked in at [him]75-harney from the darkness and again there came over [her]69-charity a sense of the mysterious distance between [them]999-they ; but usually [his]75-harney fits of abstraction were followed by bursts of gaiety that chased away the shadow before it chilled [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity was still thinking of the ten dollars [he]75-harney had handed to [the driver of the run - about]1007-the driver of the run - about . It had given [them]999-they twenty minutes of pleasure , and it seemed unimaginable that [anyone]260-anyone should be able to buy amusement at that rate . With ten dollars [he]75-harney might have bought [her]69-charity an engagement ring ; [she]69-charity knew that [Mrs. Tom Fry]115-mrs. tom fry 's , which came from [Springfield]2-springfield , and had a diamond in it , had cost only eight seventy - five .
