But [she]69-charity did not know why the thought had occurred to [her]69-charity . [Harney]75-harney would never buy [her]69-charity an engagement ring : [they]999-they were [friends]2153-friends and [comrades]1010-comrades , but no more . [He]75-harney had been perfectly fair to [her]69-charity : [he]75-harney had never said a word to mislead [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity wondered what [the girl]180-the girl was like whose hand was waiting for [his]75-harney ring .... Boats were beginning to thicken on [the Lake]973-the lake and the clang of [incessantly arriving trolleys]1013-incessantly arriving trolleys announced the return of [the crowds]1014-the crowds from [the ball - field]1015-the ball - field . The shadows lengthened across the pearl - grey water and two white clouds near the sun were turning golden . On [the opposite shore]1016-the opposite shore [men]210-men were hammering hastily at a wooden scaffolding in [a field]1018-a field . [Charity]69-charity asked what it was for . “ Why , the fireworks . [I]69-charity suppose there 'll be a big show . ”[69-charity] [Harney]75-harney looked at [her]69-charity and a smile crept into [his]75-harney moody eyes . “ Have [you]69-charity never seen any good fireworks ? ”[75-harney] “ [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard always sends up lovely rockets on [the Fourth]41-the fourth , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity answered doubtfully . “ Oh---- ”[75-harney] [his]75-harney contempt was unbounded . “ [I]69-charity mean a big performance like this , [illuminated boats]2213-illuminated boats , and all the rest . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity flushed at the picture . “ Do [they]2214-they send [them]2214-they up from [the Lake]38-the lake , too ? ”[69-charity] “ Rather . Did n't [you]69-charity notice [that big raft]2215-that big raft [we]2216-we passed ? It 's wonderful to see the rockets completing their orbits down under one 's feet . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity said nothing , and [he]75-harney put the oars into the rowlocks . “ If [we]2216-we stay [we]2216-we 'd better go and pick up something to eat . ”[75-harney] “ But how can [we]2216-we get back afterwards ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity ventured , feeling it would break [her]69-charity heart if [she]69-charity missed it . [He]75-harney consulted a time - table , found [a ten o'clock train]1019-a ten o'clock train and reassured [her]69-charity . “ The moon rises so late that it will be dark by eight , and [we]2216-we 'll have over an hour of it . ”[75-harney] Twilight fell , and lights began to show along [the shore]1000-the shore . The trolleys roaring out from [Nettleton]5-nettleton became great luminous serpents coiling in and out among the trees . [The wooden eating - houses at [the Lake]38-the lake 's edge]1021-the wooden eating - houses at the lake 's edge danced with lanterns , and the dusk echoed with laughter and shouts and the clumsy splashing of oars . [Harney]75-harney and [Charity]69-charity had found a table in the corner of [a balcony built over [the Lake]973-the lake]1022-a balcony built over the lake , and were patiently awaiting an unattainable chowder . Close under [them]1024-them the water lapped the piles , agitated by the evolutions of [a little white steamboat trellised with coloured globes which was to run passengers up and down [the Lake]38-the lake]1025-a little white steamboat trellised with coloured globes which was to run passengers up and down the lake . [It]1026-it was already black with them as it sheered off on [its]1026-it first trip . Suddenly [Charity]69-charity heard [a woman]285-a woman 's laugh behind [her]69-charity . The sound was familiar , and [she]69-charity turned to look . [A band of showily dressed girls]1028-a band of showily dressed girls and [dapper young men wearing badges of secret societies]1029-dapper young men wearing badges of secret societies , with new straw hats tilted far back on [their]1028-a band of showily dressed girls square - clipped hair , had invaded [the balcony]1030-the balcony and were loudly clamouring for a table . [The girl in the lead]1031-the girl in the lead was [the one who had laughed]1032-the one who had laughed . [She]1031-the girl in the lead wore a large hat with a long white feather , and from under its brim [her]1031-the girl in the lead painted eyes looked at [Charity]69-charity with amused recognition . “ Say ! if this ai n't like [Old Home Week]42-old home week , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity remarked to [the girl at [her]69-charity elbow]1033-the girl at her elbow ; and giggles and glances passed between [them]1034-them . [Charity]69-charity knew at once that [the girl with the white feather]1035-the girl with the white feather was [Julia Hawes]112-julia . [She]69-charity had lost [her]69-charity freshness , and the paint under [her]69-charity eyes made [her]69-charity face seem thinner ; but [her]69-charity lips had the same lovely curve , and the same cold mocking smile , as if there were some secret absurdity in the person [she]69-charity was looking at , and [she]69-charity had instantly detected it . [Charity]69-charity flushed to the forehead and looked away . [She]69-charity felt [herself]69-charity humiliated by [Julia]112-julia 's sneer , and vexed that the mockery of [such a creature]1036-such a creature should affect [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity trembled lest [Harney]75-harney should notice that [the noisy troop]1037-the noisy troop had recognized [her]69-charity ; but [they]1037-the noisy troop found no table free , and passed on tumultuously . Presently there was a soft rush through the air and a shower of silver fell from the blue evening sky . In another direction , pale Roman candles shot up singly through the trees , and a fire - haired rocket swept the horizon like a portent . Between these intermittent flashes the velvet curtains of the darkness were descending , and in the intervals of eclipse the voices of [the crowds]1014-the crowds seemed to sink to smothered murmurs . [Charity]69-charity and [Harney]75-harney , dispossessed by [newcomers]1039-newcomers , were at length obliged to give up [their]1040-their table and struggle through the throng about [the boat]1005-the boat - landings . For a while there seemed no escape from the tide of [late arrivals]1042-late arrivals ; but finally [Harney]75-harney secured the last two places on the stand from which [the more privileged were to see the fireworks]1043-the more privileged were to see the fireworks . The seats were at the end of a row , one above the other . [Charity]69-charity had taken off [her]69-charity hat to have an uninterrupted view ; and whenever [she]69-charity leaned back to follow the curve of some dishevelled rocket [she]69-charity could feel [Harney]75-harney 's knees against [her]69-charity head . After a while the scattered fireworks ceased . A longer interval of darkness followed , and then the whole night broke into flower . From every point of the horizon , gold and silver arches sprang up and crossed each other , sky - orchards broke into blossom , shed their flaming petals and hung [their]1044-their branches with golden fruit ; and all the while the air was filled with a soft supernatural hum , as though great birds were building [their]1045-their nests in [those invisible tree - tops]1046-those invisible tree - tops . Now and then there came a lull , and a wave of moonlight swept [the Lake]38-the lake . In a flash it revealed hundreds of [boats]1047-boats , steel - dark against lustrous ripples ; then it withdrew as if with a furling of vast translucent wings . [Charity]69-charity 's heart throbbed with delight . It was as if all the latent beauty of things had been unveiled to [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity could not imagine that [the world]184-the world held anything more wonderful ; but near [her]69-charity [she]69-charity heard [someone]1049-someone say , “ [You]69-charity wait till [you]69-charity see the set piece , ”[1049-someone] and instantly [her]69-charity hopes took a fresh flight . At last , just as it was beginning to seem as though the whole arch of the sky were one great lid pressed against [her]69-charity dazzled eye - balls , and striking out of them continuous jets of jewelled light , the velvet darkness settled down again , and a murmur of expectation ran through [the crowd]947-the crowd . “ Now -- now ! ”[1051-the same voice] [the same voice]1051-the same voice said excitedly ; and [Charity]69-charity , grasping the hat on [her]69-charity knee , crushed it tight in the effort to restrain [her]69-charity rapture . For a moment the night seemed to grow more impenetrably black ; then a great picture stood out against it like a constellation . It was surmounted by a golden scroll bearing the inscription , “ Washington crossing [the Delaware]43-the delaware , ”[1054-the spectators] and across a flood of motionless golden ripples [the National Hero]1052-the national hero passed , erect , solemn and gigantic , standing with folded arms in the stern of [a slowly moving golden boat]1053-a slowly moving golden boat . A long “ Oh - h - h ”[1054-the spectators] burst from [the spectators]1054-the spectators : the stand creaked and shook with [their]1054-the spectators blissful trepidations . “ Oh - h - h , ”[1054-the spectators] [Charity]69-charity gasped : [she]69-charity had forgotten where [she]69-charity was , had at last forgotten even [Harney]75-harney 's nearness . [She]69-charity seemed to have been caught up into the stars .... The picture vanished and darkness came down . In the obscurity [she]69-charity felt [her]69-charity head clasped by two hands : [her]69-charity face was drawn backward , and [Harney]75-harney 's lips were pressed on [hers]69-charity . With sudden vehemence [he]75-harney wound [his]75-harney arms about [her]69-charity , holding [her]69-charity head against [his]75-harney breast while [she]69-charity gave [him]75-harney back [his]75-harney kisses . [An unknown Harney]75-harney had revealed [himself]75-harney , [a Harney who dominated [her]69-charity and yet over whom [she]69-charity felt [herself]69-charity possessed of a new mysterious power]75-harney . But [the crowd]947-the crowd was beginning to move , and [he]75-harney had to release [her]69-charity . “ Come , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney said in a confused voice . [He]75-harney scrambled over the side of the stand , and holding up [his]75-harney arm caught [her]69-charity as [she]69-charity sprang to the ground . [He]75-harney passed [his]75-harney arm about [her]69-charity waist , steadying [her]69-charity against the descending rush of [people]338-people ; and [she]69-charity clung to [him]75-harney , speechless , exultant , as if all the crowding and confusion about [them]1057-they were a mere vain stirring of the air . “ Come , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney repeated , “ [we]1057-they must try to make [the trolley]2217-the trolley . ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney drew [her]69-charity along , and [she]69-charity followed , still in [her]69-charity dream . [They]1057-they walked as if [they]1057-they were one , so isolated in ecstasy that [the people jostling [them]1057-they on every side]1058-the people jostling them on every side seemed impalpable . But when [they]1057-they reached [the terminus]1059-the terminus [the illuminated trolley]1060-the illuminated trolley was already clanging on its way , [its]1060-the illuminated trolley platforms black with [passengers]1061-passengers . [The cars waiting behind [it]1060-the illuminated trolley]1062-the cars waiting behind it were as thickly packed ; and the throng about [the terminus]1059-the terminus was so dense that it seemed hopeless to struggle for a place . “ Last trip up [the Lake]973-the lake , ”[75-harney] a megaphone bellowed from [the wharf]1064-the wharf ; and the lights of [the little steam - boat]1065-the little steam - boat came dancing out of the darkness . “ No use waiting here ; shall [we]1057-they run up [the Lake]38-the lake ? ”[75-harney] [Harney]75-harney suggested . [They]1057-they pushed [their]1057-they way back to [the edge of [the water]1067-the water]1066-the edge of the water just as [the gang - plank]1068-the gang - plank lowered from the white side of [the boat]1005-the boat . The electric light at the end of [the wharf]1064-the wharf flashed full on [the descending passengers]1071-the descending passengers , and among [them]1071-the descending passengers [Charity]69-charity caught sight of [Julia Hawes]112-julia , [her]112-julia white feather askew , and the face under it flushed with coarse laughter . As [she]69-charity stepped from [the gang - plank]1068-the gang - plank [she]69-charity stopped short , [her]69-charity dark - ringed eyes darting malice . “ [Hullo]124-hullo , [Charity Royall]69-charity ! ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity called out ; and then , looking back over [her]69-charity shoulder : “ Did n't [I]69-charity tell [you]69-charity it was a family party ? [Here 's [grandpa]2220-grandpa 's little daughter]2219-here 's grandpa 's little daughter come to take [him]1075-his [home]342-home ! ”[69-charity] [A snigger]1073-a snigger ran through [the group]1074-the group ; and then , towering above [them]1074-the group , and steadying [himself]1075-his by the hand - rail in a desperate effort at erectness , [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall stepped stiffly ashore . Like [the young men of the party]1076-the young men of the party , [he]1075-his wore a secret society emblem in the buttonhole of [his]1075-his black frock - coat . [His]1075-his head was covered by a new Panama hat , and [his]1075-his narrow black tie , half undone , dangled down on [his]1075-his rumpled shirt - front . [His]1075-his face , a livid brown , with red blotches of anger and lips sunken in like [an old man]345-an old man 's , was a lamentable ruin in the searching glare . [He]1075-his was just behind [Julia Hawes]112-julia , and had one hand on [her]112-julia arm ; but as [he]1075-his left [the gang - plank]1068-the gang - plank [he]1075-his freed [himself]1075-his , and moved a step or two away from [[his]1075-his companions]1079-his companions . [He]1075-his had seen [Charity]69-charity at once , and [his]1075-his glance passed slowly from [her]69-charity to [Harney]75-harney , whose arm was still about [her]69-charity . [He]1075-his stood staring at [them]1079-his companions , and trying to master the senile quiver of [his]1075-his lips ; then [he]1075-his drew [himself]1075-his up with the tremulous majesty of drunkenness , and stretched out [his]1075-his arm . “ [[You]69-charity whore]2222-you whore -- [[you]69-charity damn -- bare - headed whore]2223-you damn -- bare - headed whore , [you]69-charity ! ”[1075-his] [he]1075-his enunciated slowly . There was a scream of tipsy laughter from the party , and [Charity]69-charity involuntarily put [her]69-charity hands to [her]69-charity head . [She]69-charity remembered that [her]69-charity hat had fallen from [her]69-charity lap when [she]69-charity jumped up to leave the stand ; and suddenly [she]69-charity had a vision of [herself]69-charity , hatless , dishevelled , with [a man]322-a man 's arm about [her]69-charity , confronting [that drunken crew]1081-that drunken crew , headed by [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian 's pitiable figure . The picture filled [her]69-charity with shame . [She]69-charity had known since childhood about [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's “ habits ”[64-mr. royall] : had seen [him]64-mr. royall , as [she]69-charity went up to bed , sitting morosely in [[his]64-mr. royall office]310-his office , a bottle at [his]64-mr. royall elbow ; or coming [home]342-home , heavy and quarrelsome , from [his]64-mr. royall business expeditions to [Hepburn]4-hepburn or [Springfield]2-springfield ; but the idea of [his]64-mr. royall associating [himself]64-mr. royall publicly with [a band of [disreputable girls]1086-disreputable girls and [bar - room loafers]1087-bar - room loafers]1085-a band of disreputable girls and bar - room loafers was new and dreadful to [her]69-charity . “ Oh---- ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said in a gasp of misery ; and releasing [herself]69-charity from [Harney]75-harney 's arm [she]69-charity went straight up to [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall . “ [You]64-mr. royall come [home]342-home with [me]69-charity -- [you]64-mr. royall come right [home]342-home with [me]69-charity , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said in a low stern voice , as if [she]69-charity had not heard [his]64-mr. royall apostrophe ; and [one of [the girls]462-the girls]1088-one of the girls called out : “ Say , how many [fellers]2226-fellers does [she]69-charity want ? ”[1088-one of the girls] There was another laugh , followed by a pause of curiosity , during which [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall continued to glare at [Charity]69-charity . At length [his]64-mr. royall twitching lips parted . “ [I]64-mr. royall said , ' [[You]69-charity -- damn -- whore]2227-you -- damn -- whore ! ' ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall repeated with precision , steadying [himself]64-mr. royall on [Julia]112-julia 's shoulder . Laughs and jeers were beginning to spring up from [the circle of people beyond [[their]1090-the circle of people beyond their group group]1091-their group]1090-the circle of people beyond their group ; and a voice called out from [the gangway]1092-the gangway : “ Now , then , step lively there -- [all ABOARD]2228-all aboard ! ”[1093-approaching and departing passengers] The pressure of [approaching and departing passengers]1093-approaching and departing passengers forced [the actors in the rapid scene]1094-the actors in the rapid scene apart , and pushed [them]1094-the actors in the rapid scene back into the throng . [Charity]69-charity found [herself]69-charity clinging to [Harney]75-harney 's arm and sobbing desperately . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had disappeared , and in the distance [she]69-charity heard the receding sound of [Julia]112-julia 's laugh . [The boat , laden to the taffrail]1095-the boat , laden to the taffrail , was puffing away on [her]69-charity last trip . [XI]125-xi AT two o'clock in the morning [the freckled boy from [Creston]19-creston]1096-the freckled boy from creston stopped [his]1096-the freckled boy from creston sleepy horse at the door of [the red house]357-the red house , and [Charity]69-charity got out . [Harney]75-harney had taken leave of [her]69-charity at [Creston River]20-creston river , charging [the boy]640-the boy to drive [her]69-charity [home]342-home . [Her]69-charity mind was still in a fog of misery , and [she]69-charity did not remember very clearly what had happened , or what [they]1100-they said to [each other]328-each other , during the interminable interval since [their]1100-they departure from [Nettleton]5-nettleton ; but the secretive instinct of the animal in pain was so strong in [her]69-charity that [she]69-charity had a sense of relief when [Harney]75-harney got out and [she]69-charity drove on alone . The full moon hung over [North Dormer]1-north dormer , whitening the mist that filled the hollows between [the hills]150-the hills and floated transparently above [the fields]151-the fields . [Charity]69-charity stood a moment at the gate , looking out into the waning night . [She]69-charity watched [the boy]640-the boy drive off , [his]640-the boy horse 's head wagging heavily to and fro ; then [she]69-charity went around to the kitchen door and felt under the mat for the key . [She]69-charity found it , unlocked the door and went in . [The kitchen]330-the kitchen was dark , but [she]69-charity discovered a box of matches , lit a candle and went [upstairs]424-upstairs . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's door , opposite [hers]69-charity , stood open on [[his]64-mr. royall unlit room]1107-his unlit room ; evidently [he]64-mr. royall had not come back . [She]69-charity went into [[her]69-charity room]323-her room , bolted [her]69-charity door and began slowly to untie the ribbon about [her]69-charity waist , and to take off [her]69-charity dress . Under the bed [she]69-charity saw the paper bag in which [she]69-charity had hidden [her]69-charity new hat from inquisitive eyes .... [She]69-charity lay for a long time sleepless on [her]69-charity bed , staring up at the moonlight on the low ceiling ; dawn was in the sky when [she]69-charity fell asleep , and when [she]69-charity woke the sun was on [her]69-charity face . [She]69-charity dressed and went down to [the kitchen]330-the kitchen . [Verena]87-verena was there alone : [she]87-verena glanced at [Charity]69-charity tranquilly , with [her]87-verena old deaf - looking eyes . There was no sign of [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall about [the house]171-the house and the hours passed without [his]64-mr. royall reappearing . [Charity]69-charity had gone up to [[her]69-charity room]323-her room , and sat there listlessly , [her]69-charity hands on [her]69-charity lap . Puffs of sultry air fanned [her]69-charity dimity window curtains and flies buzzed stiflingly against the bluish panes . At one o'clock [Verena]87-verena hobbled up to see if [she]69-charity were not coming down to dinner ; but [she]87-verena shook [her]87-verena head , and [the old woman]412-the old woman went away , saying : “ [I]412-the old woman 'll cover up , then . ”[412-the old woman] The sun turned and left [[her]69-charity room]323-her room , and [Charity]69-charity seated [herself]69-charity in the window , gazing down [the village street]1114-the village street through the half - opened shutters . Not a thought was in [her]69-charity mind ; it was just a dark whirlpool of crowding images ; and [she]69-charity watched [the people passing along [the street]163-the street]1115-the people passing along the street , [[Dan Targatt]95-dan targatt 's team]1117-dan targatt 's team hauling a load of pine - trunks down to [Hepburn]4-hepburn , [the sexton]1118-the sexton 's old white horse grazing on the bank across the way , as if [she]69-charity looked at these familiar sights from the other side of [the grave]1119-the grave . [She]69-charity was roused from [her]69-charity apathy by seeing [Ally Hawes]74-ally come out of [the Frys]111-the frys ' gate and walk slowly toward [the red house]357-the red house with [her]74-ally uneven limping step . At the sight [Charity]69-charity recovered [her]69-charity severed contact with reality . [She]69-charity divined that [Ally]74-ally was coming to hear about [her]69-charity day : [no one else]283-no one else was in the secret of the trip to [Nettleton]5-nettleton , and it had flattered [Ally]74-ally profoundly to be allowed to know of it . At the thought of having to see [her]74-ally , of having to meet [her]74-ally eyes and answer or evade [her]74-ally questions , the whole horror of the previous night 's adventure rushed back upon [Charity]69-charity . What had been a feverish nightmare became a cold and unescapable fact . [Poor Ally]126-ally , at that moment , represented [North Dormer]1-north dormer , with all its mean curiosities , its furtive malice , its sham unconsciousness of evil . [Charity]69-charity knew that , although all relations with [Julia]112-julia were supposed to be severed , [the tender - hearted Ally]126-ally still secretly communicated with [her]112-julia ; and no doubt [Julia]112-julia would exult in the chance of retailing the scandal of [the wharf]1064-the wharf . The story , exaggerated and distorted , was probably already on its way to [North Dormer]1-north dormer . [Ally]126-ally 's dragging pace had not carried [her]126-ally far from [the Frys]111-the frys ' gate when [she]126-ally was stopped by [old Mrs. Sollas]127-old mrs. sollas , who was [a great talker]1123-a great talker , and spoke very slowly because [she]127-old mrs. sollas had never been able to get used to [her]127-old mrs. sollas new teeth from [Hepburn]4-hepburn . Still , even this respite would not last long ; in another ten minutes [Ally]126-ally would be at the door , and [Charity]69-charity would hear [her]126-ally greeting [Verena]87-verena in [the kitchen]330-the kitchen , and then calling up from the foot of the stairs . Suddenly it became clear that flight , and instant flight , was the only thing conceivable . The longing to escape , to get away from [familiar faces]1125-familiar faces , from places where [she]126-ally was known , had always been strong in [her]126-ally in moments of distress . [She]126-ally had a childish belief in the miraculous power of strange scenes and new faces to transform [her]126-ally life and wipe out bitter memories . But such impulses were mere fleeting whims compared to the cold resolve which now possessed [her]126-ally . [She]126-ally felt [she]126-ally could not remain an hour longer under the roof of [the man who had publicly dishonoured [her]126-ally , and face to face with [the people who would presently be gloating over all the details of]1127-the people who would presently be gloating over all the details of [her]126-ally humiliation]1126-the man who had publicly dishonoured her , and face to face with the people who would presently be gloating over all the details of her humiliation . [Her]126-ally passing pity for [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had been swallowed up in loathing : everything in [her]126-ally recoiled from the disgraceful spectacle of [the drunken old man]1128-the drunken old man apostrophizing [her]126-ally in the presence of a band of [loafers and street - walkers]1129-loafers and street - walkers . Suddenly , vividly , [she]126-ally relived again the horrible moment when [he]64-mr. royall had tried to force [himself]64-mr. royall into [[her]126-ally room]323-her room , and what [she]126-ally had before supposed to be a mad aberration now appeared to [her]126-ally as a vulgar incident in a debauched and degraded life . While these thoughts were hurrying through [her]126-ally [she]126-ally had dragged out [her]126-ally old canvas school - bag , and was thrusting into it a few articles of clothing and the little packet of letters [she]126-ally had received from [Harney]75-harney . From under [her]126-ally pincushion [she]126-ally took the library key , and laid it in full view ; then [she]126-ally felt at the back of a drawer for the blue brooch that [Harney]75-harney had given [her]126-ally . [She]126-ally would not have dared to wear it openly at [North Dormer]1-north dormer , but now [she]126-ally fastened it on [her]126-ally bosom as if it were a talisman to protect [her]126-ally in [her]126-ally flight . These preparations had taken but a few minutes , and when [they]1131-they were finished [Ally Hawes]74-ally was still at [[the Frys]111-the frys ' corner]1132-the frys ' corner talking to [old Mrs. Sollas]127-old mrs. sollas .... [She]74-ally had said to [herself]74-ally , as [she]74-ally always said in moments of revolt : “ [I]74-ally 'll go to [the Mountain]8-the mountain -- [I'll]74-ally go back to [[my]74-ally own folks]2229-my own folks . ”[74-ally] [She]74-ally had never really meant it before ; but now , as [she]74-ally considered [her]74-ally case , no other course seemed open . [She]74-ally had never learned any trade that would have given [her]74-ally independence in [a strange place]1133-a strange place , and [she]74-ally knew no one in [[the big towns]1134-the big towns of [the valley]228-the valley]1135-the big towns of the valley , where [she]74-ally might have hoped to find employment . [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard was still away ; but even had [she]66-miss hatchard been at [North Dormer]1-north dormer [she]66-miss hatchard was [the last person to whom [Charity]69-charity]1137-the last person to whom charity would have turned , since one of the motives urging [her]66-miss hatchard to flight was the wish not to see [Lucius Harney]75-harney . Travelling back from [Nettleton]5-nettleton , in [the crowded brightly - lit train]1138-the crowded brightly - lit train , all exchange of confidence between [them]1139-them had been impossible ; but during [their]1139-them drive from [Hepburn]4-hepburn to [Creston River]20-creston river [she]74-ally had gathered from [Harney]75-harney 's snatches of consolatory talk -- again hampered by [the freckled boy]876-the freckled boy 's presence -- that [he]75-harney intended to see [her]74-ally the next day . At the moment [she]74-ally had found a vague comfort in the assurance ; but in the desolate lucidity of the hours that followed [she]74-ally had come to see the impossibility of meeting [him]75-harney again . [Her]74-ally dream of comradeship was over ; and the scene on [the wharf]1064-the wharf -- vile and disgraceful as it had been -- had after all shed the light of truth on [her]74-ally minute of madness . It was as if [[her]74-ally guardian]305-her guardian 's words had stripped [her]74-ally bare in the face of [the grinning crowd]1143-the grinning crowd and proclaimed to [the world]184-the world the secret admonitions of [her]74-ally conscience . [She]74-ally did not think these things out clearly ; [she]74-ally simply followed the blind propulsion of [her]74-ally wretchedness . [She]74-ally did not want , ever again , to see anyone [she]74-ally had known ; above all , [she]74-ally did not want to see [Harney]75-harney .... [She]74-ally climbed the hill - path behind [the house]171-the house and struck through [the woods]488-the woods by a short - cut leading to [the Creston road]846-the creston road . A lead - coloured sky hung heavily over [the fields]151-the fields , and in [the forest]574-the forest the motionless air was stifling ; but [she]74-ally pushed on , impatient to reach [the road which was the shortest way to [the Mountain]8-the mountain]1150-the road which was the shortest way to the mountain . To do so , [she]74-ally had to follow [the Creston road]846-the creston road for a mile or two , and go within half a mile of [the village]148-the village ; and [she]74-ally walked quickly , fearing to meet [Harney]75-harney . But there was no sign of [him]75-harney , and [she]74-ally had almost reached [the branch road]1153-the branch road when [she]74-ally saw the flanks of [a large white tent projecting through the trees by [the roadside]1155-the roadside]1154-a large white tent projecting through the trees by the roadside . [She]74-ally supposed that [it]1154-a large white tent projecting through the trees by the roadside sheltered [a travelling circus which had come there for [the Fourth]41-the fourth]1156-a travelling circus which had come there for the fourth ; but as [she]74-ally drew nearer [she]74-ally saw , over the folded - back flap , a large sign bearing the inscription , “ Gospel Tent . ”[1158-a young man in a black alpaca coat] [The interior]1157-the interior seemed to be empty ; but [a young man in a black alpaca coat]1158-a young man in a black alpaca coat , [his]1158-a young man in a black alpaca coat lank hair parted over a round white face , stepped from under the flap and advanced toward [her]74-ally with a smile . “ [Sister]128-sister , [[your]128-sister Saviour]2230-your saviour knows everything . Wo n't [you]128-sister come in and lay [your]128-sister guilt before [Him]2230-your saviour ? ”[1158-a young man in a black alpaca coat] [he]1158-a young man in a black alpaca coat asked insinuatingly , putting [his]1158-a young man in a black alpaca coat hand on [her]74-ally arm . [Charity]69-charity started back and flushed . For a moment [she]74-ally thought [the evangelist]1159-the evangelist must have heard a report of the scene at [Nettleton]5-nettleton ; then [she]74-ally saw the absurdity of the supposition . “ [I]74-ally on'y wish't [I]74-ally had any to lay ! ”[74-ally] [she]74-ally retorted , with one of [her]74-ally fierce flashes of self - derision ; and [the young man]173-the young man murmured , aghast : “ Oh , [Sister]128-sister , do n't speak blasphemy .... ”[173-the young man] But [she]74-ally had jerked [her]74-ally arm out of [his]173-the young man hold , and was running up [the branch road]1153-the branch road , trembling with the fear of meeting a familiar face . Presently [she]74-ally was out of sight of [the village]148-the village , and climbing into [the heart of [the forest]574-the forest]1163-the heart of the forest . [She]74-ally could not hope to do the fifteen miles to [the Mountain]8-the mountain that afternoon ; but [she]74-ally knew of [a place half - way to [Hamblin]18-hamblin where [she]74-ally could sleep , and where [no one]1910-no one would think of looking for [her]74-ally]1165-a place half - way to hamblin where she could sleep , and where no one would think of looking for her . It was [a little deserted house on a slope in [one of the lonely rifts of [the hills]150-the hills]1168-one of the lonely rifts of the hills]1167-a little deserted house on a slope in one of the lonely rifts of the hills . [She]74-ally had seen [it]1167-a little deserted house on a slope in one of the lonely rifts of the hills once , years before , when [she]74-ally had gone on a nutting expedition to [the grove of walnuts below]1170-the grove of walnuts below [it]1167-a little deserted house on a slope in one of the lonely rifts of the hills . [The party]1171-the party had taken refuge in [the house]171-the house from a sudden mountain storm , and [she]74-ally remembered that [Ben Sollas]129-ben sollas , who liked [frightening girls]1173-frightening girls , had told [them]1173-frightening girls that it was said to be haunted . [She]74-ally was growing faint and tired , for [she]74-ally had eaten nothing since morning , and was not used to walking so far . [Her]74-ally head felt light and [she]74-ally sat down for a moment by [the roadside]1155-the roadside . As [she]74-ally sat there [she]74-ally heard the click of a bicycle - bell , and started up to plunge back into [the forest]574-the forest ; but before [she]74-ally could move the bicycle had swept around the curve of [the road]160-the road , and [Harney]75-harney , jumping off , was approaching [her]74-ally with outstretched arms . “ [Charity]69-charity ! What on earth are [you]75-harney doing here ? ”[75-harney] [She]74-ally stared as if [he]75-harney were a vision , so startled by the unexpectedness of [his]75-harney being there that no words came to [her]74-ally . “ Where were [you]74-ally going ? Had [you]74-ally forgotten that [I]75-harney was coming ? ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney continued , trying to draw [her]74-ally to [him]75-harney ; but [she]74-ally shrank from [his]75-harney embrace . “ [I]74-ally was going away -- [I]74-ally do n't want to see [you]75-harney -- [I]74-ally want [you]75-harney should leave [me]74-ally alone , ”[74-ally] [she]74-ally broke out wildly . [He]75-harney looked at [her]74-ally and [his]75-harney face grew grave , as though the shadow of a premonition brushed it . “ Going away -- from [me]75-harney , [Charity]69-charity ? ”[75-harney] “ From [everybody]306-everybody . [I]75-harney want [you]74-ally should leave [me]75-harney . ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney stood glancing doubtfully up and down [the lonely forest road]1177-the lonely forest road that stretched away into [sun - flecked distances]1178-sun - flecked distances . “ Where were [you]75-harney going ? ' “[75-harney] [Home]342-home . ” “[75-harney] [Home]342-home -- this way ? ” [She]74-ally threw [her]74-ally head back defiantly . “[75-harney] To [[my]0-i home]1181-my home -- up yonder : to [the Mountain]231-the mountain . ” As [she]74-ally spoke [she]74-ally became aware of a change in [his]75-harney face . [He]75-harney was no longer listening to [her]74-ally , [he]75-harney was only looking at [her]74-ally , with the passionate absorbed expression [she]74-ally had seen in [his]75-harney eyes after [they]2232-they had kissed on the stand at [Nettleton]5-nettleton . [He]75-harney was [the new Harney]75-harney again , [the Harney]75-harney abruptly revealed in that embrace , who seemed so penetrated with the joy of [her]74-ally presence that [he]75-harney was utterly careless of what [she]74-ally was thinking or feeling . [He]75-harney caught [her]74-ally hands with a laugh . “[75-harney] How do [you]1183-you suppose [I]0-i found [you]1183-you ? ” [he]75-harney said gaily . [He]75-harney drew out the little packet of [his]75-harney letters and flourished them before [her]74-ally bewildered eyes . “[1183-you] [You]1183-you dropped them , [[you]1183-you imprudent young person]1184-you imprudent young person -- dropped them in [the middle of [the road]160-the road]1185-the middle of the road , not far from here ; and [the young man who is running [the Gospel tent]1188-the gospel tent]1187-the young man who is running the gospel tent picked them up just as [I]0-i was riding by . ” [He]75-harney drew back , holding [her]74-ally at arm 's length , and scrutinizing [her]74-ally troubled face with the minute searching gaze of [his]75-harney short - sighted eyes . “[1187-the young man who is running the gospel tent] Did [you]1183-you really think [you]1183-you could run away from [me]0-i ? [You]1183-you see [you]1183-you were n't meant to , ” [he]75-harney said ; and before [she]74-ally could answer [he]75-harney had kissed [her]74-ally again , not vehemently , but tenderly , almost fraternally , as if [he]75-harney had guessed [her]74-ally confused pain , and wanted [her]74-ally to know [he]75-harney understood it . [He]75-harney wound [his]75-harney fingers through [hers]74-ally . “[1183-you] Come let 's walk a little . [I]0-i want to talk to [you]1183-you . There 's so much to say . ” [He]75-harney spoke with [a boy]805-a boy 's gaiety , carelessly and confidently , as if nothing had happened that could shame or embarrass [them]2234-them ; and for a moment , in the sudden relief of [her]74-ally release from lonely pain , [she]74-ally felt [herself]74-ally yielding to [his]75-harney mood . But [he]75-harney had turned , and was drawing [her]74-ally back along the road by which [she]74-ally had come . [She]74-ally stiffened [herself]74-ally and stopped short . “[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't go back , ” [she]74-ally said . [They]2234-them looked at [each other]328-each other a moment in silence ; then [he]75-harney answered gently : “[0-i] Very well : let 's go the other way , then . ” [She]74-ally remained motionless , gazing silently at the ground , and [he]75-harney went on : “[0-i] Is n't there [a house up here somewhere]1189-a house up here somewhere -- [a little abandoned house]1190-a little abandoned house -- [you]0-i meant to show [me]0-i some day ? ” Still [she]74-ally made no answer , and [he]75-harney continued , in the same tone of tender reassurance : “[0-i] Let [us]1191-us go [there]185-there now and sit down and talk quietly . ” [He]75-harney took one of the hands that hung by [her]74-ally side and pressed [his]75-harney lips to the palm . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i suppose [I]0-i 'm going to let [you]0-i send [me]0-i away ? Do [you]0-i suppose [I]0-i do n't understand ? ” [The little old house]2236-the little old house -- [its]2236-the little old house wooden walls sun - bleached to a ghostly gray -- stood in [an orchard above [the road]160-the road]2237-an orchard above the road . [The garden palings]2239-the garden palings had fallen , but the broken gate dangled between [its]2236-the little old house posts , and [the path to [the house]171-the house]2240-the path to the house was marked by rose - bushes run wild and hanging their small pale blossoms above the crowding grasses . Slender pilasters and an intricate fan - light framed the opening where the door had hung ; and the door itself lay rotting in the grass , with an old apple - tree fallen across it . Inside , also , wind and weather had blanched everything to the same wan silvery tint ; [the house]171-the house was as dry and pure as the interior of a long - empty shell . But [it]171-the house must have been exceptionally well built , for [the little rooms]2243-the little rooms had kept something of [their]2243-the little rooms human aspect : the wooden mantels with [their]2243-the little rooms neat classic ornaments were in place , and the corners of one ceiling retained a light film of plaster tracery . [Harney]75-harney had found an old bench at the back door and dragged it into [the house]171-the house . [Charity]69-charity sat on it , leaning [her]69-charity head against the wall in a state of drowsy lassitude . [He]75-harney had guessed that [she]69-charity was hungry and thirsty , and had brought [her]69-charity some tablets of chocolate from [his]75-harney bicycle - bag , and filled [his]75-harney drinking - cup from a spring in [the orchard]2245-the orchard ; and now [he]75-harney sat at [her]69-charity feet , smoking a cigarette , and looking up at [her]69-charity without speaking . Outside , the afternoon shadows were lengthening across the grass , and through the empty window - frame that faced [her]69-charity [she]69-charity saw [the Mountain]8-the mountain thrusting its dark mass against a sultry sunset . It was time to go . [She]69-charity stood up , and [he]75-harney sprang to [his]75-harney feet also , and passed [his]75-harney arm through [hers]69-charity with an air of authority . “[0-i] Now , [Charity]69-charity , [you]69-charity 're coming back with [me]0-i . ” [She]69-charity looked at [him]75-harney and shook [her]69-charity head . “[0-i] [I]0-i ai n't ever going back . [You]69-charity do n't know . ” “[69-charity] What do n't [I]0-i know ? ” [She]69-charity was silent , and [he]75-harney continued : “[0-i] What happened on [the wharf]1064-the wharf was horrible -- it 's natural [you]1194-her should feel as [you]1194-her do . But it does n't make any real difference : [you]1194-her ca n't be hurt by such things . [You]1194-her must try to forget . And [you]1194-her must try to understand that [men]210-men ... [men]210-men sometimes ... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know about [men]210-men . That 's why . ” [He]75-harney coloured a little at the retort , as though it had touched [him]75-harney in a way [she]1194-her did not suspect . “[0-i] Well , then ... [you]1194-her must know [one]933-one has to make allowances .... [He]933-one 'd been drinking .... ” “[0-i] [I]0-i know all that , too . [I]0-i 've seen [him]933-one so before . But [he]933-one would n't have dared speak to [me]0-i that way if [he]933-one had n't ... ” “[933-one] Had n't what ? What do [you]1194-her mean ? ” “[1194-her] Had n't wanted [me]0-i to be like [those other girls]1199-those other girls .... ” [She]1194-her lowered [her]1194-her voice and looked away from [him]75-harney . “[1194-her] So 's ' t [he]933-one would n't have to go out .... ” [Harney]75-harney stared at [her]1194-her . For a moment [he]75-harney did not seem to seize [her]1194-her meaning ; then [his]75-harney face grew dark . “[1194-her] The damned hound ! The villainous low hound ! ” [His]75-harney wrath blazed up , crimsoning [him]75-harney to the temples . “[1194-her] [I]0-i never dreamed -- good God , it 's too vile , ” [he]75-harney broke off , as if [his]75-harney thoughts recoiled from the discovery . “[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't never go back [there]185-there , ” [she]1194-her repeated doggedly . “[0-i] No---- ” [he]75-harney assented . There was a long interval of silence , during which [she]1194-her imagined that [he]75-harney was searching [her]1194-her face for more light on what [she]1194-her had revealed to [him]75-harney ; and a flush of shame swept over [her]1194-her . “[0-i] [I]0-i know the way [you]0-i must feel about [me]0-i , ” [she]1194-her broke out , “[0-i] ... telling [you]0-i such things .... ” But once more , as [she]1194-her spoke , [she]1194-her became aware that [he]75-harney was no longer listening . [He]75-harney came close and caught [her]1194-her to [him]75-harney as if [he]75-harney were snatching [her]1194-her from some imminent peril : [his]75-harney impetuous eyes were in [hers]1194-her , and [she]1194-her could feel the hard beat of [his]75-harney heart as [he]75-harney held [her]1194-her against it . “[0-i] Kiss [me]0-i again -- like last night , ” [he]75-harney said , pushing [her]1194-her hair back as if to draw [her]1194-her whole face up into [his]75-harney kiss . XII ONE afternoon toward the end of [August]47-august [a group of girls]2246-a group of girls sat in [a room at [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's]2247-a room at miss hatchard 's in a gay confusion of flags , turkey - red , blue and white paper muslin , harvest sheaves and illuminated scrolls . [North Dormer]1-north dormer was preparing for [its]1-north dormer Old Home Week . That form of sentimental decentralization was still in its early stages , and , precedents being few , and the desire to set an example contagious , the matter had become a subject of prolonged and passionate discussion under [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's roof . The incentive to the celebration had come rather from [those who had left [North Dormer]1-north dormer]2248-those who had left north dormer than from [those who had been obliged to stay [there]185-there]2249-those who had been obliged to stay there , and there was some difficulty in rousing [the village]148-the village to the proper state of enthusiasm . But [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's pale prim drawing - room]2252-miss hatchard 's pale prim drawing - room was the centre of constant comings and goings from [Hepburn]4-hepburn , [Nettleton]5-nettleton , [Springfield]2-springfield and [even more distant cities]2253-even more distant cities ; and whenever [a visitor]2254-a visitor arrived [he]2254-a visitor was led across [the hall]2255-the hall , and treated to a glimpse of [the group of girls]2256-the group of girls deep in [their]2256-the group of girls pretty preparations . “[0-i] All the old names ... all the old names .... ” [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard would be heard , tapping across [the hall]2255-the hall on [her]66-miss hatchard crutches . “[0-i] [Targatt ... Sollas ... Fry]48-targatt ... sollas ... fry : this is [Miss Orma Fry]77-orma fry sewing the stars on the drapery for the organ - loft . Do n't move , [girls]795-girls ... and this is [Miss Ally Hawes]74-ally , [[our]1202-our cleverest needle - woman]1203-our cleverest needle - woman ... and [Miss Charity Royall]69-charity making [our]1202-our garlands of evergreen .... [I]0-i like the idea of its all being homemade , do n't [you]795-girls ? [We]1202-our have n't had to call in any foreign talent : [[my]0-i young cousin]1204-my young cousin [Lucius Harney]75-harney , [the architect]439-the architect -- [you]795-girls know [he]75-harney 's up here preparing a book on [Colonial houses]1206-colonial houses -- [he]75-harney 's taken the whole thing in hand so cleverly ; but [you]795-girls must come and see [his]75-harney sketch for the stage [we]1202-our 're going to put up in [the Town Hall]361-the town hall . ” One of the first results of the Old Home Week agitation had , in fact , been the reappearance of [Lucius Harney]75-harney in [the village street]1114-the village street . [He]75-harney had been vaguely spoken of as being not far off , but for some weeks past [no one]1910-no one had seen [him]75-harney at [North Dormer]1-north dormer , and there was a recent report of [his]75-harney having left [Creston River]20-creston river , where [he]75-harney was said to have been staying , and gone away from [the neighbourhood]398-the neighbourhood for good . Soon after [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's return , however , [he]75-harney came back to [[his]75-harney old quarters]2261-his old quarters in [[her]66-miss hatchard house]1882-her house , and began to take a leading part in the planning of the festivities . [He]75-harney threw [himself]75-harney into the idea with extraordinary good - humour , and was so prodigal of sketches , and so inexhaustible in devices , that [he]75-harney gave an immediate impetus to the rather languid movement , and infected [the whole village]2263-the whole village with [his]75-harney enthusiasm . “[75-harney] [Lucius]75-harney has such a feeling for the past that [he]75-harney has roused [us]1208-us all to a sense of [our]1208-us privileges , ” [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard would say , lingering on the last word , which was a favourite one . And before leading [[her]66-miss hatchard visitor]2264-her visitor back to [the drawing - room]2265-the drawing - room [she]66-miss hatchard would repeat , for the hundredth time , that [she]66-miss hatchard supposed [he]75-harney thought it very bold of little [North Dormer]1-north dormer to start up and have [a Home Week of its own]2266-a home week of its own , when so many bigger places had n't thought of it yet ; but that , after all , Associations counted more than the size of [the population]2267-the population , did n't [they]2268-they ? And of course [North Dormer]2269-north dormer was so full of Associations ... historic , literary ( here a filial sigh for [Honorius]70-honorius hatchard ) and ecclesiastical ... [he]75-harney knew about the old pewter communion service imported from [England]13-england in 1769 , [she]66-miss hatchard supposed ? And it was so important , in a wealthy materialistic age , to set the example of reverting to the old ideals , [the family]2270-the family and [the homestead]2271-the homestead , and so on . This peroration usually carried [her]66-miss hatchard half - way back across [the hall]2255-the hall , leaving [the girls]462-the girls to return to [their]462-the girls interrupted activities . The day on which [Charity Royall]69-charity was weaving hemlock garlands for the procession was the last before the celebration . When [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard called upon the North Dormer maidenhood to collaborate in the festal preparations [Charity]69-charity had at first held aloof ; but it had been made clear to [her]69-charity that [her]69-charity non - appearance might excite conjecture , and , reluctantly , [she]69-charity had joined [the other workers]2274-the other workers . [The girls]462-the girls , at first shy and embarrassed , and puzzled as to the exact nature of the projected commemoration , had soon become interested in the amusing details of [their]462-the girls task , and excited by the notice [they]462-the girls received . [They]462-the girls would not for [the world]184-the world have missed [their]462-the girls afternoons at [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's]771-miss hatchard 's , and , while [they]462-the girls cut out and sewed and draped and pasted , [their]462-the girls tongues kept up such an accompaniment to the sewing - machine that [Charity]69-charity 's silence sheltered itself unperceived under [their]462-the girls chatter . In spirit [she]69-charity was still almost unconscious of the pleasant stir about [her]69-charity . Since [her]69-charity return to [the red house]357-the red house , on the evening of the day when [Harney]75-harney had overtaken [her]69-charity on [her]69-charity way to [the Mountain]231-the mountain , [she]69-charity had lived at [North Dormer]1-north dormer as if [she]69-charity were suspended in the void . [She]69-charity had come back [there]185-there because [Harney]75-harney , after appearing to agree to the impossibility of [her]69-charity doing so , had ended by persuading [her]69-charity that any other course would be madness . [She]69-charity had nothing further to fear from [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall . Of this [she]69-charity had declared [herself]69-charity sure , though [she]69-charity had failed to add , in [his]75-harney exoneration , that [he]75-harney had twice offered to make [her]69-charity [[his]75-harney wife]1917-his wife . [Her]69-charity hatred of [him]75-harney made it impossible , at the moment , for [her]69-charity to say anything that might partly excuse [him]75-harney in [Harney]75-harney 's eyes . [Harney]75-harney , however , once satisfied of [her]69-charity security , had found plenty of reasons for urging [her]69-charity to return . The first , and the most unanswerable , was that [she]69-charity had nowhere else to go . But the one on which [he]75-harney laid the greatest stress was that flight would be equivalent to avowal . If -- as was almost inevitable -- rumours of the scandalous scene at [Nettleton]5-nettleton should reach [North Dormer]1-north dormer , how else would [her]69-charity disappearance be interpreted ? [[Her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian had publicly taken away [her]69-charity character , and [she]69-charity immediately vanished from [[his]75-harney house]2283-his house . [Seekers]130-seekers after motives could hardly fail to draw an unkind conclusion . But if [she]69-charity came back at once , and was seen leading [her]69-charity usual life , the incident was reduced to its true proportions , as the outbreak of [a drunken old man]2284-a drunken old man furious at being surprised in disreputable company . [People]338-people would say that [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had insulted [[his]64-mr. royall ward]2286-his ward to justify [himself]64-mr. royall , and the sordid tale would fall into its place in the chronicle of [his]64-mr. royall obscure debaucheries . [Charity]69-charity saw the force of the argument ; but if [she]69-charity acquiesced it was not so much because of that as because it was [Harney]75-harney 's wish . Since that evening in [the deserted house]2287-the deserted house [she]69-charity could imagine no reason for doing or not doing anything except the fact that [Harney]75-harney wished or did not wish it . All [her]69-charity tossing contradictory impulses were merged in a fatalistic acceptance of [his]75-harney will . It was not that [she]69-charity felt in [him]75-harney any ascendancy of character -- there were moments already when [she]69-charity knew [she]69-charity was the stronger -- but that all the rest of life had become a mere cloudy rim about the central glory of [their]2288-their passion . Whenever [she]69-charity stopped thinking about that for a moment [she]69-charity felt as [she]69-charity sometimes did after lying on the grass and staring up too long at the sky ; [her]69-charity eyes were so full of light that everything about [her]69-charity was a blur . Each time that [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard , in the course of [her]66-miss hatchard periodical incursions into [the work - room]2289-the work - room , dropped an allusion to [[her]66-miss hatchard young cousin]2290-her young cousin , [the architect]439-the architect , the effect was the same on [Charity]69-charity . The hemlock garland [she]69-charity was wearing fell to [her]69-charity knees and [she]69-charity sat in a kind of trance . It was so manifestly absurd that [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard should talk of [Harney]75-harney in that familiar possessive way , as if [she]69-charity had any claim on [him]75-harney , or knew anything about [him]75-harney . [She]69-charity , [Charity Royall]69-charity , was [the only being on earth]2292-the only being on earth who really knew [him]75-harney , knew [him]75-harney from the soles of [his]75-harney feet to the rumpled crest of [his]75-harney hair , knew the shifting lights in [his]75-harney eyes , and the inflexions of [his]75-harney voice , and the things [he]75-harney liked and disliked , and everything there was to know about [him]75-harney , as minutely and yet unconsciously as [a child]224-a child knows the walls of [the room it wakes up in every morning]2294-the room it wakes up in every morning . It was this fact , which [nobody about [her]69-charity]2295-nobody about her guessed , or would have understood , that made [her]69-charity life something apart and inviolable , as if nothing had any power to hurt or disturb [her]69-charity as long as [her]69-charity secret was safe . [The room in which [the girls]462-the girls sat]2296-the room in which the girls sat was [the one which had been [[Harney]75-harney 's bedroom]2299-harney 's bedroom]2298-the one which had been harney 's bedroom . [He]75-harney had been sent [upstairs]424-upstairs , to make room for [the Home Week workers]2301-the home week workers ; but the furniture had not been moved , and as [Charity]69-charity sat there [she]69-charity had perpetually before [her]69-charity the vision [she]69-charity had looked in on from [the midnight garden]2302-the midnight garden . The table at which [Harney]75-harney had sat was the one about which [the girls]462-the girls were gathered ; and [her]69-charity own seat was near the bed on which [she]69-charity had seen [him]75-harney lying . Sometimes , when [the others]2304-the others were not looking , [she]69-charity bent over as if to pick up something , and laid [her]69-charity cheek for a moment against the pillow . Toward sunset [the girls]462-the girls disbanded . [Their]462-the girls work was done , and the next morning at daylight the draperies and garlands were to be nailed up , and the illuminated scrolls put in place in [the Town Hall]361-the town hall . [The first guests]2307-the first guests were to drive over from [Hepburn]4-hepburn in time for the midday banquet under a tent in [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's field]2308-miss hatchard 's field ; and after that the ceremonies were to begin . [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard [, pale with fatigue and excitement]2309-, pale with fatigue and excitement , thanked [[her]66-miss hatchard young assistants]2310-her young assistants , and stood in [the porch]320-the porch , leaning on [her]66-miss hatchard crutches and waving a farewell as [she]66-miss hatchard watched [them]2310-her young assistants troop away down [the street]163-the street . [Charity]69-charity had slipped off among the first ; but at the gate [she]69-charity heard [Ally Hawes]74-ally calling after [her]69-charity , and reluctantly turned . “[75-harney] Will [you]1209-you come over now and try on [your]1209-you dress ? ” [Ally]74-ally asked , looking at [her]1209-you with wistful admiration . “[1209-you] [I]0-i want to be sure the sleeves do n't ruck up the same as they did yesterday . ” [Charity]69-charity gazed at [her]74-ally with dazzled eyes . “[0-i] Oh , it 's lovely , ” [she]69-charity said , and hastened away without listening to [Ally]74-ally 's protest . [She]69-charity wanted [her]69-charity dress to be as pretty as the other girls'--wanted it , in fact , to outshine the rest , since [she]69-charity was to take part in the “[0-i] exercises”--but [she]69-charity had no time just then to fix [her]69-charity mind on such matters .... [She]69-charity sped up [the street]163-the street to [the library]240-the library , of which [she]69-charity had the key about [her]69-charity neck . From [the passage at the back]2315-the passage at the back [she]69-charity dragged forth [a bicycle]2316-a bicycle , and guided [it]2316-a bicycle to the edge of [the street]163-the street . [She]69-charity looked about to see if [any of [the girls]462-the girls]2318-any of the girls were approaching ; but [they]2318-any of the girls had drifted away together toward [the Town Hall]361-the town hall , and [she]69-charity sprang into the saddle and turned toward [the Creston road]846-the creston road . There was an almost continual descent to [Creston]19-creston , and with [her]69-charity feet against the pedals [she]69-charity floated through the still evening air like one of the hawks [she]69-charity had often watched slanting downward on motionless wings . Twenty minutes from the time when [she]69-charity had left [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's door [she]69-charity was turning up [the wood - road on which [Harney]75-harney had overtaken [her]69-charity on the day of [her]69-charity flight]2322-the wood - road on which harney had overtaken her on the day of her flight ; and a few minutes afterward [she]69-charity had jumped from [her]69-charity bicycle at the gate of [the deserted house]2287-the deserted house . In the gold - powdered sunset [it]2324-it looked more than ever like some frail shell dried and washed by many seasons ; but at the back , [whither Charity]69-charity advanced , drawing [her]69-charity bicycle after [her]69-charity , there were signs of recent habitation . A rough door made of boards hung in the kitchen doorway , and pushing it open [she]69-charity entered [a room furnished in primitive camping fashion]2325-a room furnished in primitive camping fashion . In the window was a table , also made of boards , with an earthenware jar holding a big bunch of wild asters , two canvas chairs stood near by , and in one corner was a mattress with a Mexican blanket over it . [The room]259-the room was empty , and leaning [her]69-charity bicycle against [the house]171-the house [Charity]69-charity clambered up the slope and sat down on a rock under an old apple - tree . The air was perfectly still , and from where [she]69-charity sat [she]69-charity would be able to hear the tinkle of a bicycle - bell a long way down [the road]160-the road .... [She]69-charity was always glad when [she]69-charity got to [the little house]2329-the little house before [Harney]75-harney . [She]69-charity liked to have time to take in every detail of its secret sweetness -- the shadows of the apple - trees swaying on the grass , the old walnuts rounding their domes below [the road]160-the road , [the meadows]2331-the meadows sloping westward in the afternoon light -- before [his]75-harney first kiss blotted it all out . Everything unrelated to the hours spent in [that tranquil place]2332-that tranquil place was as faint as the remembrance of a dream . The only reality was the wondrous unfolding of [her]69-charity new self , the reaching out to the light of all [her]69-charity contracted tendrils . [She]69-charity had lived all [her]69-charity life among [people whose sensibilities seemed to have withered for lack of use]2333-people whose sensibilities seemed to have withered for lack of use ; and more wonderful , at first , than [Harney]75-harney 's endearments were the words that were a part of them . [She]69-charity had always thought of love as something confused and furtive , and [he]75-harney made it as bright and open as the summer air . On the morrow of the day when [she]69-charity had shown [him]75-harney the way to [the deserted house [he]75-harney had packed up and left [Creston River]20-creston river]2334-the deserted house he had packed up and left creston river for [Boston]39-boston ; but at [the first station]2335-the first station [he]75-harney had jumped on [the train]904-the train with a hand - bag and scrambled up into [the hills]150-the hills . For two golden rainless August weeks [he]75-harney had camped in [the house]171-the house , getting eggs and milk from [the solitary farm in [the valley]228-the valley]2339-the solitary farm in the valley , where [no one]1910-no one knew [him]75-harney , and doing [his]75-harney cooking over a spirit - lamp . [He]75-harney got up every day with the sun , took a plunge in a brown pool [he]75-harney knew of , and spent long hours lying in the scented hemlock - woods above [the house]171-the house , or wandering along [the yoke of [the Eagle Ridge]22-eagle ridge]2343-the yoke of the eagle ridge , far above [the misty blue valleys that swept away east and west between [the endless hills]2345-the endless hills]2344-the misty blue valleys that swept away east and west between the endless hills . And in the afternoon [Charity]69-charity came to [him]75-harney . With part of what was left of [her]69-charity savings [she]69-charity had hired [a bicycle]2316-a bicycle for a month , and every day after dinner , as soon as [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian started to [[his]75-harney office]310-his office , [she]69-charity hurried to [the library]240-the library , got out [her]69-charity bicycle , and flew down [the Creston road]846-the creston road . [She]69-charity knew that [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , like [everyone else in [North Dormer]1-north dormer]2351-everyone else in north dormer , was perfectly aware of [her]69-charity acquisition : possibly [he]64-mr. royall , as well as [the rest of [the village]148-the village]2352-the rest of the village , knew what use [she]69-charity made of it . [She]69-charity did not care : [she]69-charity felt [him]64-mr. royall to be so powerless that if [he]64-mr. royall had questioned [her]69-charity [she]69-charity would probably have told [him]64-mr. royall the truth . But [they]2354-they had never spoken to [each other]328-each other since the night on [the wharf at [Nettleton]5-nettleton]2356-the wharf at nettleton . [He]64-mr. royall had returned to [North Dormer]1-north dormer only on the third day after that encounter , arriving just as [Charity]69-charity and [Verena]87-verena were sitting down to supper . [He]64-mr. royall had drawn up [his]64-mr. royall chair , taken [his]64-mr. royall napkin from the side - board drawer , pulled it out of its ring , and seated [himself]64-mr. royall as unconcernedly as if [he]64-mr. royall had come in from [his]64-mr. royall usual afternoon session at [Carrick Fry 's]88-carrick fry ; and the long habit of [the household]2357-the household made it seem almost natural that [Charity]69-charity should not so much as raise [her]69-charity eyes when [he]64-mr. royall entered . [She]69-charity had simply let [him]64-mr. royall understand that [her]69-charity silence was not accidental by leaving the table while [he]64-mr. royall was still eating , and going up without a word to shut [herself]69-charity into [[her]69-charity room]323-her room . After that [he]64-mr. royall formed the habit of talking loudly and genially to [Verena]87-verena whenever [Charity]69-charity was in [the room]259-the room ; but otherwise there was no apparent change in [their]2360-their relations . [She]69-charity did not think connectedly of these things while [she]69-charity sat waiting for [Harney]75-harney , but they remained in [her]69-charity mind as a sullen background against which [her]69-charity short hours with [him]64-mr. royall flamed out like forest fires . Nothing else mattered , neither the good nor the bad , or what might have seemed so before [she]69-charity knew [him]64-mr. royall . [He]64-mr. royall had caught [her]69-charity up and carried [her]69-charity away into [a new world]2361-a new world , from which , at stated hours , [the ghost of [her]69-charity]2362-the ghost of her came back to perform certain customary acts , but all so thinly and insubstantially that [she]69-charity sometimes wondered that [the people [she]69-charity went about among]2363-the people she went about among could see [her]69-charity .... Behind the swarthy Mountain the sun had gone down in waveless gold . From a pasture up [the slope]278-the slope a tinkle of cow - bells sounded ; a puff of smoke hung over [the farm]2365-the farm in [the valley]228-the valley , trailed on the pure air and was gone . For a few minutes , in the clear light that is all shadow , [fields and woods]2367-fields and woods were outlined with an unreal precision ; then the twilight blotted them out , and [the little house]2329-the little house turned gray and spectral under [its]2329-the little house wizened apple - branches . [Charity]69-charity 's heart contracted . The first fall of night after a day of radiance often gave [her]69-charity a sense of hidden menace : it was like looking out over [the world]184-the world as it would be when love had gone from [it]184-the world . [She]69-charity wondered if some day [she]69-charity would sit in [that same place]2370-that same place and watch in vain for [[her]69-charity lover]2371-her lover .... [His]2371-her lover bicycle - bell sounded down [the lane]2372-the lane , and in a minute [she]69-charity was at the gate and [his]2371-her lover eyes were laughing in [hers]69-charity . [They]2373-they walked back through the long grass , and pushed open the door behind [the house]171-the house . [The room]259-the room at first seemed quite dark and [they]2373-they had to grope [their]2373-they way in hand in hand . Through the window - frame the sky looked light by contrast , and above the black mass of asters in the earthen jar one white star glimmered like a moth . “[0-i] There was such a lot to do at the last minute , ” [Harney]75-harney was explaining , “[0-i] and [I]0-i had to drive down to [Creston]19-creston to meet [someone who has come to stay with [[my]0-i cousin]1884-my cousin for the show]1210-someone who has come to stay with my cousin for the show . ” [He]2371-her lover had [his]2371-her lover arms about [her]69-charity , and [his]2371-her lover kisses were in [her]69-charity hair and on [her]69-charity lips . Under [his]2371-her lover touch things deep down in [her]69-charity struggled to the light and sprang up like flowers in sunshine . [She]69-charity twisted [her]69-charity fingers into [his]2371-her lover , and [they]2373-they sat down side by side on the improvised couch . [She]69-charity hardly heard [his]2371-her lover excuses for being late : in [his]2371-her lover absence a thousand doubts tormented [her]69-charity , but as soon as [he]2371-her lover appeared [she]69-charity ceased to wonder where [he]2371-her lover had come from , what had delayed [him]2371-her lover , who had kept [him]2371-her lover from [her]69-charity . It seemed as if the places [he]2371-her lover had been in , and [the people [he]2371-her lover had been with]2376-the people he had been with , must cease to exist when [he]2371-her lover left [them]2376-the people he had been with , just as [her]69-charity own life was suspended in [his]2371-her lover absence . [He]2371-her lover continued , now , to talk to [her]69-charity volubly and gaily , deploring [his]2371-her lover lateness , grumbling at the demands on [his]2371-her lover time , and good - humouredly mimicking [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's benevolent agitation . “[1212-you] [She]1212-you hurried off [Miles]67-mr. miles to ask [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall to speak at [the Town Hall]361-the town hall tomorrow : [I]0-i did n't know till it was done . ” [Charity]69-charity was silent , and [he]2371-her lover added : “[1212-you] After all , perhaps it 's just as well . [No one else]283-no one else could have done it . ” [Charity]69-charity made no answer : [She]69-charity did not care what part [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian played in the morrow 's ceremonies . Like all the other figures peopling [[her]69-charity meagre world]2378-her meagre world [he]2371-her lover had grown non - existent to [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity had even put off hating [him]2371-her lover . “[283-no one else] Tomorrow [I]0-i shall only see [you]1212-you from far off , ” [Harney]75-harney continued . “[0-i] But in the evening there 'll be the dance in [the Town Hall]361-the town hall . Do [you]1212-you want [me]0-i to promise not to dance with [any other girl]1216-any other girl ? ” [Any other girl]1216-any other girl ? Were there any others ? [She]69-charity had forgotten even that peril , so enclosed did [he]2371-her lover and [she]69-charity seem in [their]2380-they secret world . [Her]69-charity heart gave a frightened jerk . “[1212-you] Yes , promise . ” [He]75-harney laughed and took [her]69-charity in [his]75-harney arms . “[1212-you] [You]1212-you goose -- not even if they 're hideous ? ” [He]75-harney pushed the hair from [her]69-charity forehead , bending [her]69-charity face back , as [his]75-harney way was , and leaning over so that [his]75-harney head loomed black between [her]69-charity eyes and the paleness of the sky , in which the white star floated ... Side by side [they]2380-they sped back along [the dark wood - road]2381-the dark wood - road to [the village]148-the village . A late moon was rising , full orbed and fiery , turning [the mountain ranges]2383-the mountain ranges from fluid gray to a massive blackness , and making the upper sky so light that the stars looked as faint as their own reflections in water . At the edge of [the wood]2384-the wood , half a mile from [North Dormer]1-north dormer , [Harney]75-harney jumped from [[his]75-harney bicycle]2385-his bicycle , took [Charity]69-charity in [his]75-harney arms for a last kiss , and then waited while [she]69-charity went on alone . [They]2380-they were later than usual , and instead of taking [the bicycle]2386-the bicycle to [the library]240-the library [she]69-charity propped it against the back of [the wood - shed]2388-the wood - shed and entered [the kitchen of [the red house]357-the red house]2389-the kitchen of the red house . [Verena]87-verena sat there alone ; when [Charity]69-charity came in [she]87-verena looked at [her]87-verena with mild impenetrable eyes and then took a plate and a glass of milk from the shelf and set them silently on the table . [Charity]69-charity nodded [her]69-charity thanks , and sitting down , fell hungrily upon [her]69-charity piece of pie and emptied the glass . [Her]69-charity face burned with [her]69-charity quick flight through the night , and [her]69-charity eyes were dazzled by the twinkle of the kitchen lamp . [She]69-charity felt like a night - bird suddenly caught and caged . “[1212-you] [He]1217-he ai n't come back since supper , ” [Verena]87-verena said . “[1217-he] [He]1217-he 's down to [the Hall]2255-the hall . ” [Charity]69-charity took no notice . [Her]69-charity soul was still winging through [the forest]574-the forest . [She]69-charity washed [her]69-charity plate and tumbler , and then felt [her]69-charity way up the dark stairs . When [she]69-charity opened [her]69-charity door a wonder arrested [her]69-charity . Before going out [she]69-charity had closed [her]69-charity shutters against the afternoon heat , but they had swung partly open , and a bar of moonlight , crossing [the room]259-the room , rested on [her]69-charity bed and showed a dress of China silk laid out on it in virgin whiteness . [Charity]69-charity had spent more than [she]69-charity could afford on the dress , which was to surpass those of [all the other girls]2067-all the other girls ; [she]69-charity had wanted to let [North Dormer]1-north dormer see that [she]69-charity was worthy of [Harney]75-harney 's admiration . Above the dress , folded on the pillow , was the white veil which [the young women who took part in the exercises]2394-the young women who took part in the exercises were to wear under a wreath of asters ; and beside the veil a pair of slim white satin shoes that [Ally]74-ally had produced from an old trunk in which [she]74-ally stored mysterious treasures . [Charity]69-charity stood gazing at all the outspread whiteness . It recalled a vision that had come to [her]69-charity in the night after [her]69-charity first meeting with [Harney]75-harney . [She]69-charity no longer had such visions ... warmer splendours had displaced them ... but it was stupid of [Ally]74-ally to have paraded all those white things on [her]69-charity bed , exactly as [Hattie Targatt]131-hattie targatt 's wedding dress from [Springfield]2-springfield had been spread out for [the neighbours]2395-the neighbours to see when [she]131-hattie targatt married [Tom Fry]115-mrs. tom fry .... [Charity]69-charity took up the satin shoes and looked at them curiously . By day , no doubt , they would appear a little worn , but in the moonlight they seemed carved of ivory . [She]69-charity sat down on the floor to try them on , and they fitted [her]69-charity perfectly , though when [she]69-charity stood up [she]69-charity lurched a little on the high heels . [She]69-charity looked down at [her]69-charity feet , which the graceful mould of the slippers had marvellously arched and narrowed . [She]69-charity had never seen such shoes before , even in [the shop - windows at [Nettleton]5-nettleton]2396-the shop - windows at nettleton ... never , except ... yes , once , [she]69-charity had noticed a pair of the same shape on [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch . A blush of mortification swept over [her]69-charity . [Ally]74-ally sometimes sewed for [Miss Balch]108-miss balch when that brilliant being descended on [North Dormer]1-north dormer , and no doubt [she]69-charity picked up presents of cast - off clothing : the treasures in the mysterious trunk all came from [the people [she]69-charity worked for]2397-the people she worked for ; there could be no doubt that the white slippers were [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch 's .... As [she]69-charity stood there , staring down moodily at [her]69-charity feet , [she]69-charity heard the triple click - click - click of a bicycle - bell under [her]69-charity window . It was [Harney]75-harney 's secret signal as [he]75-harney passed on [his]75-harney way [home]342-home . [She]69-charity stumbled to the window on [her]69-charity high heels , flung open the shutters and leaned out . [He]75-harney waved to [her]69-charity and sped by , [his]75-harney black shadow dancing merrily ahead of [him]75-harney down [the empty moonlit road]2399-the empty moonlit road ; and [she]69-charity leaned there watching [him]75-harney till [he]75-harney vanished under the Hatchard spruces . [XIII THE Town Hall]51-xiii the town hall was crowded and exceedingly hot . As [Charity]69-charity marched into [it]51-xiii the town hall third in the white muslin file headed by [Orma Fry]77-orma fry , [she]69-charity was conscious mainly of the brilliant effect of the wreathed columns framing the green - carpeted stage toward which [she]69-charity was moving ; and of the unfamiliar faces turning from the front rows to watch the advance of the procession . But it was all a bewildering blur of eyes and colours till [she]69-charity found [herself]69-charity standing at the back of [the stage]2400-the stage , [her]69-charity great bunch of asters and goldenrod held well in front of [her]69-charity , and answering the nervous glance of [Lambert Sollas]132-lambert sollas , [the organist from [[Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles 's church]2402-mr. miles 's church , who had come up from [Nettleton]5-nettleton to play the harmonium and sat behind [it]51-xiii the town hall , [[his]67-mr. miles conductor]2403-his conductor 's eye running over [the fluttered girls]2404-the fluttered girls]2401-the organist from mr. miles 's church , who had come up from nettleton to play the harmonium and sat behind it , his conductor 's eye running over the fluttered girls . A moment later [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles , pink and twinkling , emerged from the background , as if buoyed up on [his]67-mr. miles broad white gown , and briskly dominated the bowed heads in the front rows . [He]67-mr. miles prayed energetically and briefly and then retired , and a fierce nod from [Lambert Sollas]132-lambert sollas warned [the girls]462-the girls that [they]462-the girls were to follow at once with “[1217-he] [Home]342-home , [Sweet Home]52-sweet home . ” It was a joy to [Charity]69-charity to sing : it seemed as though , for the first time , [her]69-charity secret rapture might burst from [her]69-charity and flash its defiance at [the world]184-the world . All the glow in [her]69-charity blood , the breath of the summer earth , the rustle of [the forest]574-the forest , the fresh call of birds at sunrise , and the brooding midday languors , seemed to pass into [her]69-charity untrained voice , lifted and led by [the sustaining chorus]2408-the sustaining chorus . And then suddenly the song was over , and after an uncertain pause , during which [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's pearl - grey gloves started a furtive signalling down [the hall]2255-the hall , [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , emerging in turn , ascended [the steps of the stage]2410-the steps of the stage and appeared behind the flower - wreathed desk . [He]67-mr. miles passed close to [Charity]69-charity , and [she]69-charity noticed that [his]67-mr. miles gravely set face wore the look of majesty that used to awe and fascinate [her]69-charity childhood .
