[His]67-mr. miles frock - coat had been carefully brushed and ironed , and the ends of [his]67-mr. miles narrow black tie were so nearly even that the tying must have cost [him]67-mr. miles a protracted struggle . [His]67-mr. miles appearance struck [her]69-charity all the more because it was the first time [she]69-charity had looked [him]67-mr. miles full in the face since the night at [Nettleton]5-nettleton , and nothing in [his]67-mr. miles grave and impressive demeanour revealed a trace of the lamentable figure on [the wharf]1064-the wharf . [He]67-mr. miles stood a moment behind the desk , resting [his]67-mr. miles finger - tips against it , and bending slightly toward [[his]67-mr. miles audience]2412-his audience ; then [he]67-mr. miles straightened [himself]67-mr. miles and began . At first [she]69-charity paid no heed to what [he]67-mr. miles was saying : only fragments of sentences , sonorous quotations , allusions to [illustrious men]2413-illustrious men , including the obligatory tribute to [Honorius Hatchard]70-honorius hatchard , drifted past [her]69-charity inattentive ears . [She]69-charity was trying to discover [Harney]75-harney among [the notable people in the front row]2414-the notable people in the front row ; but [he]75-harney was nowhere near [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard , who , crowned by a pearl - grey hat that matched [her]66-miss hatchard gloves , sat just below the desk , supported by [Mrs. Miles]110-mrs. miles and [an important - looking unknown lady]2415-an important - looking unknown lady . [Charity]69-charity was near one end of [the stage]2400-the stage , and from where [she]69-charity sat the other end of the first row of seats was cut off by the screen of foliage masking the harmonium . The effort to see [Harney]75-harney around the corner of the screen , or through its interstices , made [her]69-charity unconscious of everything else ; but the effort was unsuccessful , and gradually [she]69-charity found [her]69-charity attention arrested by [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian 's discourse . [She]69-charity had never heard [him]75-harney speak in public before , but [she]69-charity was familiar with the rolling music of [his]75-harney voice when [he]75-harney read aloud , or held forth to [the selectmen]1924-the selectmen about the stove at [Carrick Fry 's]88-carrick fry . Today [his]75-harney inflections were richer and graver than [she]69-charity had ever known them : [he]75-harney spoke slowly , with pauses that seemed to invite [[his]75-harney hearers]2419-his hearers to silent participation in [his]75-harney thought ; and [Charity]69-charity perceived a light of response in [their]2419-his hearers faces . [He]75-harney was nearing the end of [his]75-harney address ... “[1217-he] Most of [you]1220-you , ” [he]75-harney said , “[1217-he] [most of [you]1220-you who have returned [here]1923-here today , to take contact with [this little place]1223-this little place for a brief hour]1221-most of you who have returned here today , to take contact with this little place for a brief hour , have come only on a pious pilgrimage , and will go back presently to [busy cities]1224-busy cities and lives full of larger duties . But that is not the only way of coming back to [North Dormer]1-north dormer . [Some of [us]1226-us , who went out from [here]1923-here in [our]1226-us youth]1225-some of us , who went out from here in our youth ... went out , like [you]1220-you , to [busy cities]1224-busy cities and larger duties ... have come back in another way -- come back for good . [I]0-i am one of those , as many of [you]1220-you know .... ” [He]0-i paused , and there was a sense of suspense in [the listening hall]2420-the listening hall . “[0-i] [My]0-i history is without interest , but it has its lesson : not so much for [those of [you]1220-you who have already made [your]1220-you lives in [other places]1230-other places , as for [the young men who are perhaps planning even now to leave [these quiet hills]1232-these quiet hills and go down into the struggle]1231-the young men who are perhaps planning even now to leave these quiet hills and go down into the struggle]1229-those of you who have already made your lives in other places , as for the young men who are perhaps planning even now to leave these quiet hills and go down into the struggle . Things [they]1231-the young men who are perhaps planning even now to leave these quiet hills and go down into the struggle can not foresee may send [some of [those young men]1234-those young men]1233-some of those young men back some day to [the little township]1235-the little township and [the old homestead]1236-the old homestead : [they]1233-some of those young men may come back for good .... ” [He]0-i looked about [him]0-i , and repeated gravely : “[1233-some of those young men] For GOOD . There 's the point [I]0-i want to make ... [North Dormer]1-north dormer is [a poor little place]1237-a poor little place , almost lost in [a mighty landscape]1238-a mighty landscape : perhaps , by this time , [it]1-north dormer might have been [a bigger place]1239-a bigger place , and more in scale with [the landscape]516-the landscape , if [those who had to come back]1241-those who had to come back had come with that feeling in [their]1241-those who had to come back minds -- that [they]1241-those who had to come back wanted to come back for GOOD ... and not for bad ... or just for indifference .... “ [Gentlemen]2421-gentlemen , let [us]2422-us look at things as [they]2423-they are . [Some of [us]2422-us]2424-some of us have come back to [[our]2422-us native town]2425-our native town because [we]2422-us 'd failed to get on elsewhere . One way or other , things had gone wrong with [us]2422-us ... what [we]2422-us 'd dreamed of had n't come true . But the fact that [we]2422-us had failed elsewhere is no reason why [we]2422-us should fail here . [Our]2422-us very experiments in larger places , even if [they]2423-they were unsuccessful , ought to have helped [us]2422-us to make [North Dormer]1-north dormer [a larger place]2426-a larger place ... and [[you]2421-gentlemen young men who [are preparing even now to follow the call of ambition]2428-are preparing even now to follow the call of ambition , and turn [your]2421-gentlemen back on [the old homes]2429-the old homes]2427-you young men who are preparing even now to follow the call of ambition , and turn your back on the old homes -- well , let [me]1242-i say this to [you]2421-gentlemen , that if ever [you]2421-gentlemen do come back to [them]2429-the old homes it 's worth while to come back to [them]2429-the old homes for [their]2429-the old homes good .... And to do that , [you]2421-gentlemen must keep on loving [them]2429-the old homes while [you]2421-gentlemen 're away from [them]2429-the old homes ; and even if [you]2421-gentlemen come back against [your]2421-gentlemen will -- and thinking it 's all a bitter mistake of Fate or [Providence]53-providence -- [you]2421-gentlemen must try to make the best of it , and to make the best of [your old town]2430-your old town ; and after a while -- well , [ladies]2431-ladies and [gentlemen]2421-gentlemen , [I]1242-i give [you]2421-gentlemen [my]1242-i recipe for what it 's worth ; after a while , [I]1242-i believe [you]2421-gentlemen 'll be able to say , as [I]1242-i can say today : ' [I]1242-i 'm glad [I]1242-i 'm [here]1923-here . ' Believe [me]1242-i , all of [you]2421-gentlemen , the best way to help [the places [we]2435-we live in]2434-the places we live in is to be glad [we]2435-we live [there]185-there . ”[1242-i] [He]1242-i stopped , and a murmur of emotion and surprise ran through [the audience]1243-the audience . It was not in the least what [they]1243-the audience had expected , but it moved [them]1243-the audience more than what [they]1243-the audience had expected would have moved [them]1243-the audience . “ Hear , hear ! ”[1245-they] a voice cried out in the middle of [the hall]2255-the hall . An outburst of cheers caught up the cry , and as [they]1245-they subsided [Charity]69-charity heard [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles saying to [someone near [him]67-mr. miles]1246-someone near him : “ That was [a MAN]322-a man talking---- ”[67-mr. miles] [He]67-mr. miles wiped [his]67-mr. miles spectacles . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had stepped back from the desk , and taken [his]64-mr. royall seat in the row of chairs in front of the harmonium . [A dapper white - haired gentleman]1247-a dapper white - haired gentleman -- [a distant Hatchard]1248-a distant hatchard -- succeeded [him]67-mr. miles behind the goldenrod , and began to say beautiful things about the old oaken bucket , [patient white - haired mothers]1249-patient white - haired mothers , and where [the boys]1250-the boys used to go nutting ... and [Charity]69-charity began again to search for [Harney]75-harney .... Suddenly [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall pushed back [his]64-mr. royall seat , and one of the maple branches in front of the harmonium collapsed with a crash . It uncovered the end of the first row and in one of the seats [Charity]69-charity saw [Harney]75-harney , and in the next [a lady whose face was turned toward [him]67-mr. miles , and almost hidden by the brim of [her]1251-a lady whose face was turned toward him , and almost hidden by the brim of her drooping hat drooping hat]1251-a lady whose face was turned toward him , and almost hidden by the brim of her drooping hat . [Charity]69-charity did not need to see the face . [She]69-charity knew at a glance [the slim figure , the fair hair heaped up under the hat - brim]1252-the slim figure , the fair hair heaped up under the hat - brim , the long pale wrinkled gloves with bracelets slipping over them . At the fall of the branch [Miss Balch]108-miss balch turned [her]108-miss balch head toward the stage , and in [her]108-miss balch pretty thin - lipped smile there lingered the reflection of something [[her]108-miss balch neighbour]1253-her neighbour had been whispering to [her]108-miss balch .... [Someone]1049-someone came forward to replace the fallen branch , and [Miss Balch]108-miss balch and [Harney]75-harney were once more hidden . But to [Charity]69-charity the vision of [their]1255-their two faces had blotted out everything . In a flash [they]1255-their had shown [her]69-charity the bare reality of [her]69-charity situation . Behind the frail screen of [[her]69-charity lover]2371-her lover 's caresses was the whole inscrutable mystery of [his]2371-her lover life : [his]2371-her lover relations with [other people]969-other people -- with [other women]1258-other women -- [his]2371-her lover opinions , [his]2371-her lover prejudices , [his]2371-her lover principles , the net of influences and interests and ambitions in which [every man]1259-every man 's life is entangled . Of all these [she]69-charity knew nothing , except what [he]2371-her lover had told [her]69-charity of [his]2371-her lover architectural aspirations . [She]69-charity had always dimly guessed [him]2371-her lover to be in touch with [important people]1260-important people , involved in complicated relations -- but [she]69-charity felt it all to be so far beyond [her]69-charity understanding that the whole subject hung like a luminous mist on the farthest verge of [her]69-charity thoughts . In the foreground , hiding all else , there was the glow of [his]2371-her lover presence , the light and shadow of [his]2371-her lover face , the way [his]2371-her lover short - sighted eyes , at [her]69-charity approach , widened and deepened as if to draw [her]69-charity down into them ; and , above all , the flush of youth and tenderness in which [his]2371-her lover words enclosed [her]69-charity . Now [she]69-charity saw [him]2371-her lover detached from [her]69-charity , drawn back into the unknown , and whispering to [another girl]1261-another girl things that provoked the same smile of mischievous complicity [he]2371-her lover had so often called to [her]69-charity own lips . The feeling possessing [her]69-charity was not one of jealousy : [she]69-charity was too sure of [his]2371-her lover love . It was rather a terror of the unknown , of all the mysterious attractions that must even now be dragging [him]2371-her lover away from [her]69-charity , and of [her]69-charity own powerlessness to contend with [them]1262-them . [She]69-charity had given [him]2371-her lover all [she]69-charity had -- but what was it compared to the other gifts life held for [him]2371-her lover ? [She]69-charity understood now the case of [girls like [herself]69-charity to whom this kind of thing happened]1263-girls like herself to whom this kind of thing happened . [They]1263-girls like herself to whom this kind of thing happened gave all [they]1263-girls like herself to whom this kind of thing happened had , but [their]1263-girls like herself to whom this kind of thing happened all was not enough : it could not buy more than a few moments .... The heat had grown suffocating -- [she]69-charity felt it descend on [her]69-charity in smothering waves , and the faces in [the crowded hall]1264-the crowded hall began to dance like the pictures flashed on the screen at [Nettleton]5-nettleton . For an instant [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's countenance detached itself from the general blur . [He]2371-her lover had resumed [his]2371-her lover place in front of [the harmonium]1265-the harmonium , and sat close to [her]69-charity , [his]2371-her lover eyes on [her]69-charity face ; and [his]2371-her lover look seemed to pierce to the very centre of [her]69-charity confused sensations .... A feeling of physical sickness rushed over [her]69-charity -- and then deadly apprehension . The light of the fiery hours in [the little house]2329-the little house swept back on [her]69-charity in a glare of fear .... [She]69-charity forced [herself]69-charity to look away from [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian , and became aware that the oratory of [the Hatchard cousin]1268-the hatchard cousin had ceased , and that [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles was again flapping [his]67-mr. miles wings . Fragments of [his]2371-her lover peroration floated through [her]69-charity bewildered brain .... “ A rich harvest of hallowed memories .... A sanctified hour to which , in moments of trial , [your]2438-your thoughts will prayerfully return .... And now , [O Lord]2439-o lord , let [us]1269-us humbly and fervently give thanks for this blessed day of reunion , here in [the old home to which [we]1269-us have come back from so far]2440-the old home to which we have come back from so far . Preserve it to [us]1269-us , [O Lord]2439-o lord , in times to come , in all its homely sweetness -- in the kindliness and wisdom of [[its]2440-the old home to which we have come back from so far old people]2442-its old people , in the courage and industry of [its young men]2443-its young men , in the piety and purity of [this group of innocent girls----]2444-this group of innocent girls---- ”[2371-her lover] [He]2371-her lover flapped a white wing in [their]1269-us direction , and at the same moment [Lambert Sollas]132-lambert sollas , with [his]2371-her lover fierce nod , struck the opening bars of “ [Auld Lang Syne]54-auld lang syne . ”[2371-her lover] ... [Charity]69-charity stared straight ahead of [her]69-charity and then , dropping [her]69-charity flowers , fell face downward at [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's feet . XIV [NORTH DORMER]1-north dormer 'S celebration naturally included [the villages attached to [its township]1271-its township]1270-the villages attached to its township , and the festivities were to radiate over [the whole group]1272-the whole group , from [Dormer]17-dormer and [the two Crestons]1273-the two crestons to [Hamblin]18-hamblin , [the lonely hamlet on [the north slope of [the Mountain where the first snow always fell]1276-the mountain where the first snow always fell]1275-the north slope of the mountain where the first snow always fell]1274-the lonely hamlet on the north slope of the mountain where the first snow always fell . On the third day there were speeches and ceremonies at [Creston]19-creston and [Creston River]20-creston river ; on the fourth [the principal performers]1277-the principal performers were to be driven in buck - boards to [Dormer]17-dormer and [Hamblin]18-hamblin . It was on the fourth day that [Charity]69-charity returned for the first time to [the little house]2329-the little house . [She]69-charity had not seen [Harney]75-harney alone since [they]1279-they had parted at [the wood]2384-the wood 's edge the night before the celebrations began . In the interval [she]69-charity had passed through many moods , but for the moment the terror which had seized [her]69-charity in [the Town Hall]361-the town hall had faded to the edge of consciousness . [She]69-charity had fainted because [the hall]2255-the hall was stiflingly hot , and because the speakers had gone on and on .... [Several other people]1283-several other people had been affected by the heat , and had had to leave before the exercises were over . There had been thunder in the air all the afternoon , and [everyone]1284-everyone said afterward that something ought to have been done to ventilate [the hall]2255-the hall .... At the dance that evening -- where [she]69-charity had gone reluctantly , and only because [she]69-charity feared to stay away , [she]69-charity had sprung back into instant reassurance . As soon as [she]69-charity entered [she]69-charity had seen [Harney]75-harney waiting for [her]69-charity , and [he]75-harney had come up with kind gay eyes , and swept [her]69-charity off in a waltz . [Her]69-charity feet were full of music , and though [her]69-charity only training had been with [[the village]148-the village youths]510-the village youths [she]69-charity had no difficulty in tuning [her]69-charity steps to [his]75-harney . As [they]510-the village youths circled about the floor all [her]69-charity vain fears dropped from [her]69-charity , and [she]69-charity even forgot that [she]69-charity was probably dancing in [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch 's slippers . When the waltz was over [Harney]75-harney , with a last hand - clasp , left [her]69-charity to meet [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard and [Miss Balch]108-miss balch , who were just entering . [Charity]69-charity had a moment of anguish as [Miss Balch]108-miss balch appeared ; but it did not last . The triumphant fact of [her]69-charity own greater beauty , and of [Harney]75-harney 's sense of it , swept [her]69-charity apprehensions aside . [Miss Balch]108-miss balch , in an unbecoming dress , looked sallow and pinched , and [Charity]69-charity fancied there was a worried expression in [her]69-charity pale - lashed eyes . [She]69-charity took a seat near [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard and it was presently apparent that [she]69-charity did not mean to dance . [Charity]69-charity did not dance often either . [Harney]75-harney explained to [her]69-charity that [Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard had begged [him]75-harney to give each of [the other girls]497-the other girls a turn ; but [he]75-harney went through the form of asking [Charity]69-charity 's permission each time [he]75-harney led one out , and that gave [her]69-charity a sense of secret triumph even completer than when [she]69-charity was whirling about [the room]259-the room with [him]75-harney . [She]69-charity was thinking of all this as [she]69-charity waited for [him]75-harney in [the deserted house]2287-the deserted house . The late afternoon was sultry , and [she]69-charity had tossed aside [her]69-charity hat and stretched [herself]69-charity at full length on the Mexican blanket because it was cooler indoors than under the trees . [She]69-charity lay with [her]69-charity arms folded beneath [her]69-charity head , gazing out at [the shaggy shoulder of [the Mountain]8-the mountain]1291-the shaggy shoulder of the mountain . The sky behind [it]8-the mountain was full of the splintered glories of the descending sun , and before long [she]69-charity expected to hear [Harney]75-harney 's bicycle - bell in [the lane]2372-the lane . [He]75-harney had bicycled to [Hamblin]18-hamblin , instead of driving [there]185-there with [[his]75-harney cousin]531-his cousin and [[her]531-his cousin friends]1295-her friends , so that [he]75-harney might be able to make [his]75-harney escape earlier and stop on the way back at [the deserted house]2287-the deserted house , which was on [the road to [Hamblin]18-hamblin]1297-the road to hamblin . [They]1298-they had smiled together at the joke of hearing the crowded buck - boards roll by on the return , while [they]1298-they lay close in [their]1298-they hiding above [the road]160-the road . Such childish triumphs still gave [her]69-charity a sense of reckless security . Nevertheless [she]69-charity had not wholly forgotten the vision of fear that had opened before [her]69-charity in [the Town Hall]361-the town hall . The sense of lastingness was gone from [her]69-charity and every moment with [Harney]75-harney would now be ringed with doubt . [The Mountain]8-the mountain was turning purple against a fiery sunset from which [it]1301-it seemed to be divided by a knife - edge of quivering light ; and above this wall of flame the whole sky was a pure pale green , like [some cold mountain lake in shadow]1302-some cold mountain lake in shadow . [Charity]69-charity lay gazing up at [it]8-the mountain , and watching for the first white star .... [Her]69-charity eyes were still fixed on the upper reaches of the sky when [she]69-charity became aware that a shadow had flitted across [the glory - flooded room]1303-the glory - flooded room : it must have been [Harney]75-harney passing the window against the sunset .... [She]69-charity half raised [herself]69-charity , and then dropped back on [her]69-charity folded arms . The combs had slipped from [her]69-charity hair , and it trailed in a rough dark rope across [her]69-charity breast . [She]69-charity lay quite still , a sleepy smile on [her]69-charity lips , [her]69-charity indolent lids half shut . There was a fumbling at the padlock and [she]69-charity called out : “ Have [you]64-mr. royall slipped the chain ? ”[69-charity] The door opened , and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall walked into [the room]259-the room . [She]69-charity started up , sitting back against the cushions , and [they]1305-they looked at [each other]328-each other without speaking . Then [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall closed the door - latch and advanced a few steps . [Charity]69-charity jumped to [her]69-charity feet . “ What have [you]64-mr. royall come for ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity stammered . The last glare of the sunset was on [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian 's face , which looked ash - coloured in the yellow radiance . “ Because [I]64-mr. royall knew [you]69-charity were [here]1923-here , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall answered simply . [She]69-charity had become conscious of the hair hanging loose across [her]69-charity breast , and it seemed as though [she]69-charity could not speak to [him]64-mr. royall till [she]69-charity had set [herself]69-charity in order . [She]69-charity groped for [her]69-charity comb , and tried to fasten up the coil . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall silently watched [her]69-charity . “ [Charity]69-charity , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said , “ [he]64-mr. royall 'll be here in a minute . Let [me]64-mr. royall talk to [you]69-charity first . ”[64-mr. royall] “ [You]64-mr. royall 've got no right to talk to [me]64-mr. royall . [I]64-mr. royall can do what [I]64-mr. royall please . ”[64-mr. royall] “ Yes . What is it [you]64-mr. royall mean to do ? ”[64-mr. royall] “ [I]64-mr. royall need n't answer that , or anything else . ”[64-mr. royall] [He]64-mr. royall had glanced away , and stood looking curiously about [the illuminated room]1308-the illuminated room . Purple asters and red maple - leaves filled the jar on the table ; on a shelf against the wall stood a lamp , the kettle , a little pile of cups and saucers . The canvas chairs were grouped about the table . “ So this is where [you]69-charity meet , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said . [His]64-mr. royall tone was quiet and controlled , and the fact disconcerted [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity had been ready to give [him]64-mr. royall violence for violence , but this calm acceptance of things as they were left [her]69-charity without a weapon . “ See here , [Charity]69-charity -- [you're]69-charity always telling [me]1309-i [I]1309-i 've got no rights over [you]69-charity . There might be two ways of looking at that -- but [I]1309-i ai n't going to argue it . All [I]1309-i know is [I]1309-i raised [you]69-charity as good as [I]1309-i could , and meant fairly by [you]69-charity always except once , for a bad half - hour . There 's no justice in weighing that half - hour against the rest , and [you]69-charity know it . If [you]69-charity had n't , [you]69-charity would n't have gone on living under [[my]1309-i roof]2446-my roof . Seems to [me]1309-i the fact of [your]69-charity doing that gives [me]1309-i some sort of a right ; the right to try and keep [you]69-charity out of trouble . [I]1309-i 'm not asking [you]69-charity to consider any other . ”[1309-i] [She]1309-i listened in silence , and then gave a slight laugh . “ Better wait till [I]1309-i 'm in trouble , ”[1309-i] [she]1309-i said . [He]1310-he paused a moment , as if weighing [her]1309-i words . “ Is that all [your]1309-i answer ? ”[1310-he] “ Yes , that 's all . ”[1310-he] “ Well -- [I'll]1310-he wait . ”[1310-he] [He]1310-he turned away slowly , but as [he]1310-he did so the thing [she]1309-i had been waiting for happened ; the door opened again and [Harney]75-harney entered . [He]75-harney stopped short with a face of astonishment , and then , quickly controlling [himself]75-harney , went up to [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall with a frank look . “ Have [you]64-mr. royall come to see [me]75-harney , [sir]2068-sir ? ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney said coolly , throwing [his]75-harney cap on the table with an air of proprietorship . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall again looked slowly about [the room]259-the room ; then [his]64-mr. royall eyes turned to [the young man]173-the young man . “ Is this [[your]173-the young man house]2448-your house ? ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall inquired . [Harney]75-harney laughed : “ Well -- as much as it 's [anybody]1939-anybody 's . [I]75-harney come here to sketch occasionally . ”[75-harney] “ And to receive [Miss Royall]69-charity 's visits ? ”[64-mr. royall] “ When [she]69-charity does [me]64-mr. royall the honour---- ”[64-mr. royall] “ Is this [the home]2450-the home [you]75-harney propose to bring [her]69-charity to when [you]75-harney get married ? ”[64-mr. royall] There was an immense and oppressive silence . [Charity]69-charity , quivering with anger , started forward , and then stood silent , too humbled for speech . [Harney]75-harney 's eyes had dropped under [the old man]1313-the old man 's gaze ; but [he]75-harney raised them presently , and looking steadily at [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , said : “ [Miss Royall]69-charity is not [a child]224-a child . Is n't it rather absurd to talk of [her]69-charity as if [she]69-charity were ? [I]75-harney believe [she]69-charity considers [herself]69-charity free to come and go as [she]69-charity pleases , without any questions from [anyone]260-anyone . ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney paused and added : “ [I]75-harney 'm ready to answer any [she]69-charity wishes to ask [me]75-harney . ”[75-harney] [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall turned to [her]69-charity . “ Ask [him]75-harney when [he]75-harney 's going to marry [you]69-charity , then---- ”[64-mr. royall] There was another silence , and [he]75-harney laughed in [his]75-harney turn -- a broken laugh , with a scraping sound in it . “ [You]69-charity darsn't ! ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney shouted out with sudden passion . [He]75-harney went close up to [Charity]69-charity , [his]75-harney right arm lifted , not in menace but in tragic exhortation . “ [You]69-charity darsn't , and [you]69-charity know it -- and [you]69-charity know why ! ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney swung back again upon [the young man]173-the young man . “ And [you]69-charity know why [you]69-charity ai n't asked [her]69-charity to marry [you]69-charity , and why [you]69-charity do n't mean to . It 's because [you]69-charity had n't need to ; nor [any other man]2453-any other man either . [I]1315-i 'm the only one that was fool enough not to know that ; and [I]1315-i guess nobody'll repeat [my]1315-i mistake -- not in [Eagle County]16-eagle county , anyhow . [They]2454-they all know what [she]69-charity is , and what [she]69-charity came from . [They]2454-they all know [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother was [a woman of the town from [Nettleton]5-nettleton]2456-a woman of the town from nettleton , that followed [one of [those Mountain fellows]2458-those mountain fellows]2457-one of those mountain fellows up to [[his]2457-one of those mountain fellows place]2459-his place and lived [there]185-there with [him]2457-one of those mountain fellows like [a heathen]2461-a heathen . [I]1315-i saw [her]69-charity [there]185-there sixteen years ago , when [I]1315-i went to bring [this child]2463-this child down . [I]1315-i went to save [her]69-charity from the kind of life [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother was leading -- but [I]1315-i 'd better have left [her]69-charity in [the kennel [she]69-charity came from]2465-the kennel she came from .... ”[1315-i] [He]1315-i paused and stared darkly at [the two young people]1316-the two young people , and out beyond [them]1316-the two young people , at [the menacing Mountain with [its]1317-the menacing mountain with its rim of fire rim of fire]1317-the menacing mountain with its rim of fire ; then [he]1315-i sat down beside the table on which [they]1316-the two young people had so often spread [their]1316-the two young people rustic supper , and covered [his]1315-i face with [his]1315-i hands . [Harney]75-harney leaned in the window , a frown on [his]75-harney face : [he]75-harney was twirling between [his]75-harney fingers a small package that dangled from a loop of string .... [Charity]69-charity heard [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall draw a hard breath or two , and [his]75-harney shoulders shook a little . Presently [he]75-harney stood up and walked across [the room]259-the room . [He]75-harney did not look again at [the young people]190-the young people : [they]190-the young people saw [him]75-harney feel [his]75-harney way to the door and fumble for the latch ; and then [he]75-harney went out into the darkness . After [he]75-harney had gone there was a long silence . [Charity]69-charity waited for [Harney]75-harney to speak ; but [he]75-harney seemed at first not to find anything to say . At length [he]75-harney broke out irrelevantly : “ [I]75-harney wonder how [he]75-harney found out ? ”[75-harney] [She]69-charity made no answer and [he]75-harney tossed down the package [he]75-harney had been holding , and went up to [her]69-charity . “ [I]69-charity 'm so sorry , [dear]2466-dear ... that this should have happened .... ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity threw [her]69-charity head back proudly . “ [I]69-charity ai n't ever been sorry -- not a minute ! ”[69-charity] “ No . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity waited to be caught into [his]75-harney arms , but [he]75-harney turned away from [her]69-charity irresolutely . The last glow was gone from behind [the Mountain]231-the mountain . Everything in [the room]259-the room had turned grey and indistinct , and an autumnal dampness crept up from the hollow below [the orchard]2245-the orchard , laying its cold touch on [their]1323-their flushed faces . [Harney]75-harney walked the length of [the room]259-the room , and then turned back and sat down at the table . “ Come , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney said imperiously . [She]69-charity sat down beside [him]75-harney , and [he]75-harney untied the string about the package and spread out a pile of sandwiches . “ [I]75-harney stole them from the love - feast at [Hamblin]18-hamblin , ”[75-harney] [he]75-harney said with a laugh , pushing them over to [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity laughed too , and took one , and began to eat . “ Did n't [you]75-harney make the tea ? ”[69-charity] “ No , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said . “ [I]69-charity forgot---- ”[69-charity] “ Oh , well -- it 's too late to boil the water now . ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney said nothing more , and sitting opposite to [each other]328-each other [they]1323-their went on silently eating the sandwiches . Darkness had descended in [the little room]1326-the little room , and [Harney]75-harney 's face was a dim blur to [Charity]69-charity . Suddenly [he]75-harney leaned across the table and laid [his]75-harney hand on [hers]69-charity . “ [I]75-harney shall have to go off for a while -- a month or two , perhaps -- to arrange some things ; and then [I]75-harney 'll come back ... and [we]1323-their 'll get married . ”[75-harney] [His]75-harney voice seemed like [a stranger]168-a stranger 's : nothing was left in it of the vibrations [she]69-charity knew . [Her]69-charity hand lay inertly under [his]75-harney , and [she]69-charity left it there , and raised [her]69-charity head , trying to answer [him]75-harney . But the words died in [her]69-charity throat . [They]1323-their sat motionless , in [their]1323-their attitude of confident endearment , as if some strange death had surprised [them]1323-their . At length [Harney]75-harney sprang to [his]75-harney feet with a slight shiver . “ God ! it 's damp -- [we]1323-their could n't have come [here]1923-here much longer . ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney went to the shelf , took down a tin candle - stick and lit the candle ; then [he]75-harney propped an unhinged shutter against the empty window - frame and put the candle on the table . It threw a queer shadow on [his]75-harney frowning forehead , and made the smile on [his]75-harney lips a grimace . “ But it 's been good , though , has n't it , [Charity]69-charity ? ... What 's the matter -- why do [you]69-charity stand there staring at [me]75-harney ? Have n't the days here been good ? ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney went up to [her]69-charity and caught [her]69-charity to [his]75-harney breast . “ And there 'll be [others]2056-others -- lots of [others]2056-others ... jollier ... even jollier ... wo n't [there]185-there , [darling]2471-darling ? ”[75-harney] [He]75-harney turned [her]69-charity head back , feeling for the curve of [her]69-charity throat below the ear , and kissing here there , and on the hair and eyes and lips . [She]69-charity clung to [him]75-harney desperately , and as [he]75-harney drew [her]69-charity to [his]75-harney knees on the couch [she]69-charity felt as if [they]1328-their were being sucked down together into [some bottomless abyss]1329-some bottomless abyss . [XV]133-xv That night , as usual , [they]1328-their said good - bye at [the wood]2384-the wood 's edge . [Harney]75-harney was to leave the next morning early . [He]75-harney asked [Charity]69-charity to say nothing of [their]1328-their plans till [his]75-harney return , and , strangely even to [herself]69-charity , [she]69-charity was glad of the postponement . A leaden weight of shame hung on [her]69-charity , benumbing every other sensation , and [she]69-charity bade [him]75-harney good - bye with hardly a sign of emotion . [His]75-harney reiterated promises to return seemed almost wounding . [She]69-charity had no doubt that [he]75-harney intended to come back ; [her]69-charity doubts were far deeper and less definable . Since the fanciful vision of the future that had flitted through [her]69-charity imagination at [their]1328-their first meeting [she]69-charity had hardly ever thought of [his]75-harney marrying [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity had not had to put the thought from [her]69-charity mind ; it had not been there . If ever [she]69-charity looked ahead [she]69-charity felt instinctively that the gulf between [them]1328-their was too deep , and that the bridge [their]1328-their passion had flung across it was as insubstantial as a rainbow . But [she]69-charity seldom looked ahead ; each day was so rich that it absorbed [her]69-charity .... Now [her]69-charity first feeling was that everything would be different , and that [she]69-charity [herself]69-charity would be a different being to [Harney]75-harney . Instead of remaining separate and absolute , [she]69-charity would be compared with [other people]969-other people , and unknown things would be expected of [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity was too proud to be afraid , but the freedom of [her]69-charity spirit drooped .... [Harney]75-harney had not fixed any date for [his]75-harney return ; [he]75-harney had said [he]75-harney would have to look about first , and settle things . [He]75-harney had promised to write as soon as there was anything definite to say , and had left [her]69-charity [his]75-harney address , and asked [her]69-charity to write also . But the address frightened [her]69-charity . It was in [New York]24-new york , at [a club with a long name in [Fifth Avenue]55-fifth avenue]1332-a club with a long name in fifth avenue : it seemed to raise an insurmountable barrier between [them]1333-their . Once or twice , in the first days , [she]69-charity got out a sheet of paper , and sat looking at it , and trying to think what to say ; but [she]69-charity had the feeling that [her]69-charity letter would never reach its destination . [She]69-charity had never written to anyone farther away than [Hepburn]4-hepburn . [Harney]75-harney 's first letter came after [he]75-harney had been gone about ten days . It was tender but grave , and bore no resemblance to the gay little notes [he]75-harney had sent [her]69-charity by [the freckled boy from [Creston River]20-creston river]1334-the freckled boy from creston river . [He]75-harney spoke positively of [his]75-harney intention of coming back , but named no date , and reminded [Charity]69-charity of [their]1333-their agreement that [their]1333-their plans should not be divulged till [he]75-harney had had time to “ settle things . ”[75-harney] When that would be [he]75-harney could not yet foresee ; but [she]69-charity could count on [his]75-harney returning as soon as the way was clear . [She]69-charity read the letter with a strange sense of its coming from immeasurable distances and having lost most of its meaning on the way ; and in reply [she]69-charity sent [him]75-harney a coloured postcard of [Creston Falls]56-creston falls , on which [she]69-charity wrote : “ With love from [Charity]69-charity . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity felt the pitiful inadequacy of this , and understood , with a sense of despair , that in [her]69-charity inability to express [herself]69-charity [she]69-charity must give [him]75-harney an impression of coldness and reluctance ; but [she]69-charity could not help it . [She]69-charity could not forget that [he]75-harney had never spoken to [her]69-charity of marriage till [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had forced the word from [his]75-harney lips ; though [she]69-charity had not had the strength to shake off the spell that bound [her]69-charity to [him]75-harney [she]69-charity had lost all spontaneity of feeling , and seemed to [herself]69-charity to be passively awaiting a fate [she]69-charity could not avert . [She]69-charity had not seen [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall on [her]69-charity return to [the red house]357-the red house . The morning after [her]69-charity parting from [Harney]75-harney , when [she]69-charity came down from [[her]69-charity room]323-her room , [Verena]87-verena told [her]69-charity that [[her]69-charity guardian]305-her guardian had gone off to [Worcester]57-worcester and [Portland]58-portland . It was the time of year when [he]305-her guardian usually reported to [the insurance agencies [he]305-her guardian represented]1338-the insurance agencies he represented , and there was nothing unusual in [his]305-her guardian departure except its suddenness . [She]69-charity thought little about [him]305-her guardian , except to be glad [he]305-her guardian was not there .... [She]69-charity kept to [herself]69-charity for the first days , while [North Dormer]1-north dormer was recovering from its brief plunge into publicity , and the subsiding agitation left [her]69-charity unnoticed . But [the faithful Ally]74-ally could not be long avoided . For the first few days after the close of the Old Home Week festivities [Charity]69-charity escaped [her]69-charity by roaming [the hills]150-the hills all day when [she]69-charity was not at [her]69-charity post in [the library]240-the library ; but after that a period of rain set in , and one pouring afternoon , [Ally]74-ally , sure that [she]74-ally would find [[her]74-ally friend]1341-her friend indoors , came around to [the red house]357-the red house with [her]74-ally sewing . [The two girls]726-the two girls sat [upstairs]424-upstairs in [[Charity]69-charity 's room]1345-charity 's room . [Charity]69-charity , [her]69-charity idle hands in [her]69-charity lap , was sunk in a kind of leaden dream , through which [she]74-ally was only half - conscious of [Ally]74-ally , who sat opposite [her]74-ally in a low rush - bottomed chair , [her]69-charity work pinned to [her]69-charity knee , and [her]69-charity thin lips pursed up as [she]69-charity bent above it . “ It was [my]69-charity idea running a ribbon through the gauging , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said proudly , drawing back to contemplate the blouse [she]69-charity was trimming . “ It 's for [Miss Balch]108-miss balch : [she]108-miss balch was awfully pleased . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity paused and then added , with a queer tremor in [her]69-charity piping voice : “ [I]69-charity darsn't have told [her]108-miss balch [I]69-charity got the idea from one [I]69-charity saw on [Julia]112-julia . ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity raised [her]69-charity eyes listlessly . “ Do [you]74-ally still see [Julia]112-julia sometimes ? ”[69-charity] [Ally]74-ally reddened , as if the allusion had escaped [her]74-ally unintentionally . “ Oh , it was a long time ago [I]74-ally seen [her]112-julia with those gaugings .... ”[74-ally] Silence fell again , and [Ally]74-ally presently continued : “ [Miss Balch]108-miss balch left [me]74-ally a whole lot of things to do over this time . ”[74-ally] “ Why -- has [she]112-julia gone ? ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity inquired with an inner start of apprehension . “ Did n't [you]74-ally know ? [She]112-julia went off the morning after [they]2472-they had the celebration at [Hamblin]18-hamblin . [I]69-charity seen [her]112-julia drive by early with [Mr. Harney]76-harney . ”[69-charity] There was another silence , measured by the steady tick of the rain against the window , and , at intervals , by the snipping sound of [Ally]74-ally 's scissors . [Ally]74-ally gave a meditative laugh . “ Do [you]69-charity know what [she]112-julia told [me]74-ally before [she]112-julia went away ? [She]112-julia told [me]74-ally [she]112-julia was going to send for [me]74-ally to come over to [Springfield]2-springfield and make some things for [her]112-julia wedding . ”[74-ally] [Charity]69-charity again lifted [her]69-charity heavy lids and stared at [Ally]74-ally 's pale pointed face , which moved to and fro above [her]69-charity moving fingers . “ Is [she]112-julia going to get married ? ”[69-charity] [Ally]74-ally let the blouse sink to [her]74-ally knee , and sat gazing at it . [Her]74-ally lips seemed suddenly dry , and [she]74-ally moistened them a little with [her]74-ally tongue . “ Why , [I]74-ally presume so ... from what [she]112-julia said .... Did n't [you]74-ally know ? ”[74-ally] “ Why should [I]74-ally know ? ”[74-ally] [Ally]74-ally did not answer . [She]74-ally bent above the blouse , and began picking out a basting thread with the point of the scissors . “ Why should [I]69-charity know ? ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity repeated harshly . “ [I]69-charity did n't know but what ... [folks]1922-folks here say [she]112-julia 's engaged to [Mr. Harney]76-harney . ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity stood up with a laugh , and stretched [her]69-charity arms lazily above [her]69-charity head . “ If all [the people]2034-the people got married that [folks]1922-folks say are going to [you]74-ally 'd have [your]74-ally time full making wedding - dresses , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said ironically . “ Why -- don't [you]69-charity believe it ? ”[74-ally] [Ally]74-ally ventured . “ It would not make it true if [I]69-charity did -- nor prevent it if [I]69-charity did n't . ”[69-charity] “ That 's so .... [I]69-charity only know [I]69-charity seen [her]69-charity crying the night of the party because [her]69-charity dress did n't set right . That was why [she]69-charity would n't dance any .... ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity stood absently gazing down at the lacy garment on [Ally]74-ally 's knee . Abruptly [she]69-charity stooped and snatched it up . “ Well , [I]69-charity guess [she]69-charity wo n't dance in this either , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said with sudden violence ; and grasping the blouse in [her]69-charity strong young hands [she]69-charity tore it in two and flung the tattered bits to the floor . “ Oh , [Charity----]102-charity---- ”[74-ally] [Ally]74-ally cried , springing up . For a long interval [the two girls]726-the two girls faced [each other]328-each other across the ruined garment . [Ally]74-ally burst into tears . “ Oh , what 'll [I]74-ally say to [her]69-charity ? What 'll [I]74-ally do ? It was real lace ! ”[74-ally] [she]74-ally wailed between [her]74-ally piping sobs . [Charity]69-charity glared at [her]74-ally unrelentingly . “ [You]74-ally 'd ought n't to have brought it [here]1923-here , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said , breathing quickly . “ [I]69-charity hate [other people]969-other people 's clothes -- it 's just as if [they]969-other people was there [themselves]969-other people . ”[69-charity] [The two]1348-the two stared at [each other]328-each other again over this avowal , till [Charity]69-charity brought out , in a gasp of anguish : “ Oh , go -- go -- go -- or [I]69-charity 'll hate [you]74-ally too .... ”[69-charity] When [Ally]74-ally left [her]69-charity , [she]74-ally fell sobbing across [her]74-ally bed . The long storm was followed by a north - west gale , and when it was over , [the hills]150-the hills took on their first umber tints , the sky grew more densely blue , and the big white clouds lay against [the hills]150-the hills like snow - banks . The first crisp maple - leaves began to spin across [[Miss Hatchard]66-miss hatchard 's lawn]1352-miss hatchard 's lawn , and the Virginia creeper on [the Memorial]1353-the memorial splashed [the white porch]1354-the white porch with scarlet . It was a golden triumphant September . Day by day the flame of the Virginia creeper spread to [the hillsides]1355-the hillsides in wider waves of carmine and crimson , the larches glowed like the thin yellow halo about a fire , the maples blazed and smouldered , and the black hemlocks turned to indigo against the incandescence of [the forest]574-the forest . The nights were cold , with a dry glitter of stars so high up that they seemed smaller and more vivid . Sometimes , as [Charity]69-charity lay sleepless on [her]69-charity bed through the long hours , [she]69-charity felt as though [she]69-charity were bound to those wheeling fires and swinging with them around [the great black vault]1357-the great black vault . At night [she]69-charity planned many things ... it was then [she]69-charity wrote to [Harney]76-harney . But the letters were never put on paper , for [she]69-charity did not know how to express what [she]69-charity wanted to tell [him]76-harney . So [she]69-charity waited . Since [her]69-charity talk with [Ally]74-ally [she]69-charity had felt sure that [Harney]76-harney was engaged to [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch , and that the process of “ settling things ”[69-charity] would involve the breaking of this tie . [Her]69-charity first rage of jealousy over , [she]69-charity felt no fear on this score . [She]69-charity was still sure that [Harney]76-harney would come back , and [she]69-charity was equally sure that , for the moment at least , it was [she]69-charity whom [he]76-harney loved and not [Miss Balch]108-miss balch . Yet [the girl]180-the girl , no less , remained [a rival]1359-a rival , since [she]180-the girl represented all the things that [Charity]69-charity felt [herself]69-charity most incapable of understanding or achieving . [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch was , if not [the girl [Harney]76-harney]1360-the girl harney ought to marry , at least the kind of girl it would be natural for [him]76-harney to marry . [Charity]69-charity had never been able to picture [herself]69-charity as [[his]76-harney wife]1917-his wife ; had never been able to arrest the vision and follow it out in its daily consequences ; but [she]69-charity could perfectly imagine [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch in that relation to [him]76-harney . The more [she]69-charity thought of these things the more the sense of fatality weighed on [her]69-charity : [she]69-charity felt the uselessness of struggling against the circumstances . [She]69-charity had never known how to adapt [herself]69-charity ; [she]69-charity could only break and tear and destroy . The scene with [Ally]74-ally had left [her]69-charity stricken with shame at [her]69-charity own childish savagery . What would [Harney]76-harney have thought if [he]76-harney had witnessed it ? But when [she]69-charity turned the incident over in [her]69-charity puzzled mind [she]69-charity could not imagine what [a civilized person]1362-a civilized person would have done in [her]69-charity place . [She]69-charity felt [herself]69-charity too unequally pitted against unknown forces .... At length this feeling moved [her]69-charity to sudden action . [She]69-charity took a sheet of letter paper from [[Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's office]1363-mr. royall 's office , and sitting by the kitchen lamp , one night after [Verena]87-verena had gone to bed , began [her]69-charity first letter to [Harney]76-harney . It was very short : [I]0-i want [you]76-harney should marry [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch if [you]76-harney promised to . [I]0-i think maybe [you]76-harney were afraid [I]0-i 'd feel too bad about it . [I]0-i feel [I]0-i 'd rather [you]76-harney acted right . [Your]76-harney loving CHARITY . [She]69-charity posted the letter early the next morning , and for a few days [her]69-charity heart felt strangely light . Then [she]69-charity began to wonder why [she]69-charity received no answer . One day as [she]69-charity sat alone in [the library]240-the library pondering these things the walls of books began to spin around [her]69-charity , and the rosewood desk to rock under [her]69-charity elbows . The dizziness was followed by a wave of nausea like that [she]69-charity had felt on the day of the exercises in [the Town Hall]361-the town hall . But [the Town Hall]361-the town hall had been crowded and stiflingly hot , and [the library]240-the library was empty , and so chilly that [she]69-charity had kept on [her]69-charity jacket . Five minutes before [she]69-charity had felt perfectly well ; and now it seemed as if [she]69-charity were going to die . The bit of lace at which [she]69-charity still languidly worked dropped from [her]69-charity fingers , and the steel crochet hook clattered to the floor . [She]69-charity pressed [her]69-charity temples hard between [her]69-charity damp hands , steadying [herself]69-charity against the desk while the wave of sickness swept over [her]69-charity . Little by little it subsided , and after a few minutes [she]69-charity stood up , shaken and terrified , groped for [her]69-charity hat , and stumbled out into the air . But the whole sunlit autumn whirled , reeled and roared around [her]69-charity as [she]69-charity dragged [herself]69-charity along the interminable length of [the road]160-the road [home]342-home . As [she]69-charity approached [the red house]357-the red house [she]69-charity saw a buggy standing at the door , and [her]69-charity heart gave a leap . But it was only [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall who got out , [his]64-mr. royall travelling - bag in hand . [He]64-mr. royall saw [her]69-charity coming , and waited in [the porch]320-the porch . [She]69-charity was conscious that [he]64-mr. royall was looking at [her]69-charity intently , as if there was something strange in [her]69-charity appearance , and [she]69-charity threw back [her]69-charity head with a desperate effort at ease . [Their]1372-their eyes met , and [she]69-charity said : “ [You]64-mr. royall back ? ”[69-charity] as if nothing had happened , and [he]64-mr. royall answered : “ Yes , [I]64-mr. royall 'm back , ”[64-mr. royall] and walked in ahead of [her]69-charity , pushing open the door of [[his]64-mr. royall office]310-his office . [She]69-charity climbed to [[her]69-charity room]323-her room , every step of the stairs holding [her]69-charity fast as if [her]69-charity feet were lined with glue . Two days later , [she]69-charity descended from [the train]904-the train at [Nettleton]5-nettleton , and walked out of [the station]2204-the station into [the dusty square]1377-the dusty square . The brief interval of cold weather was over , and the day was as soft , and almost as hot , as when [she]69-charity and [Harney]76-harney had emerged on the same scene on the Fourth of July . In [the square]919-the square [the same broken - down hacks and carry - alls]1379-the same broken - down hacks and carry - alls stood drawn up in a despondent line , and the lank horses with fly - nets over [their]1380-their withers swayed [their]1380-their heads drearily to and fro . [She]69-charity recognized the staring signs over [the eating - houses]1381-the eating - houses and [billiard saloons]1382-billiard saloons , and the long lines of wires on lofty poles tapering down [the main street]920-the main street to [the park]923-the park at [its]923-the park other end . Taking the way the wires pointed , [she]69-charity went on hastily , with bent head , till [she]69-charity reached [a wide transverse street]1385-a wide transverse street with [a brick building]1386-a brick building at the corner . [She]69-charity crossed [this street]1387-this street and glanced furtively up at the front of [the brick building]1388-the brick building ; then [she]69-charity returned , and entered a door opening on [a flight of steep brass - rimmed stairs]1389-a flight of steep brass - rimmed stairs . On [the second landing]1390-the second landing [she]69-charity rang a bell , and [a mulatto girl with a bushy head and a frilled apron]1391-a mulatto girl with a bushy head and a frilled apron let [her]69-charity into [a hall]1392-a hall where a stuffed fox on [his]1391-a mulatto girl with a bushy head and a frilled apron hind legs proffered a brass card - tray to [visitors]1393-visitors . At the back of [the hall]2255-the hall was a glazed door marked : “ [Office]2478-office . ”[121-dr. merkle] After waiting a few minutes in [a handsomely furnished room , with plush sofas surmounted by large gold - framed photographs of [showy young women]1396-showy young women]1395-a handsomely furnished room , with plush sofas surmounted by large gold - framed photographs of showy young women , [Charity]69-charity was shown into [the office]819-the office .... When [she]69-charity came out of the glazed door [Dr. Merkle]121-dr. merkle followed , and led [her]69-charity into [another room]1398-another room , smaller , and still more crowded with plush and gold frames . [She]121-dr. merkle wore a rich black dress , with gold chains and charms hanging from [her]121-dr. merkle bosom . [Her]121-dr. merkle hands were large and smooth , and quick in all [their]1400-their movements ; and [she]121-dr. merkle smelt of musk and carbolic acid . [She]121-dr. merkle smiled on [Charity]69-charity with all [her]121-dr. merkle faultless teeth . “ Sit down , [[my]121-dr. merkle dear]1903-my dear . [This woman with the false hair , the false teeth , the false murderous smile]1401-this woman with the false hair , the false teeth , the false murderous smile -- what was [she]1401-this woman with the false hair , the false teeth , the false murderous smile offering [her]69-charity but immunity from some unthinkable crime ? [Charity]69-charity , till then , had been conscious only of a vague self - disgust and a frightening physical distress ; now , of a sudden , there came to [her]69-charity the grave surprise of motherhood . [She]69-charity had come to [this dreadful place]1402-this dreadful place because [she]69-charity knew of no other way of making sure that [she]69-charity was not mistaken about [her]69-charity state ; and [the woman]648-the woman had taken [her]69-charity for a miserable creature like [Julia]112-julia .... [Her]69-charity last savings had gone in repaying [Ally]74-ally for the cost of [Miss Balch]108-miss balch 's ruined blouse , and [she]69-charity had had to borrow four dollars from [[her]69-charity friend]1341-her friend to pay for [her]69-charity railway ticket and cover [the doctor]1404-the doctor 's fee . [She]69-charity sat with half - closed eyes as [the train]904-the train rushed through the familiar landscape ; and now the memories of [her]69-charity former journey , instead of flying before [her]69-charity like dead leaves , seemed to be ripening in [her]69-charity blood like sleeping grain . [She]69-charity would never again know what it was to feel [herself]69-charity alone . Everything seemed to have grown suddenly clear and simple . [She]69-charity no longer had any difficulty in picturing [herself]69-charity as [[Harney]76-harney 's wife]1413-harney 's wife now that [she]69-charity was [the mother of [[his]76-harney child]1415-his child]1414-the mother of his child ; and compared to [her]69-charity sovereign right [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch 's claim seemed no more than [a girl]144-a girl 's sentimental fancy . That evening , at the gate of [the red house]357-the red house , [she]69-charity found [Ally]74-ally waiting in the dusk . “ [I]74-ally was down at [the post - office]362-the post - office just as [they]362-the post - office were closing up , and [Will Targatt]131-hattie targatt said there was a letter for [you]74-ally , so [I]74-ally brought it . ”[74-ally] [Ally]74-ally held out the letter , looking at [Charity]69-charity with piercing sympathy . Since the scene of the torn blouse there had been a new and fearful admiration in the eyes [she]69-charity bent on [[her]69-charity friend]1341-her friend . [Charity]69-charity snatched the letter with a laugh . “ Oh , thank [you]74-ally -- good - night , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity called out over [her]69-charity shoulder as [she]69-charity ran up [the path]332-the path . [She]69-charity hurried [upstairs]424-upstairs and felt [her]69-charity way into [[her]69-charity dark room]1421-her dark room . [Her]69-charity hands trembled as [she]69-charity groped for the matches and lit [her]69-charity candle , and the flap of the envelope was so closely stuck that [she]69-charity had to find [her]69-charity scissors and slit it open . At length [she]69-charity read : [DEAR CHARITY]69-charity : [I]0-i have [your]69-charity letter , and it touches [me]0-i more than [I]0-i can say . Wo n't [you]69-charity trust [me]0-i , in return , to do [my]0-i best ? There are things it is hard to explain , much less to justify ; but [your]69-charity generosity makes everything easier . All [I]0-i can do now is to thank [you]69-charity from [my]0-i soul for understanding . If ever there is a hope of realizing what [we]1422-we dreamed of [you]69-charity will see [me]0-i back on the instant ; and [I]0-i have n't yet lost that hope . [She]69-charity read the letter with a rush ; then [she]69-charity went over and over it , each time more slowly and painstakingly . It was so beautifully expressed that [she]69-charity found it almost as difficult to understand as [the gentleman]1423-the gentleman 's explanation of the Bible pictures at [Nettleton]5-nettleton ; but gradually [she]69-charity became aware that the gist of its meaning lay in the last few words . “ If ever there is a hope of realizing what [we]1422-we dreamed of ... ”[1423-the gentleman] But then [he]1423-the gentleman was n't even sure of that ? [She]69-charity understood now that every word and every reticence was an avowal of [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch 's prior claim . It was true that [he]1423-the gentleman was engaged to [her]69-charity , and that [he]1423-the gentleman had not yet found a way of breaking [his]1423-the gentleman engagement . As [she]69-charity read the letter over [Charity]69-charity understood what it must have cost [him]1423-the gentleman to write it . [He]1423-the gentleman was not trying to evade an importunate claim ; [he]1423-the gentleman was honestly and contritely struggling between opposing duties . [She]69-charity did not even reproach [him]1423-the gentleman in [her]69-charity thoughts for having concealed from [her]69-charity that [he]1423-the gentleman was not free : [she]69-charity could not see anything more reprehensible in [his]1423-the gentleman conduct than in [her]69-charity own . From the first [she]69-charity had needed [him]1423-the gentleman more than [he]1423-the gentleman had wanted [her]69-charity , and the power that had swept [them]1424-them together had been as far beyond resistance as a great gale loosening the leaves of [the forest]574-the forest .... Only , there stood between [them]1424-them , fixed and upright in the general upheaval , the indestructible figure of [Annabel Balch]65-annabel balch .... Face to face with [his]1423-the gentleman admission of the fact , [she]69-charity sat staring at the letter . A cold tremor ran over [her]69-charity , and the hard sobs struggled up into [her]69-charity throat and shook [her]69-charity from head to foot . For a while [she]69-charity was caught and tossed on great waves of anguish that left [her]69-charity hardly conscious of anything but the blind struggle against [their]1424-them assaults . Then , little by little , [she]69-charity began to relive , with a dreadful poignancy , each separate stage of [her]69-charity poor romance . Foolish things [she]69-charity had said came back to [her]69-charity , gay answers [Harney]76-harney had made , [his]76-harney first kiss in the darkness between the fireworks , [their]1424-them choosing the blue brooch together , the way [he]76-harney had teased [her]69-charity about the letters [she]69-charity had dropped in [her]69-charity flight from [the evangelist]1159-the evangelist . All these memories , and a thousand others , hummed through [her]69-charity brain till [his]76-harney nearness grew so vivid that [she]69-charity felt [his]76-harney fingers in [her]69-charity hair , and [his]76-harney warm breath on [her]69-charity cheek as [he]76-harney bent [her]69-charity head back like a flower . These things were [hers]69-charity ; they had passed into [her]69-charity blood , and become a part of [her]69-charity , [they]1427-they were building [the child]2109-the child in [her]69-charity womb ; it was impossible to tear asunder strands of life so interwoven . The conviction gradually strengthened [her]69-charity , and [she]69-charity began to form in [her]69-charity mind the first words of the letter [she]69-charity meant to write to [Harney]76-harney . [She]69-charity wanted to write it at once , and with feverish hands [she]69-charity began to rummage in [her]69-charity drawer for a sheet of letter paper . But there was none left ; [she]69-charity must go [downstairs]757-downstairs to get it . [She]69-charity had a superstitious feeling that the letter must be written on the instant , that setting down [her]69-charity secret in words would bring [her]69-charity reassurance and safety ; and taking up [her]69-charity candle [she]69-charity went down to [[Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's office]1363-mr. royall 's office . [She]69-charity started back as [their]1433-their eyes met , remembering that [her]69-charity own were red with weeping , and that [her]69-charity face was livid with the fatigue and emotion of [her]69-charity journey . But it was too late to escape , and [she]69-charity stood and looked at [him]64-mr. royall in silence . [He]64-mr. royall had risen from [his]64-mr. royall chair , and came toward [her]69-charity with outstretched hands . [She]69-charity snatched up the paper , [her]69-charity reassurance dissolving under [his]64-mr. royall pitiless gaze , in which [she]69-charity seemed to read the grim perception of [her]69-charity state , and the ironic recollection of the day when , in [that very room]1434-that very room , [he]64-mr. royall had offered to compel [Harney]76-harney to marry [her]69-charity . [His]64-mr. royall look seemed to say that [he]64-mr. royall knew [she]69-charity had taken the paper to write to [[her]69-charity lover]2371-her lover , who had left [her]69-charity as [he]64-mr. royall had warned [her]69-charity [she]69-charity would be left . [She]69-charity remembered the scorn with which [she]69-charity had turned from [him]64-mr. royall that day , and knew , if [he]64-mr. royall guessed the truth , what a list of old scores it must settle . [She]69-charity turned and fled [upstairs]424-upstairs ; but when [she]69-charity got back to [[her]69-charity room]323-her room all the words that had been waiting had vanished .... If [she]69-charity could have gone to [Harney]76-harney it would have been different ; [she]69-charity would only have had to show [herself]69-charity to let [his]76-harney memories speak for [her]69-charity . But [she]69-charity had no money left , and there was [no one from whom [she]69-charity could have borrowed enough for such a journey]1438-no one from whom she could have borrowed enough for such a journey . There was nothing to do but to write , and await [his]76-harney reply . For a long time [she]69-charity sat bent above the blank page ; but [she]69-charity found nothing to say that really expressed what [she]69-charity was feeling .... [Harney]76-harney had written that [she]69-charity had made it easier for [him]76-harney , and [she]69-charity was glad it was so ; [she]69-charity did not want to make things hard . [She]69-charity knew [she]69-charity had it in [her]69-charity power to do that ; [she]69-charity held [his]76-harney fate in [her]69-charity hands . All [she]69-charity had to do was to tell [him]76-harney the truth ; but that was the very fact that held [her]69-charity back .... [Her]69-charity five minutes face to face with [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had stripped [her]69-charity of [her]69-charity last illusion , and brought [her]69-charity back to [North Dormer]1-north dormer 's point of view . Distinctly and pitilessly there rose before [her]69-charity the fate of [the girl who was married “ to make things right]2489-the girl who was married “ to make things right . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity had seen too many village love - stories end in that way . [Poor Rose Coles]134-poor rose coles 's miserable marriage was of the number ; and what good had come of it for [her]134-poor rose coles or for [Halston Skeff]135-halston skeff ? [They]1439-they had hated [each other]328-each other from the day [the minister]2086-the minister married [them]1439-they ; and whenever [old Mrs. Skeff]136-old mrs. skeff had a fancy to humiliate [[her]136-old mrs. skeff daughter - in - law]1442-her daughter - in - law [she]136-old mrs. skeff had only to say : “ Who 'd ever think [the baby]2490-the baby 's only two ?
