Only -- was there no alternative but [Julia]112-julia 's ? [Her]69-charity soul recoiled from the vision of [the white - faced woman among the plush sofas and gilt frames]1443-the white - faced woman among the plush sofas and gilt frames . In the established order of things as [she]69-charity knew them [she]69-charity saw no place for [her]69-charity individual adventure .... [She]69-charity sat in [her]69-charity chair without undressing till faint grey streaks began to divide the black slats of the shutters . Then [she]69-charity stood up and pushed them open , letting in the light . The coming of a new day brought a sharper consciousness of ineluctable reality , and with it a sense of the need of action . [She]69-charity looked at [herself]69-charity in the glass , and saw [her]69-charity face , white in the autumn dawn , with pinched cheeks and dark - ringed eyes , and all the marks of [her]69-charity state that [she]69-charity [herself]69-charity would never have noticed , but that [Dr. Merkle]121-dr. merkle 's diagnosis had made plain to [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity could not hope that those signs would escape [the watchful village]1444-the watchful village ; even before [her]69-charity figure lost its shape [she]69-charity knew [her]69-charity face would betray [her]69-charity . Leaning from [her]69-charity window [she]69-charity looked out on the dark and empty scene ; [the ashen houses with shuttered windows]1445-the ashen houses with shuttered windows , [the grey road]1446-the grey road climbing the slope to [the hemlock belt above [the cemetery]162-the cemetery]1447-the hemlock belt above the cemetery , and the heavy mass of [the Mountain]8-the mountain black against a rainy sky . To the east a space of light was broadening above [the forest]574-the forest ; but over that also the clouds hung . Slowly [her]69-charity gaze travelled across [the fields]151-the fields to [the rugged curve of [the hills]150-the hills]1451-the rugged curve of the hills . [She]69-charity had looked out so often on that lifeless circle , and wondered if anything could ever happen to [anyone who was enclosed in it]1453-anyone who was enclosed in it .... Almost without conscious thought [her]69-charity decision had been reached ; as [her]69-charity eyes had followed the circle of [the hills]150-the hills [her]69-charity mind had also travelled the old round . [She]69-charity supposed it was something in [her]69-charity blood that made [the Mountain]8-the mountain the only answer to [her]69-charity questioning , the inevitable escape from all that hemmed [her]69-charity in and beset [her]69-charity . At any rate it began to loom against the rainy dawn ; and the longer [she]69-charity looked at it the more clearly [she]69-charity understood that now at last [she]69-charity was really going [there]185-there . XVI THE rain held off , and an hour later , when [she]69-charity started , wild gleams of sunlight were blowing across [the fields]151-the fields . After [Harney]76-harney 's departure [she]69-charity had returned [[her]69-charity bicycle]1457-her bicycle to [its owner]1458-its owner at [Creston]19-creston , and [she]69-charity was not sure of being able to walk all the way to [the Mountain]8-the mountain . [The deserted house]2287-the deserted house was on [the road]160-the road ; but the idea of spending the night there was unendurable , and [she]69-charity meant to try to push on to [Hamblin]18-hamblin , where [she]69-charity could sleep under a wood - shed if [her]69-charity strength should fail [her]69-charity . [Her]69-charity preparations had been made with quiet forethought . Before starting [she]69-charity had forced [herself]69-charity to swallow a glass of milk and eat a piece of bread ; and [she]69-charity had put in [her]69-charity canvas satchel a little packet of the chocolate that [Harney]76-harney always carried in [his]76-harney bicycle bag . [She]69-charity wanted above all to keep up [her]69-charity strength , and reach [her]69-charity destination without attracting notice .... Mile by mile [she]69-charity retraced [the road over which [she]69-charity had so often flown to [[her]69-charity lover]2371-her lover]1461-the road over which she had so often flown to her lover . When [she]69-charity reached the turn where [the wood - road]1463-the wood - road branched off from [the Creston highway]1464-the creston highway [she]69-charity remembered [the Gospel tent]1188-the gospel tent -- long since folded up and transplanted -- and [her]69-charity start of involuntary terror when [the fat evangelist]1466-the fat evangelist had said : “ [[Your]69-charity Saviour]2230-your saviour knows everything . Come and confess [your]69-charity guilt . ”[1466-the fat evangelist] There was no sense of guilt in [her]69-charity now , but only a desperate desire to defend [her]69-charity secret from irreverent eyes , and begin life again among [people to whom the harsh code of]1467-people to whom the harsh code of [the village]148-the village was unknown . The impulse did not shape itself in thought : [she]69-charity only knew [she]69-charity must save [[her]69-charity baby]1469-her baby , and hide [herself]69-charity with it somewhere where [no one]1910-no one would ever come to trouble [them]1471-them . [She]69-charity walked on and on , growing more heavy - footed as the day advanced . It seemed a cruel chance that compelled [her]69-charity to retrace every step of the way to [the deserted house]2287-the deserted house ; and when [she]69-charity came in sight of [the orchard]2245-the orchard , and the silver - gray roof slanting crookedly through the laden branches , [her]69-charity strength failed [her]69-charity and [she]69-charity sat down by [the road]160-the road - side . [She]69-charity sat there a long time , trying to gather the courage to start again , and walk past the broken gate and the untrimmed rose - bushes strung with scarlet hips . A few drops of rain were falling , and [she]69-charity thought of the warm evenings when [she]69-charity and [Harney]76-harney had sat embraced in [the shadowy room]1475-the shadowy room , and the noise of summer showers on the roof had rustled through [their]1476-their kisses . At length [she]69-charity understood that if [she]69-charity stayed any longer the rain might compel [her]69-charity to take shelter in [the house]171-the house overnight , and [she]69-charity got up and walked on , averting [her]69-charity eyes as [she]69-charity came abreast of the white gate and [the tangled garden]1478-the tangled garden . The hours wore on , and [she]69-charity walked more and more slowly , pausing now and then to rest , and to eat a little bread and an apple picked up from the roadside . [Her]69-charity body seemed to grow heavier with every yard of the way , and [she]69-charity wondered how [she]69-charity would be able to carry [[her]69-charity child]1479-her child later , if already [he]76-harney laid such a burden on [her]69-charity .... A fresh wind had sprung up , scattering the rain and blowing down keenly from [the mountain]231-the mountain . Presently the clouds lowered again , and a few white darts struck [her]69-charity in the face : it was the first snow falling over [Hamblin]18-hamblin . [The roofs of [the lonely village]1482-the lonely village]1481-the roofs of the lonely village were only half a mile ahead , and [she]69-charity was resolved to push beyond [it]1481-the roofs of the lonely village , and try to reach [the Mountain]231-the mountain that night . [She]69-charity had no clear plan of action , except that , once in [the settlement]1484-the settlement , [she]69-charity meant to look for [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt , and get [him]94-liff hyatt to take [her]69-charity to [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother . [She]69-charity [herself]69-charity had been born as [[her]69-charity own baby]1486-her own baby was going to be born ; and whatever [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother 's subsequent life had been , [she]69-charity could hardly help remembering the past , and receiving [a daughter who was facing the trouble [she]69-charity had known]1488-a daughter who was facing the trouble she had known . Suddenly the deadly faintness came over [her]69-charity once more and [she]69-charity sat down on [the bank]1489-the bank and leaned [her]69-charity head against a tree - trunk . [The long road]1490-the long road and the cloudy landscape vanished from [her]69-charity eyes , and for a time [she]69-charity seemed to be circling about in some terrible wheeling darkness . Then that too faded . [She]69-charity opened [her]69-charity eyes , and saw a buggy drawn up beside [her]69-charity , and [a man who had jumped down from it and was gazing at [her]69-charity with a puzzled face]1491-a man who had jumped down from it and was gazing at her with a puzzled face . Slowly consciousness came back , and [she]69-charity saw that [the man]1492-the man was [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt . [She]69-charity was dimly aware that [he]1491-a man who had jumped down from it and was gazing at her with a puzzled face was asking [her]69-charity something , and [she]69-charity looked at [him]1491-a man who had jumped down from it and was gazing at her with a puzzled face in silence , trying to find strength to speak . At length [her]69-charity voice stirred in [her]69-charity throat , and [she]69-charity said in a whisper : “ [I]69-charity 'm going up [the Mountain]231-the mountain . ”[69-charity] “ Up [the Mountain]8-the mountain ? ”[1491-a man who had jumped down from it and was gazing at her with a puzzled face] [he]1491-a man who had jumped down from it and was gazing at her with a puzzled face repeated , drawing aside a little ; and as [he]1491-a man who had jumped down from it and was gazing at her with a puzzled face moved [she]69-charity saw behind [him]1491-a man who had jumped down from it and was gazing at her with a puzzled face , in the buggy , [a heavily coated figure with a familiar pink face and gold spectacles on the bridge of a Grecian nose]1493-a heavily coated figure with a familiar pink face and gold spectacles on the bridge of a grecian nose . “ [Charity]69-charity ! What on earth are [you]69-charity doing here ? ”[67-mr. miles] [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles exclaimed , throwing the reins on the horse 's back and scrambling down from the buggy . [She]69-charity lifted [her]69-charity heavy eyes to [his]67-mr. miles . “ [I]69-charity 'm going to see [[my]69-charity mother]2023-my mother . ”[69-charity] [The two men]728-the two men glanced at [each other]328-each other , and for a moment [neither of them]838-neither of them spoke . Then [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles said : “ [You]69-charity look ill , [[my]67-mr. miles dear]1903-my dear , and it 's a long way . Do [you]69-charity think it 's wise ? ”[67-mr. miles] [Charity]69-charity stood up . “ [I]67-mr. miles 've got to go to [her]2023-my mother . ”[67-mr. miles] A vague mirthless grin contracted [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt 's face , and [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles again spoke uncertainly . “ [You]69-charity know , then -- [you'd]69-charity been told ? ”[67-mr. miles] [She]69-charity stared at [him]67-mr. miles . “ [I]69-charity do n't know what [you]67-mr. miles mean . [I]69-charity want to go to [her]2023-my mother . ”[69-charity] [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles was examining [her]69-charity thoughtfully . [She]69-charity fancied [she]69-charity saw a change in [his]67-mr. miles expression , and the blood rushed to [her]69-charity forehead . “ [I]69-charity just want to go to [her]2023-my mother , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity repeated . [He]67-mr. miles laid [his]67-mr. miles hand on [her]69-charity arm . “ [[My]67-mr. miles child]1875-my child , [[your]1875-my child mother]2497-your mother is dying . [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt came down to fetch [me]67-mr. miles .... Get in and come with [us]1497-us . ”[67-mr. miles] [He]67-mr. miles helped [her]69-charity up to the seat at [his]67-mr. miles side , [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt clambered in at the back , and [they]1497-us drove off toward [Hamblin]18-hamblin . At first [Charity]69-charity had hardly grasped what [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles was saying ; the physical relief of finding [herself]69-charity seated in [the buggy]540-the buggy , and securely on [[her]69-charity road]1499-her road to [the Mountain]231-the mountain , effaced the impression of [his]67-mr. miles words . But as [her]69-charity head cleared [she]69-charity began to understand . [She]69-charity knew [the Mountain]231-the mountain had but the most infrequent intercourse with [the valleys]2043-the valleys ; [she]69-charity had often enough heard it said that [no one]1910-no one ever went up there except [the minister]2086-the minister , when [someone]1049-someone was dying . And now it was [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother who was dying ... and [she]69-charity would find [herself]69-charity as much alone on [the Mountain]231-the mountain as anywhere else in [the world]184-the world . The sense of unescapable isolation was all [she]69-charity could feel for the moment ; then [she]69-charity began to wonder at the strangeness of its being [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles who had undertaken to perform this grim errand . [He]67-mr. miles did not seem in the least like [the kind of man who would care to go up [the Mountain]231-the mountain]1509-the kind of man who would care to go up the mountain . But here [he]67-mr. miles was at [her]69-charity side , guiding the horse with a firm hand , and bending on [her]69-charity the kindly gleam of [his]67-mr. miles spectacles , as if there were nothing unusual in [their]1511-their being together in such circumstances . For a while [she]69-charity found it impossible to speak , and [he]67-mr. miles seemed to understand this , and made no attempt to question [her]69-charity . But presently [she]69-charity felt [her]69-charity tears rise and flow down over [her]69-charity drawn cheeks ; and [he]67-mr. miles must have seen them too , for [he]67-mr. miles laid [his]67-mr. miles hand on [hers]69-charity , and said in a low voice : “ Wo n't [you]69-charity tell [me]67-mr. miles what is troubling [you]69-charity ? ”[67-mr. miles] [She]69-charity shook [her]69-charity head , and [he]67-mr. miles did not insist : but after a while [he]67-mr. miles said , in the same low tone , so that [they]1511-their should not be overheard : “ [Charity]69-charity , what do [you]69-charity know of [your]69-charity childhood , before [you]69-charity came down to [North Dormer]1-north dormer ? ”[67-mr. miles] [She]69-charity controlled [herself]69-charity , and answered : “ Nothing only what [I]69-charity heard [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall say one day . [He]64-mr. royall said [he]64-mr. royall brought [me]69-charity down because [[my]69-charity father]2498-my father went to [prison]2499-prison . ”[69-charity] “ And [you]69-charity 've never been up [there]185-there since ? ”[67-mr. miles] “ Never . ”[67-mr. miles] [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles was silent again , then [he]67-mr. miles said : “ [I]67-mr. miles 'm glad [you]69-charity 're coming with [me]67-mr. miles now . Perhaps [we]1512-they may find [[your]69-charity mother]2497-your mother alive , and [she]2497-your mother may know that [you]69-charity have come . ”[67-mr. miles] [They]1512-they had reached [Hamblin]18-hamblin , where the snow - flurry had left white patches in the rough grass on [the roadside]1155-the roadside , and in the angles of the roofs facing north . [It]18-hamblin was [a poor bleak village under [the granite flank of the Mountain]1515-the granite flank of the mountain]1514-a poor bleak village under the granite flank of the mountain , and as soon as [they]1512-they left [it]18-hamblin [they]1512-they began to climb . [The road]160-the road was steep and full of ruts , and the horse settled down to a walk while [they]1512-they mounted and mounted , [the world]184-the world dropping away below [them]1512-they in great mottled stretches of forest and field , and stormy dark blue distances . [Charity]69-charity had often had visions of [this ascent of [the Mountain]8-the mountain]1518-this ascent of the mountain but [she]69-charity had not known [it]1518-this ascent of the mountain would reveal so wide [a country]1519-a country , and the sight of [those strange lands]1520-those strange lands reaching away on every side gave [her]69-charity a new sense of [Harney]76-harney 's remoteness . [She]69-charity knew [he]76-harney must be miles and miles beyond [the last range of [hills that seemed to be the outmost verge of things]1522-hills that seemed to be the outmost verge of things]1521-the last range of hills that seemed to be the outmost verge of things , and [she]69-charity wondered how [she]69-charity had ever dreamed of going to [New York]24-new york to find [him]76-harney .... As [the road]160-the road mounted [the country]1888-the country grew bleaker , and [they]1512-they drove across fields of faded mountain grass bleached by long months beneath the snow . In the hollows a few white birches trembled , or a mountain ash lit [its]8-the mountain scarlet clusters ; but only a scant growth of pines darkened the granite ledges . The wind was blowing fiercely across [the open slopes]601-the open slopes ; the horse faced it with bent head and straining flanks , and now and then the buggy swayed so that [Charity]69-charity had to clutch [its]8-the mountain side . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles had not spoken again ; [he]67-mr. miles seemed to understand that [she]69-charity wanted to be left alone . After a while the track [they]1512-they were following forked , and [he]67-mr. miles pulled up the horse , as if uncertain of the way . [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt craned [his]94-liff hyatt head around from the back , and shouted against the wind : “ Left---- ”[94-liff hyatt] and [they]1512-they turned into [a stunted pine - wood]1526-a stunted pine - wood and began to drive down [the other side of [the Mountain]231-the mountain]1527-the other side of the mountain . A mile or two farther on [they]1512-they came out on [a clearing where [two or three low houses]1530-two or three low houses lay in [stony fields]1531-stony fields]1529-a clearing where two or three low houses lay in stony fields , crouching among the rocks as if to brace [themselves]1530-two or three low houses against the wind . [They]1532-they were hardly more than [sheds]1533-sheds , built of logs and rough boards , with tin stove - pipes sticking out of [their]1532-they roofs . The sun was setting , and dusk had already fallen on [the lower world]1534-the lower world , but a yellow glare still lay on [the lonely hillside]1535-the lonely hillside and [the crouching houses]1536-the crouching houses . The next moment it faded and left [the landscape]516-the landscape in dark autumn twilight . “ Over there , ”[94-liff hyatt] [Liff]94-liff hyatt called out , stretching [his]94-liff hyatt long arm over [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles 's shoulder . [The clergyman]339-the clergyman turned to the left , across a bit of bare ground overgrown with docks and nettles , and stopped before [the most ruinous of [the sheds]1540-the sheds]1539-the most ruinous of the sheds . A stove - pipe reached its crooked arm out of one window , and the broken panes of the other were stuffed with rags and paper . In contrast to such a dwelling [the brown house in [the swamp]2011-the swamp]1541-the brown house in the swamp might have stood for [the home of plenty]1543-the home of plenty . As [the buggy drew up two or three mongrel dogs]1544-the buggy drew up two or three mongrel dogs jumped out of the twilight with a great barking , and [a young man]925-a young man slouched to the door and stood there staring . In the twilight [Charity]69-charity saw that [his]925-a young man face had the same sodden look as [Bash Hyatt]97-bash hyatt 's , the day [she]69-charity had seen [him]925-a young man sleeping by the stove . [He]925-a young man made no effort to silence the dogs , but leaned in the door , as if roused from a drunken lethargy , while [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles got out of [the buggy]540-the buggy . “ Is it here ? ”[339-the clergyman] [the clergyman]339-the clergyman asked [Liff]94-liff hyatt in a low voice ; and [Liff]94-liff hyatt nodded . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles turned to [Charity]69-charity . “ Just hold the horse a minute , [[my]67-mr. miles dear]1903-my dear : [I]67-mr. miles 'll go in first , ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles said , putting the reins in [her]69-charity hands . [She]69-charity took them passively , and sat staring straight ahead of [her]69-charity at the darkening scene while [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles and [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt went up to [the house]171-the house . [They]1549-they stood a few minutes talking with [the man in the door]1550-the man in the door , and then [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles came back . As [he]67-mr. miles came close , [Charity]69-charity saw that [his]67-mr. miles smooth pink face wore a frightened solemn look . “ [[Your]69-charity mother]2497-your mother is dead , [Charity]69-charity ; [you]69-charity 'd better come with [me]67-mr. miles , ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles said . [She]69-charity got down and followed [him]67-mr. miles while [Liff]94-liff hyatt led the horse away . As [she]69-charity approached the door [she]69-charity said to [herself]69-charity : “ This is where [I]69-charity was born ... this is where [I]69-charity belong .... ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity had said it to [herself]69-charity often enough as [she]69-charity looked across [the sunlit valleys]1551-the sunlit valleys at [the Mountain]8-the mountain ; but it had meant nothing then , and now it had become a reality . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles took [her]69-charity gently by the arm , and [they]1552-they entered what appeared to be [the only room in [the house]171-the house]1553-the only room in the house . [The young man]173-the young man , instead of answering , turned [his]173-the young man head toward [the group]1074-the group . “ Where 's the candle ? [A woman]285-a woman lay on it , but [she]285-a woman did not look like [a dead woman]1569-a dead woman ; [she]285-a woman seemed to have fallen across [her]285-a woman squalid bed in a drunken sleep , and to have been left lying where [she]285-a woman fell , in [her]285-a woman ragged disordered clothes . There was a silence ; then [the young woman who had been lolling against the table]1577-the young woman who had been lolling against the table suddenly parted [the group]1074-the group , and stood in front of [Charity]69-charity . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles spoke . “ [I]67-mr. miles brought [her]180-the girl ; [she]180-the girl is [[Mary Hyatt]137-mary hyatt 's daughter]2507-mary hyatt 's daughter . ”[67-mr. miles] “ What ? [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles had set the candle on the floor and taken off [his]67-mr. miles heavy coat . [He]67-mr. miles turned to [Charity]69-charity . “ Come and help [me]67-mr. miles , ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles said . [He]67-mr. miles knelt down by the mattress , and pressed the lids over [the dead woman]1583-the dead woman 's eyes . [Charity]69-charity , trembling and sick , knelt beside [him]67-mr. miles , and tried to compose [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother 's body . [She]69-charity drew the stocking over the dreadful glistening leg , and pulled the skirt down to the battered upturned boots . As [she]69-charity did so , [she]69-charity looked at [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother 's face , thin yet swollen , with lips parted in a frozen gasp above the broken teeth . There was no sign in it of anything human : [she]1583-the dead woman lay there like a dead dog in a ditch . [Charity]69-charity 's hands grew cold as [they]1586-they touched [her]69-charity . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles drew [the woman]648-the woman 's arms across [her]648-the woman breast and laid [his]67-mr. miles coat over [her]648-the woman . Then [he]67-mr. miles covered [her]648-the woman face with [his]67-mr. miles handkerchief , and placed the bottle with the candle in it at [her]648-the woman head . Having done this [he]67-mr. miles stood up . “ Is there no coffin ? ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles asked , turning to [the group behind [him]67-mr. miles]1588-the group behind him . There was a moment of bewildered silence ; then [the fierce girl]1589-the fierce girl spoke up . “ [You]67-mr. miles 'd oughter brought it with [you]67-mr. miles . Where 'd [we]2509-we get one here , [I]1589-the fierce girl 'd like ter know ? ”[1589-the fierce girl] [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles , looking at [the others]2304-the others , repeated : “ Is it possible [you]1589-the fierce girl have no coffin ready ? ”[67-mr. miles] “ That 's what [I]642-an old woman say : [them]2510-them that has it sleeps better , ”[642-an old woman] [an old woman]642-an old woman murmured . “ But then [she]642-an old woman never had no bed .... ”[642-an old woman] “ And the stove warn't [hers]642-an old woman , ”[1592-the lank - haired man] said [the lank - haired man]1592-the lank - haired man , on the defensive . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles turned away from [them]2304-the others and moved a few steps apart . [He]67-mr. miles had drawn a book from [his]67-mr. miles pocket , and after a pause [he]67-mr. miles opened it and began to read , holding the book at arm 's length and low down , so that the pages caught the feeble light . [Charity]69-charity had remained on [her]69-charity knees by the mattress : now that [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother 's face was covered it was easier to stay near [her]481-her mother , and avoid the sight of the living faces which too horribly showed by what stages [hers]481-her mother had lapsed into death . “ [I]67-mr. miles am [the Resurrection and the Life]2511-the resurrection and the life , ”[67-mr. miles] [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles began ; “ [he]1592-the lank - haired man that believeth in [me]67-mr. miles , though [he]1592-the lank - haired man were dead , yet shall [he]1592-the lank - haired man live .... [Charity]69-charity thought of the gaping mouth and stony eyes under the handkerchief , and of the glistening leg over which [she]69-charity had drawn the stocking .... “ [We]1074-the group brought nothing into [this world]2512-this world and [we]1074-the group shall take nothing out of it---- ”[69-charity] There was a sudden muttering and a scuffle at the back of [the group]1074-the group . “ [I]1595-the elderly man with lank hair brought the stove , ”[1595-the elderly man with lank hair] said [the elderly man with lank hair]1595-the elderly man with lank hair , pushing [his]1595-the elderly man with lank hair way between [the others]2304-the others . “ [I]1595-the elderly man with lank hair wen ' down to [Creston'n]138-creston'n bought it ... n ' [I]1595-the elderly man with lank hair got a right to take it outer here ... n ' [I]1595-the elderly man with lank hair 'll lick [any feller]2513-any feller says [I]1595-the elderly man with lank hair ai n't .... ”[1595-the elderly man with lank hair] “ Sit down , damn [you]1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall ! ”[1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall] shouted [the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall]1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall . “ For [man]2514-man walketh in a vain shadow , and disquieteth [himself]2514-man in vain ; [he]2514-man heapeth up riches and can not tell who shall gather them .... ”[1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall] “ Well , it ARE [his]2514-man , ”[1598-a woman in the background] [a woman in the background]1598-a woman in the background interjected in a frightened whine . [The tall youth]1599-the tall youth staggered to [his]1599-the tall youth feet . “ If [you]1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall do n't hold [your]1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall mouths [I]1599-the tall youth 'll turn [you]1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall all out o ' here , [the whole lot of [you]1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall]2515-the whole lot of you , ”[1599-the tall youth] [he]1599-the tall youth cried with many oaths . “ [G'wan]139-g'wan , [minister]2516-minister ... do n't let ['em]2517-'em faze [you]1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall .... ”[1599-the tall youth] “ Now is [Christ]140-christ risen from the dead and become the first - fruits of [them]2518-them that slept .... Behold , [I]1599-the tall youth show [you]1597-the tall youth who had been drowsing on the bench against the wall a mystery . [We]2519-we shall not all sleep , but [we]2519-we shall all be changed , in a moment , in the twinkling of an eye , at the last trump .... For [this corruptible]2520-this corruptible must put on incorruption and [this mortal]2521-this mortal must put on immortality . So when this corruption shall have put on incorruption , and when [this mortal]2521-this mortal shall have put on immortality , then shall be brought to pass the saying that is written , Death is swallowed up in [Victory]59-victory .... ”[1599-the tall youth] One by one the mighty words fell on [Charity]69-charity 's bowed head , soothing the horror , subduing the tumult , mastering [her]69-charity as [they]1600-they mastered the drink - dazed creatures at [her]69-charity back . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles read to the last word , and then closed the book . “ Is [the grave]1119-the grave ready ? ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles asked . [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt , who had come in while [he]94-liff hyatt was reading , nodded a “ Yes , ”[94-liff hyatt] and pushed forward to the side of the mattress . [The young man on the bench]1601-the young man on the bench who seemed to assert some sort of right of kinship with [the dead woman]1583-the dead woman , got to [his]1601-the young man on the bench feet again , and [the proprietor of the stove]1603-the proprietor of the stove joined [him]1601-the young man on the bench . Between [them]1604-they [they]1604-they raised up the mattress ; but [their]1604-they movements were unsteady , and the coat slipped to the floor , revealing the poor body in its helpless misery . [Charity]69-charity , picking up the coat , covered [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother once more . [Liff]94-liff hyatt had brought a lantern , and [the old woman who had already spoken]1606-the old woman who had already spoken took it up , and opened the door to let [the little procession]1607-the little procession pass out . The wind had dropped , and the night was very dark and bitterly cold . [The old woman]412-the old woman walked ahead , the lantern shaking in [her]412-the old woman hand and spreading out before [her]412-the old woman a pale patch of dead grass and coarse - leaved weeds enclosed in an immensity of blackness . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles took [Charity]69-charity by the arm , and side by side [they]1604-they walked behind the mattress . At length [the old woman with the lantern]1609-the old woman with the lantern stopped , and [Charity]69-charity saw the light fall on the stooping shoulders of [the bearers]1610-the bearers and on [a ridge of upheaved earth over which [they]1610-the bearers were bending]1611-a ridge of upheaved earth over which they were bending . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles released [her]412-the old woman arm and approached [the hollow on the other side of the ridge]1612-the hollow on the other side of the ridge ; and while [the men]526-the men stooped down , lowering the mattress into [the grave]1119-the grave , [he]67-mr. miles began to speak again . “ Man that is born of [woman]2524-woman hath but a short time to live and is full of misery .... [He]67-mr. miles cometh up and is cut down ... [he]67-mr. miles fleeth as it were a shadow .... Yet , [[O]2525-o Lord God most holy , [O Lord most mighty]2526-o lord most mighty , [O holy and merciful Saviour]2527-o holy and merciful saviour]114-god , deliver [us]2528-us not into the bitter pains of eternal death .... ”[67-mr. miles] “ Easy there ... is [she]2524-woman down ? ”[1615-the claimant] piped [the claimant]1615-the claimant to the stove ; and [the young man]173-the young man called over [his]173-the young man shoulder : “ Lift the light there , ca n't [you]67-mr. miles ? ”[173-the young man] There was a pause , during which the light floated uncertainly over [the open grave]1617-the open grave . [Someone]1049-someone bent over and pulled out [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles 's coat----(“No , no -- leave the handkerchief , ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles interposed)--and then [Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt , coming forward with a spade , began to shovel in the earth . “ Forasmuch as it hath pleased [Almighty God]141-almighty god of [His]141-almighty god great mercy to take unto [Himself]141-almighty god the soul of [[our]2528-us dear sister]2529-our dear sister here departed , [we]2528-us therefore commit [her]2529-our dear sister body to the ground ; [earth to earth]2530-earth to earth , ashes to ashes , dust to dust ... ”[94-liff hyatt] [Liff]94-liff hyatt 's gaunt shoulders rose and bent in the lantern light as [he]94-liff hyatt dashed the clods of earth into [the grave]1119-the grave . “ [God]141-almighty god -- it 's froze a'ready , ”[94-liff hyatt] [he]94-liff hyatt muttered , spitting into [his]94-liff hyatt palm and passing [his]94-liff hyatt ragged shirt - sleeve across [his]94-liff hyatt perspiring face . “ Through [our]2528-us Lord Jesus Christ , who shall change [our]2528-us vile body that it may be like unto [His]141-almighty god glorious body , according to the mighty working , whereby [He]141-almighty god is able to subdue all things unto [Himself]141-almighty god ... ”[94-liff hyatt] The last spadeful of earth fell on the vile body of [Mary Hyatt]137-mary hyatt , and [Liff]94-liff hyatt rested on [his]94-liff hyatt spade , [his]94-liff hyatt shoulder blades still heaving with the effort . “ [Lord]2531-lord , have mercy upon [us]2528-us , [Christ]140-christ have mercy upon [us]2528-us , [Lord]2531-lord have mercy upon [us]2528-us ... ”[94-liff hyatt] [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles took the lantern from [the old woman]412-the old woman 's hand and swept its light across the circle of bleared faces . “ Now kneel down , all of [you]2528-us , ”[67-mr. miles] [he]67-mr. miles commanded , in a voice of authority that [Charity]69-charity had never heard . [She]412-the old woman knelt down at the edge of [the grave]1119-the grave , and [the others]2304-the others , stiffly and hesitatingly , got to [their]2304-the others knees beside [her]412-the old woman . [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles had been getting into [his]67-mr. miles coat again . [He]67-mr. miles came up to [Charity]69-charity , who had remained passively kneeling by [the rough mound of earth]1627-the rough mound of earth . “ [[My]69-charity child]1875-my child , [you]1875-my child must come . It 's very late . ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity lifted [her]69-charity eyes to [his]67-mr. miles face : [he]67-mr. miles seemed to speak out of [another world]1628-another world . “ [I]67-mr. miles ai n't coming : [I]67-mr. miles 'm going to stay here . ”[67-mr. miles] “ Here ? [The group about the grave]1629-the group about the grave had scattered in the darkness , but [the old woman with the lantern]1609-the old woman with the lantern stood waiting . [Her]1609-the old woman with the lantern mournful withered face was not unkind , and [Charity]69-charity went up to [her]1609-the old woman with the lantern . “ Have [you]94-liff hyatt got a place where [I]69-charity can lie down for the night ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity asked . [Liff]94-liff hyatt came up , leading [the buggy]540-the buggy out of the night . [He]94-liff hyatt looked from one to the other with [his]94-liff hyatt feeble smile . “ [She]412-the old woman 's [[my]94-liff hyatt mother]2023-my mother . XVII [CHARITY]69-charity lay on the floor on a mattress , as [[her]69-charity dead mother]1636-her dead mother 's body had lain . [The room in which [she]69-charity lay]1637-the room in which she lay was cold and dark and low - ceilinged , and even poorer and barer than the scene of [Mary Hyatt]137-mary hyatt 's earthly pilgrimage . On the other side of [the fireless stove [[Liff Hyatt]94-liff hyatt 's mother]1639-liff hyatt 's mother]1638-the fireless stove liff hyatt 's mother slept on a blanket , with [two children]1640-two children -- [[her]648-the woman grandchildren]1641-her grandchildren , [she]648-the woman said -- rolled up against [her]648-the woman like sleeping puppies . [They]1640-two children had [their]1640-two children thin clothes spread over [them]1640-two children , having given the only other blanket to [[their]1640-two children guest]1642-their guest . Through the small square of glass in the opposite wall [Charity]69-charity saw a deep funnel of sky , so black , so remote , so palpitating with frosty stars that [her]69-charity very soul seemed to be sucked into it . Up there somewhere , [she]69-charity supposed , [the God whom [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles had invoked]1643-the god whom mr. miles had invoked was waiting for [Mary Hyatt]137-mary hyatt to appear . What a long flight it was ! And what would [she]69-charity have to say when [she]69-charity reached [Him]1643-the god whom mr. miles had invoked ? [Charity]69-charity 's bewildered brain laboured with the attempt to picture [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother 's past , and to relate it in any way to the designs of [a just but merciful God]1645-a just but merciful god ; but it was impossible to imagine any link between [them]1646-them . [She]69-charity [herself]69-charity felt as remote from [the poor creature [she]69-charity had seen lowered into [[her]69-charity hastily dug grave]1648-her hastily dug grave as if the height of the heavens divided [them]1649-them]1647-the poor creature she had seen lowered into her hastily dug grave as if the height of the heavens divided them . [She]69-charity had seen poverty and misfortune in [her]69-charity life ; but in [a community where [poor thrifty [Mrs. Hawes]100-mrs. hawes]1651-poor thrifty mrs. hawes and [the industrious Ally]74-ally represented the nearest approach to destitution there was nothing to suggest the savage misery of [the Mountain farmers]1652-the mountain farmers]1650-a community where poor thrifty mrs. hawes and the industrious ally represented the nearest approach to destitution there was nothing to suggest the savage misery of the mountain farmers . As [she]69-charity lay there , half - stunned by [her]69-charity tragic initiation , [Charity]69-charity vainly tried to think [herself]69-charity into the life about [her]69-charity . But [she]69-charity could not even make out what relationship [these people]2537-these people bore to [each other]328-each other , or to [[her]69-charity dead mother]1636-her dead mother ; [they]2537-these people seemed to be herded together in a sort of passive promiscuity in which [their]2537-these people common misery was the strongest link . [She]69-charity tried to picture to [herself]69-charity what [her]69-charity life would have been if [she]69-charity had grown up on [the Mountain]8-the mountain , running wild in rags , sleeping on the floor curled up against [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother , like [the pale - faced children huddled against [old Mrs. Hyatt]142-old mrs. hyatt]1657-the pale - faced children huddled against old mrs. hyatt , and turning into [a fierce bewildered creature like [the girl who had apostrophized [her]69-charity in such strange words]1659-the girl who had apostrophized her in such strange words]1658-a fierce bewildered creature like the girl who had apostrophized her in such strange words . [She]69-charity was frightened by the secret affinity [she]69-charity had felt with [this girl]1660-this girl , and by the light it threw on [her]69-charity own beginnings . Then [she]69-charity remembered what [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall had said in telling [her]69-charity story to [Lucius Harney]75-harney : “ Yes , there was [a mother]2113-a mother ; but [she]2113-a mother was glad to have [the child]2109-the child go . [She]2113-a mother 'd have given [her]2109-the child to [anybody]1939-anybody .... ”[64-mr. royall] Well ! after all , was [[her]69-charity mother]481-her mother so much to blame ? [Charity]69-charity , since that day , had always thought of [her]481-her mother as destitute of all human feeling ; now [she]481-her mother seemed merely pitiful . What [mother]1662-mother would not want to save [[her]1662-mother child]1479-her child from such a life ? [Charity]69-charity thought of the future of [[her]69-charity own child]1664-her own child , and tears welled into [her]69-charity aching eyes , and ran down over [her]69-charity face . If [she]69-charity had been less exhausted , less burdened with [his]1664-her own child weight , [she]69-charity would have sprung up then and there and fled away .... The grim hours of the night dragged themselves slowly by , and at last the sky paled and dawn threw a cold blue beam into [the room]259-the room . [She]69-charity lay in [her]69-charity corner staring at the dirty floor , the clothes - line hung with decaying rags , [the old woman]412-the old woman huddled against the cold stove , and the light gradually spreading across the wintry world , and bringing with it a new day in which [she]69-charity would have to live , to choose , to act , to make [herself]69-charity a place among [these people]2537-these people -- or to go back to the life [she]69-charity had left . A mortal lassitude weighed on [her]69-charity . There were moments when [she]69-charity felt that all [she]69-charity asked was to go on lying there unnoticed ; then [her]69-charity mind revolted at the thought of becoming one of the miserable herd from which [she]69-charity sprang , and it seemed as though , to save [[her]69-charity child]1479-her child from such a fate , [she]69-charity would find strength to travel any distance , and bear any burden life might put on [her]69-charity . Vague thoughts of [Nettleton]5-nettleton flitted through [her]69-charity mind . [She]69-charity said to [herself]69-charity that [she]69-charity would find some quiet place where [she]69-charity could bear [[her]69-charity child]1479-her child , and give it to [decent people to keep]1670-decent people to keep ; and then [she]69-charity would go out like [Julia Hawes]112-julia and earn [its]112-julia living and [hers]69-charity . [She]69-charity knew that [girls of that kind]1671-girls of that kind sometimes made enough to have [[their]1671-girls of that kind children]1672-their children nicely cared for ; and every other consideration disappeared in the vision of [[her]69-charity baby]1469-her baby , cleaned and combed and rosy , and hidden away somewhere where [she]69-charity could run in and kiss [it]1469-her baby , and bring it pretty things to wear . Anything , anything was better than to add another life to the nest of misery on [the Mountain]8-the mountain .... [The old woman]412-the old woman and [the children]1675-the children were still sleeping when [Charity]69-charity rose from [her]69-charity mattress . [Her]69-charity body was stiff with cold and fatigue , and [she]69-charity moved slowly lest [her]69-charity heavy steps should rouse [them]1675-the children . [She]69-charity was faint with hunger , and had nothing left in [her]69-charity satchel ; but on the table [she]69-charity saw the half of a stale loaf . No doubt it was to serve as the breakfast of [old Mrs. Hyatt]142-old mrs. hyatt and [the children]1675-the children ; but [Charity]69-charity did not care ; [she]69-charity had [[her]69-charity own baby]1486-her own baby to think of . [She]69-charity broke off a piece of the bread and ate it greedily ; then [her]69-charity glance fell on the thin faces of [the sleeping children]1678-the sleeping children , and filled with compunction [she]69-charity rummaged in [her]69-charity satchel for something with which to pay for what [she]69-charity had taken . [She]69-charity found one of the pretty chemises that [Ally]74-ally had made for [her]69-charity , with a blue ribbon run through its edging . It was one of the dainty things on which [she]69-charity had squandered [her]69-charity savings , and as [she]69-charity looked at it the blood rushed to [her]69-charity forehead . [She]69-charity laid the chemise on the table , and stealing across the floor lifted the latch and went out .... The morning was icy cold and a pale sun was just rising above [the eastern shoulder of [the Mountain]231-the mountain]1679-the eastern shoulder of the mountain . [The houses]1681-the houses scattered on [the hillside]275-the hillside lay cold and smokeless under the sun - flecked clouds , and [not a human being]1683-not a human being was in sight . [Charity]69-charity paused on the threshold and tried to discover [the road by which [she]69-charity had come the night before]1684-the road by which she had come the night before . Across [the field surrounding [[Mrs. Hyatt]142-old mrs. hyatt 's shanty]1686-mrs. hyatt 's shanty]1685-the field surrounding mrs. hyatt 's shanty [she]69-charity saw [the tumble - down house in which [she]69-charity supposed the funeral service had taken place]1687-the tumble - down house in which she supposed the funeral service had taken place . [The trail]1688-the trail ran across the ground between [the two houses]1689-the two houses and disappeared in [the pine - wood]1690-the pine - wood on [the flank of [the Mountain]231-the mountain]1691-the flank of the mountain ; and a little way to the right , under a wind - beaten thorn , a mound of fresh earth made a dark spot on the fawn - coloured stubble . [Charity]69-charity walked across [the field]1693-the field to [the ground]1694-the ground . As [she]69-charity approached [it]1693-the field [she]69-charity heard a bird 's note in the still air , and looking up [she]69-charity saw a brown song - sparrow perched in an upper branch of the thorn above the grave . [She]69-charity stood a minute listening to [his]1695-his small solitary song ; then [she]69-charity rejoined [the trail]1688-the trail and began to mount [the hill]279-the hill to [the pine - wood]1690-the pine - wood . Thus far [she]69-charity had been impelled by the blind instinct of flight ; but each step seemed to bring [her]69-charity nearer to the realities of which [her]69-charity feverish vigil had given only a shadowy image . Now that [she]69-charity walked again in [a daylight world]1699-a daylight world , on the way back to familiar things , [her]69-charity imagination moved more soberly . On one point [she]69-charity was still decided : [she]69-charity could not remain at [North Dormer]1-north dormer , and the sooner [she]69-charity got away from [it]1-north dormer the better . But everything beyond was darkness . As [she]69-charity continued to climb the air grew keener , and when [she]69-charity passed from the shelter of the pines to [the open grassy roof of [the Mountain]8-the mountain]1700-the open grassy roof of the mountain the cold wind of the night before sprang out on [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity bent [her]69-charity shoulders and struggled on against it for a while ; but presently [her]69-charity breath failed , and [she]69-charity sat down under a ledge of rock overhung by shivering birches . From where [she]69-charity sat [she]69-charity saw the trail wandering across the bleached grass in the direction of [Hamblin]18-hamblin , and the granite wall of [the Mountain]8-the mountain falling away to infinite distances . On that side of the ridge [the valleys]2043-the valleys still lay in wintry shadow ; but in [the plain beyond]1702-the plain beyond the sun was touching [village roofs]1703-village roofs and steeples , and gilding the haze of smoke over [far - off invisible towns]1704-far - off invisible towns . [Charity]69-charity felt [herself]69-charity a mere speck in the lonely circle of the sky . The events of the last two days seemed to have divided [her]69-charity forever from [her]69-charity short dream of bliss . Even [Harney]75-harney 's image had been blurred by that crushing experience : [she]69-charity thought of [him]75-harney as so remote from [her]69-charity that [he]75-harney seemed hardly more than a memory . In [her]69-charity fagged and floating mind only one sensation had the weight of reality ; it was the bodily burden of [[her]69-charity child]1479-her child . But for it [she]69-charity would have felt as rootless as the whiffs of thistledown the wind blew past [her]69-charity . [[Her]69-charity child]1479-her child was like a load that held [her]69-charity down , and yet like a hand that pulled [her]69-charity to [her]69-charity feet . [She]69-charity said to [herself]69-charity that [she]69-charity must get up and struggle on .... [Her]69-charity eyes turned back to the trail across [the top of [the Mountain]231-the mountain]1707-the top of the mountain , and in the distance [she]69-charity saw a buggy against the sky . [She]69-charity knew [its]1709-its antique outline , and the gaunt build of the old horse pressing forward with lowered head ; and after a moment [she]69-charity recognized the heavy bulk of [the man who held the reins]1710-the man who held the reins . The buggy was following [the trail]1688-the trail and making straight for the pine - wood through which [she]69-charity had climbed ; and [she]69-charity knew at once that [the driver]989-the driver was in search of [her]69-charity . [Her]69-charity first impulse was to crouch down under the ledge till [he]989-the driver had passed ; but the instinct of concealment was overruled by the relief of feeling that [someone]1049-someone was near [her]69-charity in the awful emptiness . [She]69-charity stood up and walked toward the buggy . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall saw [her]69-charity , and touched the horse with the whip . A minute or two later [he]64-mr. royall was abreast of [Charity]69-charity ; [their]1714-their eyes met , and without speaking [he]64-mr. royall leaned over and helped [her]69-charity up into the buggy . [She]69-charity tried to speak , to stammer out some explanation , but no words came to [her]69-charity ; and as [he]64-mr. royall drew the cover over [her]69-charity knees [he]64-mr. royall simply said : “ [The minister]2086-the minister told [me]64-mr. royall [he]2086-the minister 'd left [you]69-charity up here , so [I]64-mr. royall come up for [you]69-charity . ”[64-mr. royall] [He]64-mr. royall turned the horse 's head , and [they]1714-their began to jog back toward [Hamblin]18-hamblin . [Charity]69-charity sat speechless , staring straight ahead of [her]69-charity , and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall occasionally uttered a word of encouragement to the horse : “ Get along [there]185-there , [Dan ....]95-dan targatt [I]64-mr. royall gave [him]64-mr. royall a rest at [Hamblin]18-hamblin ; but [I]64-mr. royall brought [him]64-mr. royall along pretty quick , and it 's a stiff pull up here against the wind . ”[64-mr. royall] As [he]64-mr. royall spoke it occurred to [her]69-charity for the first time that to reach [the top of [the Mountain]8-the mountain]1707-the top of the mountain so early [he]64-mr. royall must have left [North Dormer]1-north dormer at the coldest hour of the night , and have travelled steadily but for the halt at [Hamblin]18-hamblin ; and [she]69-charity felt a softness at [her]69-charity heart which no act of [his]64-mr. royall had ever produced since [he]64-mr. royall had brought [her]69-charity the Crimson Rambler because [she]69-charity had given up boarding - school to stay with [him]64-mr. royall . After an interval [he]64-mr. royall began again : “ It was a day just like this , only spitting snow , when [I]64-mr. royall come up here for [you]69-charity the first time . ”[64-mr. royall] Then , as if fearing that [she]69-charity might take [his]64-mr. royall remark as a reminder of past benefits , [he]64-mr. royall added quickly : “ [I]64-mr. royall dunno 's [you]69-charity think it was such a good job , either . ”[64-mr. royall] “ Yes , [I]69-charity do , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity murmured , looking straight ahead of [her]69-charity . “ Well , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said , “ [I]64-mr. royall tried---- ”[64-mr. royall] [He]64-mr. royall did not finish the sentence , and [she]69-charity could think of nothing more to say . “ Ho , there , [Dan]95-dan targatt , step out , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall muttered , jerking the bridle . “ [We]1716-they ai n't [home]342-home yet.--You cold ? ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall asked abruptly . [She]69-charity shook [her]69-charity head , but [he]64-mr. royall drew the cover higher up , and stooped to tuck it in about the ankles . [She]69-charity continued to look straight ahead . Tears of weariness and weakness were dimming [her]69-charity eyes and beginning to run over , but [she]69-charity dared not wipe them away lest [he]64-mr. royall should observe the gesture . [They]1716-they drove in silence , following the long loops of the descent upon [Hamblin]18-hamblin , and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall did not speak again till [they]1716-they reached [the outskirts of [the village]148-the village]1717-the outskirts of the village . Then [he]64-mr. royall let the reins droop on the dashboard and drew out [his]64-mr. royall watch . “ [Charity]69-charity , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said , “ [you]69-charity look fair done up , and [North Dormer]1-north dormer 's a goodish way off . [I]64-mr. royall 've figured out that [we]1716-they 'd do better to stop here long enough for [you]69-charity to get a mouthful of breakfast and then drive down to [Creston]19-creston and take [the train]904-the train . ”[64-mr. royall] [She]69-charity roused [herself]69-charity from [her]69-charity apathetic musing . “ [The train]904-the train -- [what train]2550-what train ? ”[69-charity] [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , without answering , let the horse jog on till [they]1716-they reached the door of [the first house in [the village]148-the village]1719-the first house in the village . “ This is [old [Mrs. Hobart]143-mrs. hobart 's place]2551-old mrs. hobart 's place , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said . “ [She]1722-an old woman with a kindly face 'll give [us]1716-they something hot to drink . ”[64-mr. royall] [Charity]69-charity , half unconsciously , found [herself]69-charity getting out of the buggy and following [him]64-mr. royall in at the open door . [They]1716-they entered [a decent kitchen]1721-a decent kitchen with a fire crackling in the stove . [An old woman with a kindly face]1722-an old woman with a kindly face was setting out cups and saucers on the table . [She]1722-an old woman with a kindly face looked up and nodded as [they]1716-they came in , and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall advanced to the stove , clapping [his]64-mr. royall numb hands together . “ Well , [Mrs. Hobart]143-mrs. hobart , [you]143-mrs. hobart got any breakfast for [this young lady]2552-this young lady ? [Charity]69-charity reddened , and sat down at the table . A feeling of complete passiveness had once more come over [her]69-charity , and [she]69-charity was conscious only of the pleasant animal sensations of warmth and rest . [Mrs. Hobart]143-mrs. hobart put bread and milk on the table , and then went out of [the house]171-the house : [Charity]69-charity saw [her]143-mrs. hobart leading the horse away to [the barn]1724-the barn across [the yard]1725-the yard . [She]143-mrs. hobart did not come back , and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall and [Charity]69-charity sat alone at the table with the smoking coffee between [them]1726-them . [He]64-mr. royall poured out a cup for [her]69-charity , and put a piece of bread in the saucer , and [she]69-charity began to eat . As the warmth of the coffee flowed through [her]69-charity veins [her]69-charity thoughts cleared and [she]69-charity began to feel like [a living being]1727-a living being again ; but the return to life was so painful that the food choked in [her]69-charity throat and [she]69-charity sat staring down at the table in silent anguish . After a while [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall pushed back [his]64-mr. royall chair . “ Now , then , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said , “ if [you]69-charity 're a mind to go along---- ”[64-mr. royall] [She]69-charity did not move , and [he]64-mr. royall continued : “ [We]2553-we can pick up [the noon train]2554-the noon train for [Nettleton]5-nettleton if [you]69-charity say so . ”[64-mr. royall] The words sent the blood rushing to [her]69-charity face , and [she]69-charity raised [her]69-charity startled eyes to [his]64-mr. royall . [He]64-mr. royall was standing on the other side of the table looking at [her]69-charity kindly and gravely ; and suddenly [she]69-charity understood what [he]64-mr. royall was going to say . [She]69-charity continued to sit motionless , a leaden weight upon [her]69-charity lips . “ [You]69-charity and [me]64-mr. royall have spoke some hard things to each other in [our]2553-we time , [Charity]69-charity ; and there 's no good that [I]64-mr. royall can see in any more talking now . [Her]69-charity whole body began to tremble with the dread of [her]69-charity own weakness . “ Oh , [I]69-charity can't---- ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity burst out desperately . “ Ca n't what ? ”[69-charity] [She]69-charity [herself]69-charity did not know : [she]69-charity was not sure if [she]69-charity was rejecting what [he]64-mr. royall offered , or already struggling against the temptation of taking what [she]69-charity no longer had a right to . [She]69-charity stood up , shaking and bewildered , and began to speak : “ [I]69-charity know [I]69-charity ai n't been fair to [you]64-mr. royall always ; but [I]69-charity want to be now .... [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall leaned against the wall . [He]64-mr. royall was paler than usual , but [his]64-mr. royall face was composed and kindly and [her]69-charity agitation did not appear to perturb [him]64-mr. royall . “ What 's all this about wanting ? ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said as [she]69-charity paused . “ Do [you]69-charity know what [you]69-charity really want ? XVIII [They]1736-they began to jog down [the winding road]1739-the winding road to [the valley]228-the valley at [old Dan]95-dan targatt 's languid pace . [Charity]69-charity felt [herself]69-charity sinking into deeper depths of weariness , and as [they]1736-they descended through [the bare woods]1741-the bare woods there were moments when [she]69-charity lost the exact sense of things , and seemed to be sitting beside [[her]69-charity lover]2371-her lover with the leafy arch of summer bending over [them]1736-they . But this illusion was faint and transitory . For the most part [she]69-charity had only a confused sensation of slipping down a smooth irresistible current ; and [she]69-charity abandoned [herself]69-charity to the feeling as a refuge from the torment of thought . [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall seldom spoke , but [his]64-mr. royall silent presence gave [her]69-charity , for the first time , a sense of peace and security . [She]69-charity knew that where [he]64-mr. royall was there would be warmth , rest , silence ; and for the moment [they]1743-they were all [she]69-charity wanted . [She]69-charity shut [her]69-charity eyes , and even these things grew dim to [her]69-charity .... In [the train]904-the train , during the short run from [Creston]19-creston to [Nettleton]5-nettleton , the warmth aroused [her]69-charity , and the consciousness of being under strange eyes gave [her]69-charity a momentary energy . [She]69-charity sat upright , facing [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , and stared out of the window at [the denuded country]1745-the denuded country . Forty - eight hours earlier , when [she]69-charity had last traversed [it]1745-the denuded country , many of the trees still held their leaves ; but the high wind of the last two nights had stripped them , and the lines of [the landscape]516-the landscape ' were as finely pencilled as in December . A few days of autumn cold had wiped out all trace of the rich fields and languid groves through which [she]69-charity had passed on the Fourth of July ; and with the fading of the landscape those fervid hours had faded , too . [She]69-charity could no longer believe that [she]69-charity was [the being who had lived them]1747-the being who had lived them ; [she]69-charity was [someone to whom something irreparable and overwhelming had happened]1748-someone to whom something irreparable and overwhelming had happened , but the traces of the steps leading up to it had almost vanished . When [the train]904-the train reached [Nettleton]5-nettleton and [she]69-charity walked out into [the square]919-the square at [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's side the sense of unreality grew more overpowering . The physical strain of the night and day had left no room in [her]69-charity mind for new sensations and [she]69-charity followed [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall as passively as [a tired child]1751-a tired child . As in a confused dream [she]69-charity presently found [herself]69-charity sitting with [him]64-mr. royall in [a pleasant room]1752-a pleasant room , at a table with a red and white table - cloth on which hot food and tea were placed . [He]64-mr. royall filled [her]69-charity cup and plate and whenever [she]69-charity lifted [her]69-charity eyes from them [she]69-charity found [his]64-mr. royall resting on [her]69-charity with the same steady tranquil gaze that had reassured and strengthened [her]69-charity when [they]1753-they had faced each other in [[old Mrs. Hobart]143-mrs. hobart 's kitchen]1754-old mrs. hobart 's kitchen . As everything else in [her]69-charity consciousness grew more and more confused and immaterial , became more and more like the universal shimmer that dissolves [the world]184-the world to failing eyes , [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's presence began to detach itself with rocky firmness from this elusive background . [She]69-charity had always thought of [him]64-mr. royall -- when [she]69-charity thought of [him]64-mr. royall at all -- as of someone hateful and obstructive , but whom [she]69-charity could outwit and dominate when [she]69-charity chose to make the effort . Only once , on the day of the Old Home Week celebration , while the stray fragments of [his]64-mr. royall address drifted across [her]69-charity troubled mind , had [she]69-charity caught a glimpse of [another being]1756-another being , a being so different from [the dull - witted enemy with whom [she]69-charity had supposed [herself]69-charity to be living that even through the burning mist of [her]69-charity own dreams [he]64-mr. royall had stood out with startling distinctness]1757-the dull - witted enemy with whom she had supposed herself to be living that even through the burning mist of her own dreams he had stood out with startling distinctness . But the mist of [her]69-charity dreams had hidden [him]64-mr. royall again , and [she]69-charity had forgotten that fugitive impression . It came back to [her]69-charity now , as [they]1759-they sat at the table , and gave [her]69-charity , through [her]69-charity own immeasurable desolation , a sudden sense of [their]1759-they nearness to each other . But all these feelings were only brief streaks of light in the grey blur of [her]69-charity physical weakness . Through it [she]69-charity was aware that [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall presently left [her]69-charity sitting by the table in [the warm room]1760-the warm room , and came back after an interval with [a carriage]1761-a carriage from [the station]2204-the station -- [a closed “ hack ”]2562-a closed “ hack ”[64-mr. royall] with sun - burnt blue silk blinds -- in which [they]1759-they drove together to [a house covered with creepers and standing next to [a church]1764-a church with a carpet of turf before [it]1763-a house covered with creepers and standing next to a church with a carpet of turf before it]1763-a house covered with creepers and standing next to a church with a carpet of turf before it . [The clergyman]339-the clergyman began to read , and on [her]69-charity dazed mind there rose the memory of [Mr. Miles]67-mr. miles , standing the night before in [the desolate house of [the Mountain]8-the mountain]1785-the desolate house of the mountain , and reading out of the same book words that had the same dread sound of finality : “ [I]69-charity require and charge [you]2563-you both , as [ye]2563-you will answer at the dreadful day of judgment when the secrets of all hearts shall be disclosed , that if either of [you]2563-you know any impediment whereby [ye]2563-you may not be lawfully joined together ... ”[69-charity] [Charity]69-charity raised [her]69-charity eyes and met [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's . [They]1786-they were still looking at [her]69-charity kindly and steadily . “ [I]64-mr. royall will ! ”[64-mr. royall] [she]69-charity heard [him]64-mr. royall say a moment later , after another interval of words that [she]69-charity had failed to catch . After another interval [the lady on the bench]1788-the lady on the bench stood up , and taking [her]69-charity hand put it in [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's . [She]69-charity understood then that [she]69-charity was married .... Late that afternoon [Charity]69-charity sat alone in [a bedroom of [the fashionable hotel where [she]69-charity and [Harney]75-harney had vainly sought a table on [the Fourth of July]1791-the fourth of july]1790-the fashionable hotel where she and harney had vainly sought a table on the fourth of july]1789-a bedroom of the fashionable hotel where she and harney had vainly sought a table on the fourth of july . [She]69-charity had never before been in so handsomely furnished [a room]1792-a room . The mirror above the dressing - table reflected the high head - board and fluted pillow - slips of the double bed , and a bedspread so spotlessly white that [she]69-charity had hesitated to lay [her]69-charity hat and jacket on it . The humming radiator diffused an atmosphere of drowsy warmth , and through a half - open door [she]69-charity saw the glitter of the nickel taps above twin marble basins . For a while the long turmoil of the night and day had slipped away from [her]69-charity and [she]69-charity sat with closed eyes , surrendering [herself]69-charity to the spell of warmth and silence . But presently this merciful apathy was succeeded by the sudden acuteness of vision with which [sick people]1793-sick people sometimes wake out of a heavy sleep . As [she]69-charity opened [her]69-charity eyes they rested on the picture that hung above the bed . It was a large engraving with a dazzling white margin enclosed in a wide frame of bird's - eye maple with an inner scroll of gold . The engraving represented [a young man in [a boat]996-a boat on [a lake over - hung with trees]1796-a lake over - hung with trees]1794-a young man in a boat on a lake over - hung with trees . [He]1794-a young man in a boat on a lake over - hung with trees was leaning over to gather water - lilies for [the girl in a light dress who lay among the cushions in the stern]1797-the girl in a light dress who lay among the cushions in the stern . The scene was full of a drowsy midsummer radiance , and [Charity]69-charity averted [her]69-charity eyes from it and , rising from [her]69-charity chair , began to wander restlessly about [the room]259-the room . [It]259-the room was on [the fifth floor]1799-the fifth floor , and [its]259-the room broad window of plate glass looked over the roofs of [the town]2083-the town . Beyond [them]1801-them stretched [a wooded landscape]1802-a wooded landscape in which the last fires of sunset were picking out a steely gleam . [Charity]69-charity gazed at the gleam with startled eyes . Even through the gathering twilight [she]69-charity recognized the contour of the soft hills encircling [it]259-the room , and the way [the meadows]2331-the meadows sloped to [its]259-the room edge . It was [Nettleton Lake]62-nettleton lake that [she]69-charity was looking at . [She]69-charity stood a long time in the window staring out at the fading water . The sight of it had roused [her]69-charity for the first time to a realization of what [she]69-charity had done . Even the feeling of the ring on [her]69-charity hand had not brought [her]69-charity this sharp sense of the irretrievable . For an instant the old impulse of flight swept through [her]69-charity ; but it was only the lift of a broken wing . [She]69-charity heard the door open behind [her]69-charity , and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall came in . [He]64-mr. royall had gone to [the barber]1804-the barber 's to be shaved , and [his]64-mr. royall shaggy grey hair had been trimmed and smoothed . [He]64-mr. royall moved strongly and quickly , squaring [his]64-mr. royall shoulders and carrying [his]64-mr. royall head high , as if [he]64-mr. royall did not want to pass unnoticed . “ What are [you]69-charity doing in the dark ? ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall called out in a cheerful voice . [Charity]69-charity made no answer . [He]64-mr. royall went up to the window to draw the blind , and putting [his]64-mr. royall finger on the wall flooded [the room]259-the room with a blaze of light from the central chandelier . In [this unfamiliar illumination]1806-this unfamiliar illumination [husband]1807-husband and [wife]1808-wife faced [each other]328-each other awkwardly for a moment ; then [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall said : “ [We]2564-we 'll step down and have some supper , if [you]69-charity say so . ”[64-mr. royall] The thought of food filled [her]69-charity with repugnance ; but not daring to confess it [she]69-charity smoothed [her]69-charity hair and followed [him]64-mr. royall to [the lift]1810-the lift . An hour later , coming out of the glare of [the dining - room]818-the dining - room , [she]69-charity waited in [the marble - panelled hall]1812-the marble - panelled hall while [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall , before the brass lattice of one of the corner counters , selected a cigar and bought an evening paper . [Men]210-men were lounging in rocking chairs under [the blazing chandeliers]1814-the blazing chandeliers , [travellers]1815-travellers coming and going , bells ringing , [porters]1816-porters shuffling by with luggage . Over [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's shoulder , as [he]64-mr. royall leaned against the counter , [a girl with [her]1817-a girl with her hair puffed high smirked and nodded at a dapper drummer who was getting his key at the desk across the hall hair puffed high smirked and nodded at [a dapper drummer who was getting [his]1818-a dapper drummer who was getting his key at the desk across the hall key at the desk across [the hall]2255-the hall]1818-a dapper drummer who was getting his key at the desk across the hall]1817-a girl with her hair puffed high smirked and nodded at a dapper drummer who was getting his key at the desk across the hall . [Charity]69-charity stood among these cross - currents of life as motionless and inert as if [she]69-charity had been one of the tables screwed to the marble floor . All [her]69-charity soul was gathered up into one sick sense of coming doom , and [she]69-charity watched [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall in fascinated terror while [he]64-mr. royall pinched the cigars in successive boxes and unfolded [his]64-mr. royall evening paper with a steady hand . Presently [he]64-mr. royall turned and joined [her]69-charity . “ [You]69-charity go right along up to bed -- [I'm]64-mr. royall going to sit down here and have [my]64-mr. royall smoke , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall said . [He]64-mr. royall spoke as easily and naturally as if [they]1820-they had been [an old couple]1821-an old couple , long used to [each other]328-each other 's ways , and [her]69-charity contracted heart gave a flutter of relief . [She]69-charity followed [him]64-mr. royall to [the lift]1810-the lift , and [he]64-mr. royall put [her]69-charity in and enjoined [the buttoned and braided boy]1824-the buttoned and braided boy to show [her]69-charity to [[her]69-charity room]323-her room . [She]69-charity groped [her]69-charity way in through the darkness , forgetting where the electric button was , and not knowing how to manipulate it . But a white autumn moon had risen , and the illuminated sky put a pale light in [the room]259-the room . By it [she]69-charity undressed , and after folding up the ruffled pillow - slips crept timidly under the spotless counterpane . [She]69-charity had never felt such smooth sheets or such light warm blankets ; but the softness of the bed did not soothe [her]69-charity . [She]69-charity lay there trembling with a fear that ran through [her]69-charity veins like ice . “ What have [I]69-charity done ? Oh , what have [I]69-charity done ? ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity whispered , shuddering to [her]69-charity pillow ; and pressing [her]69-charity face against it to shut out the pale landscape beyond the window [she]69-charity lay in the darkness straining [her]69-charity ears , and shaking at every footstep that approached .... Suddenly [she]69-charity sat up and pressed [her]69-charity hands against [her]69-charity frightened heart . A faint sound had told [her]69-charity that [someone]1049-someone was in [the room]259-the room ; but [she]69-charity must have slept in the interval , for [she]69-charity had heard [no one]1910-no one enter . The moon was setting beyond [the opposite roofs]1830-the opposite roofs , and in the darkness outlined against the grey square of the window , [she]69-charity saw [a figure seated in the rocking - chair]1831-a figure seated in the rocking - chair . [The figure]1832-the figure did not move : it was sunk deep in the chair , with bowed head and folded arms , and [she]69-charity saw that it was [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall who sat there . [He]64-mr. royall had not undressed , but had taken the blanket from the foot of the bed and laid it across [his]64-mr. royall knees . Trembling and holding [her]69-charity breath [she]69-charity watched [him]64-mr. royall , fearing that [he]64-mr. royall had been roused by [her]69-charity movement ; but [he]64-mr. royall did not stir , and [she]69-charity concluded that [he]64-mr. royall wished [her]69-charity to think [he]64-mr. royall was asleep . As [she]69-charity continued to watch [him]64-mr. royall ineffable relief stole slowly over [her]69-charity , relaxing [her]69-charity strained nerves and exhausted body . [He]64-mr. royall knew , then ... [he]64-mr. royall knew ... it was because [he]64-mr. royall knew that [he]64-mr. royall had married [her]69-charity , and that [he]64-mr. royall sat there in the darkness to show [her]69-charity [she]69-charity was safe with [him]64-mr. royall . A stir of something deeper than [she]69-charity had ever felt in thinking of [him]64-mr. royall flitted through [her]69-charity tired brain , and cautiously , noiselessly , [she]69-charity let [her]69-charity head sink on the pillow .... When [she]69-charity woke [the room]259-the room was full of morning light , and [her]69-charity first glance showed [her]69-charity that [she]69-charity was alone in [it]259-the room . [She]69-charity got up and dressed , and as [she]69-charity was fastening [her]69-charity dress the door opened , and [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall came in . [He]64-mr. royall looked old and tired in the bright daylight , but [his]64-mr. royall face wore the same expression of grave friendliness that had reassured [her]69-charity on [the Mountain]231-the mountain . It was as if all the dark spirits had gone out of [him]64-mr. royall . [They]1835-they went [downstairs]757-downstairs to [the dining - room]818-the dining - room for breakfast , and after breakfast [he]64-mr. royall told [her]69-charity [he]64-mr. royall had some insurance business to attend to . “ [I]64-mr. royall guess while [I]64-mr. royall 'm doing it [you]69-charity 'd better step out and buy [yourself]69-charity whatever [you]69-charity need . ”[64-mr. royall] [He]64-mr. royall smiled , and added with an embarrassed laugh : “ [You]69-charity know [I]64-mr. royall always wanted [you]69-charity to beat [all the other girls]2067-all the other girls . ”[64-mr. royall] [He]64-mr. royall drew something from [his]64-mr. royall pocket , and pushed it across the table to [her]69-charity ; and [she]69-charity saw that [he]64-mr. royall had given [her]69-charity two twenty - dollar bills . “ If it ai n't enough there 's more where that come from -- [I]64-mr. royall want [you]69-charity to beat 'em all hollow , ”[64-mr. royall] [he]64-mr. royall repeated . [She]69-charity flushed and tried to stammer out [her]69-charity thanks , but [he]64-mr. royall had pushed back [his]64-mr. royall chair and was leading the way out of [the dining - room]818-the dining - room . In [the hall]2255-the hall [he]64-mr. royall paused a minute to say that if it suited [her]69-charity [they]1840-they would take [the three o'clock train]1841-the three o'clock train back to [North Dormer]1-north dormer ; then [he]64-mr. royall took [his]64-mr. royall hat and coat from the rack and went out . A few minutes later [Charity]69-charity went out , too . [She]69-charity had watched to see in what direction [he]64-mr. royall was going , and [she]69-charity took the opposite way and walked quickly down [the main street]920-the main street to [the brick building on [the corner of [Lake Avenue]34-lake avenue]1844-the corner of lake avenue]1843-the brick building on the corner of lake avenue . [The same bushy - headed mulatto girl]1846-the same bushy - headed mulatto girl admitted [her]69-charity , and after the same interval of waiting in [the red plush parlor]1847-the red plush parlor [she]69-charity was once more summoned to [[Dr. Merkle]121-dr. merkle 's office]1848-dr. merkle 's office . [The doctor]1404-the doctor received [her]69-charity without surprise , and led [her]69-charity into [the inner plush sanctuary]1850-the inner plush sanctuary . “ [I]69-charity thought [you]69-charity 'd be back , but [you]69-charity 've come a mite too soon : [I]69-charity told [you]69-charity to be patient and not fret , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity observed , after a pause of penetrating scrutiny . [Charity]69-charity drew the money from [her]69-charity breast . “ [I]69-charity 've come to get [my]69-charity blue brooch , ”[69-charity] [she]69-charity said , flushing . “ [Your]121-dr. merkle brooch ? ”[69-charity] [Dr. Merkle]121-dr. merkle appeared not to remember . “ [My]69-charity , yes -- [I]69-charity get so many things of that kind . But how could [she]69-charity leave [her]69-charity only treasure with [that evil woman]1851-that evil woman ? [She]69-charity wanted it for [[her]69-charity baby]1469-her baby : [she]69-charity meant it , in some mysterious way , to be a link between [[Harney]75-harney 's child]1853-harney 's child and [its unknown father]1854-its unknown father . In [the street]163-the street [she]69-charity stood still , dazed by this last adventure . But the brooch lay in [her]69-charity bosom like a talisman , and [she]69-charity felt a secret lightness of heart . It gave [her]69-charity strength , after a moment , to walk on slowly in the direction of [the post office]1858-the post office , and go in through the swinging doors . At one of the windows [she]69-charity bought a sheet of letter - paper , an envelope and a stamp ; then [she]69-charity sat down at a table and dipped the rusty post office pen in ink . [She]69-charity had come there possessed with a fear which had haunted [her]69-charity ever since [she]69-charity had felt [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's ring on [her]69-charity finger : the fear that [Harney]75-harney might , after all , free [himself]75-harney and come back to [her]69-charity . It was a possibility which had never occurred to [her]69-charity during the dreadful hours after [she]69-charity had received [his]64-mr. royall letter ; only when the decisive step [she]69-charity had taken made longing turn to apprehension did such a contingency seem conceivable . [She]69-charity addressed the envelope , and on the sheet of paper [she]69-charity wrote : [I]0-i 'm married to [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall . [I]0-i 'll always remember [you]64-mr. royall . [CHARITY]69-charity . The last words were not in the least what [she]69-charity had meant to write ; they had flowed from [her]69-charity pen irresistibly . [She]69-charity had not had the strength to complete [her]69-charity sacrifice ; but , after all , what did it matter ? Now that there was no chance of ever seeing [Harney]75-harney again , why should [she]69-charity not tell [him]75-harney the truth ? When [she]69-charity had put the letter in the box [she]69-charity went out into [the busy sunlit street]1859-the busy sunlit street and began to walk to [the hotel]1860-the hotel . Behind the plateglass windows of [the department stores]1861-the department stores [she]69-charity noticed the tempting display of dresses and dress - materials that had fired [her]69-charity imagination on the day when [she]69-charity and [Harney]75-harney had looked in at [them]1861-the department stores together . [They]1861-the department stores reminded [her]69-charity of [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall 's injunction to go out and buy all [she]69-charity needed . [She]69-charity looked down at [her]69-charity shabby dress , and wondered what [she]69-charity should say when [he]75-harney saw [her]69-charity coming back empty - handed . As [she]69-charity drew near [the hotel]1860-the hotel [she]69-charity saw [him]75-harney waiting on [the doorstep]1863-the doorstep , and [her]69-charity heart began to beat with apprehension . [He]75-harney nodded and waved [his]75-harney hand at [her]69-charity approach , and [they]1864-they walked through [the hall]2255-the hall and went [upstairs]424-upstairs to collect [their]1864-they possessions , so that [Mr. Royall]64-mr. royall might give up the key of [the room]259-the room when [they]1864-they went down again for [their]1864-they midday dinner . In [the bedroom]1868-the bedroom , while [she]69-charity was thrusting back into the satchel the few things [she]69-charity had brought away with [her]69-charity , [she]69-charity suddenly felt that [his]75-harney eyes were on [her]69-charity and that [he]75-harney was going to speak . [She]69-charity stood still , [her]69-charity half - folded night - gown in [her]69-charity hand , while the blood rushed up to [her]69-charity drawn cheeks . “ Well , did [you]69-charity rig [yourself]69-charity out handsomely ? [He]75-harney smiled without answering , and [they]1869-they went out of [the room]259-the room together and dropped down to [the hall]2255-the hall in [the glittering lift]1872-the glittering lift . Late that evening , in the cold autumn moonlight , [they]1869-they drove up to the door of [the red house]357-the red house . * * *
